text:
Found this place on Yelp, decided to give it a try. We were a bit wary at first because the place was pretty empty, but we decided to give it a try, and I'm glad we did. 
Our waiter promptly greeted us and went over the menu. 
We ordered a bottle of wine, which was kept chilled at our table, which was nice. My boyfriend and I ordered the porter house for 2, and a couple of sides. Our steak was cooked perfectly, and the truffle spinach was delicious!
Had we had more room, we would have tried dessert, but we were stuffed! Prices are high, but it is a steak house, so that being said, prices are not out of line for the service and quality.

Not a good experience.  Party of 5 lots of errors on the food and drinks.   Steaks and appetizers were over salted.   Old fashion and Moscow Mule cocktails were not made correctly.   Lobster bisque was bland.   Been here several times years ago and enjoyed it immensely.  I hope it returns to its former glory

My group of five recently had a very excellent experience at this fine steak house. Very inviting atmosphere. No one was at a lost for something to look at and talk about. We were promptly seated and had all of our drinks in a few minutes. One of my guests had a sever food allergy which was addresses professional and personally handled by the manager who oversaw that no allergy issues took place. Expert Job Guys! The staff was "Johnny-on-the-spot", nothing went undone, under served or in any way negative to upset the night. I had a crab cake which was about as good as it gets when you consider the distance from the ocean. My main course was a superb cut of perfectly cooked organic chicken with just the right sides. No complaints. 4.99 out of 5. Thanks everyone for a truly amazing time for my guests and I during my birthday dinner.

so my brother and two friends decides to have a nice meal before we go back home. our flight was at 8:25. we sat down to eat at 7:00. we basically finish our entire meal in 30 mins.  

the food was delicious but was in too much of a rush to actually enjoy it.

when your strap for time, its hard to notice anything about the place.  the staff was very accommodating knowing we were in a rush. they got our food out quick.  everyone in our table order what the waiter recommended, 15 oz bone in fillet.  no words can describe this magnificent piece of meat. for apps, we had scallops and caesar salad.  scallops were good but not the salad. i would recommend the tuna tar tar.  had a nice bottle of arrowhead wine to enjoy my meal with.

overall, everything was good, one of the better steak houses in vegas.

I ate here twice in two days!  The first night I ordered the petit filet mignon and it was wonderful. So tender it melted in my mouth. We got sides of baked potato and creamed spinach and I got a Fat Tire Belgian beer. For desert I got the banana tart. All were very delicious. The second night I ordered the baked salmon a mixed green salad and had the warm brownie and a cappuccino for desert. Fantastic! The d√©cor is elegant with beautiful black and white photos of past movie stars in the nude. How beautiful were those untampered, natural breasts!  The price, however is expensive so hopefully you can win enough at black-jack or craps to afford to eat there!

Ate at strip house before show at planet hollywood. It's a steakhouse and among all the other things that made this an excellent experience (service, drinks, sides, atmosphere), it was the steak that was unbelievably fantastic. NY strip done medium. Perfect char and crust. Succulent inside and made me close my eyes with each bite. Going back when i get back to Las Vegas
Was not impressed we came there with a very large party and the food was nothing to write home about. My ny strip had too much pepper and way to much salt the side dishes were nothing special

I use Yelp all the time to find new places to eat, especially when I am out of town. But this is the first time I felt motivated to post a review of my own. My wife and I went to Strip House for our 30th anniversary dinner. We left there feeling like it was one of the best meals we had ever experienced.

First, ask for John to be your waiter. As good as the meal was, John put it over the top. He took time to explain multiple dishes to us, and he went out of his way to make our night very special. My wife even hugged him after dinner, he was that good. Thanks John!

My wife had a basic meal of fillet and baked potato. Both were amazing. The steak was as soft as butter. I had the featured bone-in fillet that had cheese crusted on the top and a balsamic reduction below - amazing! I also took John's recommendation of the gnocchi as a side dish. It had a delicious creamy sauce and shaved truffles on top - awesome!

To top it off, John brought us a slice of 20? layer chocolate cake for dessert (complimentary). It was on a beautiful plate that had "Happy 30th Anniversary" painted in chocolate. It also had a scoop of vanilla gelato. We were stuffed, but we ate about 2/3 of it. It was a delicious end to our meal.

We have been to lots of very fine steak houses. I would put this up against any of them. Pair the great food with the great service and this was one our best dining experiences ever.

I responded back to the strip steak house and gave them a copy of the bill with the date and everything she ask for, and that's about as far as it went. I guess it was my fault I didn't ask for a refund so it is a lesson learned for me.

On my next visit in a few months I will be skipping the strip steak house and going to the buffet at Caesars Palace 5 yum!

Ate here for my husband's birthday. The food was great no doubt. I'm disappointed with the service. We called to change our time which they obliged. We were grateful. When we got there, there was no greeting which they professed they would do and stated that's what they're known for. No greeting. We ate dinner and two tables next to us had birthday greetings. Disappointed to see this and seeing husband see all this. Waiter spoke with a "matter of fact" tone. No warmth. We ordered dessert hoping for redemption. Nothing. I think had there been no call day before dinner stating how they would excitedly greet we would have been fine. Better off not hearing that and just ate they wonderful food. Not good service for a so called fine dining price.
The food was good, drinks a little small, but, delicious!  Service was really good and the bacon appetizer was absolutely amazing.
The manager was the absolute worst. He actually ran from our table when we had a problem. Otherwise the place was great. Hope that you don't have an issue because the manager is scared of customers

Went for a "fancy" dinner while on our honeymoon. Pricey but absolutely delicious, and we had a spectacular waiter who truly added to the experience. Had the calamari for an appetizer which was probably the best we'd ever eaten. Perfectly seasoned. Entrees were perfectly cooked, side dishes were great. All around made for a wonderful night.

NY Strip was so delicious.  The food was worth the money.  Service was fine until the food came.  My son had ordered the 20 oz NY Strip and noticed it was the same size as the rest.  He asked the peron who delivered the food who promptly told him it was the big one.  When waiter who took the order arrived he asked again if it was the 20 oz that he ordered.  No, it was the smaller one.  After that service went down hill.  The waiter took a very long time to come back, check how it was going, if we'd like something else, and even the check.
Food and service were excellent. Would highly recommend the scallops as a starter! Hands down best tasting food we had during our stay in Las Vegas.

OMG...omgoodness this place is crazy, white linen table cloths, sparkling water, flat water, wtf man a little too much for me. The food was very good, tender and tasty, the prices are STeeeP so bring a wod of cash. Any who the service was nice and fast, until we ran out of "flat" bottled water (we didn't know it was a charge) all they said was "what can I get you flat or sparkling water"... For sure we were going for regular water, pipe water lol but flat sounded close then to find out they were like  would like to get another bottle water or regular water and the we were like OMG regular water so is that not flat water...lol. So it was a little confusing but over all we had a great time, except for the fact that everyone else dining there was so serious, we're like damn smile guys, have some fun, don't be so serious!

Outside of the lobster bisque, the food was outstanding! The surf and turf with the filet and lobster were divine. The macaroni and cheese and goose fat potatoes melted in my mouth. OMG!!! Too full for dessert....

Steak was overcooked, appetizer's never came out, and they screwed up my drink.

Have eaten at other Strip House's and this one was by far and away the worst one of the bunch.

Side note...We think that our waiter may have been high on something, but he didn't offer to share...

There is absolutely nothing more annoying than an incompetent hostess to start off your dining experience. We arrived at Strip House right on time for our 6:30pm reservation. The hostess seemed somewhat confused, and not very friendly as we walked up. She said she couldn't find our reservation in her computer, so I showed her the email confirmation from my phone. After a few minutes she finally says, "Oh the online reservation system must have put the wrong date. It does that sometimes."  Yeah right?! We are convinced that the mistake was simply hers and she was looking on the wrong date. Anyway, we got seated quickly after that, hoping that things would get better for the rest of our time at Strip House. 

The dining room is very cool. Dark woods and red, very red, with black and white photos of old time dancers and entertainers. It was a full house the night we went, but it still felt very intimate, still being able to hear our own conversation without screaming at each other. 
 
The service at our table was excellent. Our server was very serious. He maybe cracked a half a smile the entire time we were there. But he was competent, attentive and good at his job. He knew we had tickets to an 8pm show so he made sure our service was prompt.  

The food definitely made up for the mess at the hostess desk. We ordered the bone-in rib eye and the bone-in NY. Both were delicious. One was cooked perfectly (medium well) and the other was slightly less medium well, but still really good. 

Overall, we would definitely have dinner here again! Hopefully, their front of house staff will be better trained.

Came here for my wife's birthday and it was a great experience. Food was perfectly cooked. Amanda was our waitress and she was great, very attentive and did everything to ensure we were taken care of!
Went here for my birthday and the service and food were excellent. We had miso cod, which was to die for! Seriously, I'm still thinking about it and I was there last September.

Excellent meal! Went to celebrate our anniversary and although it's pricey, it was soooo worth it! My husband had the NY strip steak. I really only like filet, but I tried his steak and it was heaven! Melt in your mouth. The crab cake appetizer was awesome too. 

My filet was cooked to perfection and came with lobster. The truffle mac and cheese made the meal. We ordered the 24 layer chocolate cake for dessert and couldn't eat more than a bite...it's pretty rich.

Great meal and service, great ambience too. One of the best meals we have ever had!

The New York cut is amazing. Cooked perfectly. The server was very attentive with whom provided great service. 
A revisit for sure.

I'm a huge fan of steakhouses and sadly this one was not one of the best I've been to. Starting with the menu. All of their steak options were huge unless you wanted the 10 oz. filet mignon. My husband and I split the bone-in NY strip (20 oz) and quite honestly the only thing I could taste was salt. The steak had very little flavor and the sides (baked potato, broccoli) were equally underwhelming. Our server was efficient (although he did make several mistakes), but I wouldn't call him personable or welcoming. On the plus side the pretzel bread they served was very good. We may have just gotten them on an off night, but with all of the other steakhouse options in Vegas I wouldn't go back here.

Took 25 minutes to get seated after arriving with a reservation - there was tables - a confused hostess seem to take forever to seat people.
My Steak was way over salted... had to scrape off salt/seasoning; beans cooked nicely but tons of salt. Wife's Ceasar salad was worse she has ever had. I don't mind paying a premium for good service and food - I absolutely hate paying a premium for crap.

Awesome! The manager was super friendly asked us where we were from and informed us of the other restaurants in our area. He brought out a complimentary appetizer. Our waiter was awesome u just wish I remembered everyone's names. We had a hard time choosing between 2 different steak he recommended the boneless ribeye which was to die for. We loved our appetizers wine sides and dinner. We have been to just about every well known steak house and this was definitely the top of the list. Definitely coming back!

Thank you, John, for making the service as spectacular as the food!!

Our meal at Strip House was the highlight of last month's Vegas trip. I was in town with my friend Matt, celebrating his 30th birthday. The staff at Strip House greeted him with a warm happy birthday and made sure that our handicapped-accessible table was ready and waiting. John expertly explained the specials, and patiently answered all of our questions about the appetizers and entrees. He delivered our food in a timely manner and made the entire evening feel so rewarding. Not only did we get a meal - we got an experience!

We ordered the burrata appetizer, which was absolutely delicious. I considered ordering another, just for my entree. I'm glad that I didn't however, as the aged dry-crusted rib-eye was unbelievable. Much to my family's frustration, I've never been much of a steak person - but this definitely changed my attitude. TJohn sold me on it, based mainly on the process they use to prepare it, and on its salt and black pepper crust.  

The steak was delicious but also so large that I couldn't finish it - well worth the approx. $55. 

My neighbor ordered the lamb t-bones, and thankfully she offered me a bite - they were heavenly, and at $44, a steal. 

The sides are family style, so we ordered the following and shared them:

Potatoes Romanov (a meal in itself, crispy on the outside and deliciously warm and fluffy inside)
Creamed spinach with truffle oil (perfect balance of flavor)
A warm, buttery corn mixture (sorry, can't remember the name)
Macaroni and cheese (a little bland for my taste, but the birthday boy loved it!)

Finally, we ordered Matt a slice of the chocolate cake. I was surprised when John set a plate in front of all 5 of us - turns out, we all enjoyed ONE ENORMOUS slice of this incredibly moist, layered chocolate confection. I chose this restaurant for us based on previous reviews of this cake, and let me tell you - it delivered. 

Overall, AMAZING food, AMAZING staff. My favorite restaurant in Vegas. Can't wait to return!

Top notch classic drinks and first rate service.
Atmosphere fantastic.
Split NY and 3 great sides. Potatoes with green chilies great - wedge just ok.
Steak was Delish.

This is worth going to even with all the steak house options in Vegas
Great meal!!!! Started with the seafood plateau and finished with the filet. They nailed it!

The restaurant is on the top level at Planet Hollywood and not the most well marked location. 

When we entered it took thirty minutes to get a cocktail while waiting for a table. The restaurant was not that busy.

The food: Steaks were average. The lobster was dry. The sides were all overcooked. Sadly my wifes food even had to be sent back. 

overall very disappointing. Would not recommend or return.

So I took the Mrs. out for her birthday to this place. Had no expectations, but I thought it might be crowded so I made reservations. It turned out they weren't needed since the place was mostly empty.

We were greeted warmly and at least three times on our way to the table. This was an indication of the quality of the service: warm, thoughtful, and attentive.

For drinks, I decided on a cocktail. From the specialty menu I ordered a whiskey fig concoction. It came with a thyme sprig. I found it alcoholicky and tart. I couldn't get much of the fig taste. I think I would give that a pass if I dined again there.

We ordered the wedge salad with Stilton cheese. Since we were splitting the appetizer, they helpfully cut it in the back for us. I found it nicely done and the cheese was flavorful. The only point for improvement was that I prefer a wedge a bit colder, but that really is a nitpick. 

For dinner, I had the bone-in cheese encrusted filet and my wife had the lobster rigatoni. My filet al forno was perfectly cooked and cheese was nicely crusted and carmelized. My wife didn't find the rigatoni to her taste, it was a bit too fishy, although properly cooked and just the right amount of sauce.

For a side dish we decided on the asparagus with b√©arnaise, and it was great! Nicely prepared and tasty. Usually I hate asparagus but this one was fantastic.

For dessert we split a banana tart and it was very good as well. We were looking for something a little different and it did not disappoint.

Overall, a great dinner with great service. I'd go there again.

A OK place. Went here for the GF's Bday. I like the decor, dim lit, red/black color scheme with vintage 30's nude pics. I had the filet. It was good. I wouldn't say great or outstanding, but good nevertheless. Our sides were potato puree, which was decent and creamed spinach, skip this. 
The GF ordered a bone-in ribeye. She likes her steak well-done and was disappointed to get her ribeye charred. She sent it back. A manager or supervisor did come over to check on us and inform her that it will be about 30mins. The GF didn't like her FYI tone and decide not to get the steak at all. Then the GM came over to smooth things over and comped us glasses of wine, birthday shots, and the 24 layer chocolate cake. Cake is huge and decent. Nice gesture by the GM. 
Being that I chose this place for the GF's Bday and she had a lousy experience, this place gets a mix review. Overall, I thought it was a decent place, but I may consider other steak houses first.

My husband and I went for valentines day and we were promptly seated. Our server was very friendly but seemed to be confused on our order and brought us the wrong appetizer. We eventually got the crab cake we ordered but the server failed to ever ask how our meal was (which was probably a good thing) 

Appetizer: crab cake was just average, unless of course you were going to compare it to the steak- then it would be great

Main course: We ordered a filet with a scallop and blue cheese topping with a side of mushrooms. We'll start with the good, the scallops were delicious, our medium rare steak was over cooked and dry with far less quality beef you would expect for the price. The mushrooms were so salty we each took one bite and spit them out. 

Dessert: even though neither one of us are chocolate lovers we took servers suggestion for the 20 something layer cake and to our surprise it was actually very good. If you enjoy chocolate that is not overly sweet this would be a good choice.

I'm really conflicted about this place..I expected so much and left with really dry steak pieces still stuck in my teeth.  We went for dinner at 9pm on July 4th and the place was half filled..not a good sign.  Our wait service was alright.  However, we ordered goose fat fries which the waiter forgot or didn't hear my husband when he ordered it.  Nevertheless, we asked about it and it ended up coming during the last part of our meal. 

 Now let me get to the steak.  We ended up sharing a 28 day dry aged rib eye.  On the advice of the waiter, he said to order the steak "medium" with pink in the middle vs "medium-rare" which he said would mean that the steak would still be dark pink and cool in the middle.  BIG MISTAKE!  I don't exaggerate when I say that the steak was TOUGH as cardboard and it had to literally saw through the steak to get a piece off.  Also there is this extremely salty and peppery crust on the steak that added to the dryness to the steak.  Also, the goose fat potatoes were also very dry with a tough crust around it.  Interesting enough, that was also very salty.

The only saving grace is the truffle creamed spinach.  This dish is delicious!

My lasting memory of this place is salty tough steak that was stuck in my teeth on the way back to our hotel...not pleasant.

First off, this place isn't bad.  However, for the price, there are much better options in Vegas on the strip.  Me and the crabby husband dined here the other week before a show.  It's nicely decorated inside but it's LOUD. Seriously, why is it necessary for a place to have music blaring?  I'm dropping a couple hundred dollars and I feel like I'm at a fast food joint with the noise.  I just don't get it. My husband had the free range steak rare and he said it was fine. I had the lobster pasta that was just ok.  It was on the dry side.  Again, for the price there are better options in town. Meh.

First, the atmosphere is very nice.  The service and food were a different experience.  I have been to a lot of steak houses, from very expensive to the chains, and expected much better.  Our group of 6 arrived at 6pm with not many people in the restaurant.  Drink order was taken quick and the food order was shortly there after, but it took 45 minutes to get our dinner.  No special food order and as I said the place was not busy.  I asked the manager, or person in charge, if 45 minutes was a standard wait and he replied - "one of our guest ordered their steak well done so that is what it is".  The response sounded crazy, but it was also delivered with a I really don't care attitude.  The steaks were marginal at best and had to send back the "charred broccoli".  Our bill for two came out to be around $185 - not worth it.  With all the options in Vegas, this place should have done better.  Will not be back.
Excellent service, top notch wine list, and terrific food make this place a great choice!

Well en route to Vegas my wife had a hankering for a good steak house. This place was definitely a good choice. My wife had the surf and turf with a margarita and it was amazing. I had the New York strip and it was made to perfection. The staff (Carlos) was courteous and polite and made our visit pleasant. I would definitely recommend this establishment if you happen to be in the Planet Hollywood Casino area.

Dark and intimate setting great service by Brett S. Pricey but well worth it. Best steak house in Vegas. Lobster was phenomenal. I loved everything about this place. This is going to be a must every time im in Vegas. Loved it.

FIance and I had an amazing experience.  We ordered the following:

-Bottle of Anaba Pinot Noir 
-Spicy tuna tar-tar to begin
-20oz Rib eye for myself (Best rib eye I've ever had, hands down)
-8 oz filet mignon for fiance
-Sauteed wild mushrooms (AMAZING)
-Garlic green beans (Also great)

Brian was our server.  Hope you are lucky enough to get him.  He was awesome!  Great ambiance in the restaurant.  Love the red velvet type setting.  After dinner, we went over to the bar for a little nightcap.  Ordered a glass of 18 year old scotch for myself and some special pomegranate martini for my fiance.  Marc was our bartender, and he was also great.  It was a perfect night for us.  We are definitely coming back!

Good spot for a steak. Sat at the bar, had the 16oz NY strip medium rare, charred broccoli as a side. 

Steak was cooked perfectly, with a heavy seasoned char on the outside and served with homemade steak sauce (which was tasty, but I didn't use it) 

Broccoli was also good.

Close to 5 stars, would definitely eat here again.
food was excellent, great atmosphere, so-so service - not terrible - you just should get more from that type of place

Excellent steak house. The food and service was perfect. I had a bone in filet mignon and it was to die for. i also had a dessert, maybe apple crostada and it was delicious. everything was made to a very high standard. would definetely come back. i had an ice tea in a bottle and it was delicious.

We come here every time we are in Vegas.  We absolutely LOVE this place and our most recent trip there (10/28/14) was made even better by our waiter John. We have been to both NY and Vegas, and Vegas is by far our favorite.  While it is not cheap, we have been very happy every time we have gone and will continue to go there on future trips to Vegas.  Highly recommend.

Inconsistent seemed to be the theme. 

Two  identical steaks ordered, one was half the thickness and the doneness varied, the second was perfect.

Two cocktails ordered, first was good the second looked and tasted like dish water. 

2 espressos ordered, one was acceptable (quantity wise) the second was a film in the bottom of the cup. 

The wait staff seemed to be amused by the disparity in the orders that came to our table. I would definitely never visit again.

My wife and I are in Vegas celebrating her 50th Birthday. I saw the very good Yelp reviews regarding this steakhouse so booked reservations several days ago using Open Table App leaving note regarding special birthday celebration. 

We arrived on time for our 6:30pm reservation they made references to my wife's birthday. (Unfortunately did not mean anything since the restaurant does not comp birthday desserts).  So far everything is going well and were seated then ordered our meal. 

We started with the Mixed Field Greens which we shared and had an adequate portion for the both of us. The Sherry vinaigrette was good. 

The Main Entree meal we ordered was the Porter House Steak for two. My wife and I agreed this was the best steak we've ever eaten. 

We ordered the Potato Romanoff as a side dish along with Garlic Saut√©ed Green Beans. These two sides were outstanding with twice baked gratin potatoes and the perfectly saut√©ed crisp green beans in olive oil and garlic. 

Also ordered the Lobster Thermador in which the lobster that was placed back into the shell then baked again was pretty tough. I did enjoy the claws on top which were fried in a tempura batter. Advised the waiter regarding the toughness of the lobster meat but he basically ignored me and evidently did not inform management since he did not remove from my bill or make any attempt to deal with the issue. I've been to many restaurants that will remove a bad portion of a meal off the bill or workout an equitable arrangement that resolved the issue. Didn't want to cause a scene on my wife's birthday. I would normally handle these issues more vigorously if not initially heard since I'm paying for a service and want the best in return. 

Dessert we ordered was the Carmelized Banana Tart which was very delicious. Of course they did not comp the dessert for her birthday but in light of the the lobster issue should have been done. 

Overall the food was very good except the lobster. Disappointed they did not reach out to resolve this issue in a fair and equitable way. Hope management reads this review and contacts me to resolve this issue. I still tipped the waiter appropriately even though he did not handle my concerns properly. Only gave 3 Stars should have been 5 Star but when a business doesn't not listen their customers concerns and ignores them leaves no choice.

Amazing - the service, the food, and the atmosphere. I had a medium rare 21oz Bone in Rib eye which was cooked to perfection. The service was excellent as the staff was very prompt and friendly. The 24 layer chocolate cake they're famous for is also worth trying. All in all, a bit on the pricey side, but it's worth it.

We were a little apprehensive going to this restaurant but it was where our show for the night was. This was one of the best restaurant experiences we have had in months. We got their right when it opened so we could make the show on time.  We started off with some garlic bread with a gorgonzola fondue sauce that sent my taste buds into another dimension.  My wife had the lamb chops and I had the surf and turf. Finally a restaurant that doesn't bring the lobster out in or on the shell. Both entrees were amazing and that is truly an understatement. Kept the gorgonzola fondue as a dipping sauce for the filet as opposed to bleu cheese and it was a great accompaniment. The gourmet macaroni and cheese was also unbelievable. If you haven't been there go!!!!!  Service was outstanding but I forgot his name. Top five restaurants in Vegas.

Food: Bread, Casear Salad, & Filet Mignon 
Taste: Phenomenal
Beverage: Blue Moon w/ Orange 
Atmosphere: Classy, 1920s vibe
Dress code: Business/Business Casual
Price: Bread - Free, Salad - $14, Steak - $54, Beer - $7
Cleanliness: Perfectly clean reataurant and staff
Staff/Service: Highly attentive 
Reservations: Had a reservation for 8pm for 7 people.  Weren't seated until 8:15pm.

Our table had the filet which was excellent and the salmon which was really good.  My boring salad was very good also.  Service was top notch and the filet was perfectly cooked.  Overall great experience.

This place never fails. Service is phenomenal and the food is flawless. Marc at the bar is always attentive and never lacks conversation. 
The tuna tartar is my favorite in town...just the right amount of spice and texture with the cucumber wrap. 
Also (and I realize this is petty but I'm particular) the pretzel rolls are ridiculously good. 
Can't go wrong here.

My wife and I visited again this past week and couldn't wait to make a trip back to Strip House. We asked for John S. again as our service on our 1st visit as I mentioned was amazing.This 2nd time was no different. We both had the NY Strip steaks again and they were excellent!! Although we ordered our steaks well-done, they still packed alot of flavor and were very juicy. The crust over the steak was perfect and the accompanying garlic cloves with each bite made for a very flavorful bite each time.

We both had caesar salads to begin with which even something as small as a salad taste great. I had the garlic herb fries and my wife a baked potato.

Of course we had the 24-layer chocolate cake again and couldn't finish it between the both of us. I'm not really a sweets or cake lover, but I always enjoy that cake. 

The entire meal was great and John was on top of every detail throughout our dinner, as always. Not sure of our next trip back to Vegas, but when we do we will keep requesting for John. Thanks again and see you guys again hopefully very soon.

A definite must try and visit, well worth the money.

The food was delicious! I had an excellent waiter, Billy, that was very knowledgeable about every dish. Not to mention very handsome! Timing on food was great. I had the surf n'turf and it was done just the way I wanted it. Bartender Mark was very nice and made my friends and I feel right at home when we grabbed a drink before we headed to our table. Loved the atmosphere and had a great time with my coworkers. I will definitely come back!

This week, we took my friend out to the Strip House for his birthday. The only thing that matched the high quality of the steak we ate was the waitress we had, Crystal. She was so polite and gave such great recommendations from the menu to enhance our dinner. She was so genuinely nice and even surprised us with a delicious chocolate cake dessert for the birthday boy. Her amazing personality combined with the deliciousness of the food made this birthday celebration one we will never forget!

Literally the BEST steak I have ever had! I really believe I will never find another steak that can beat this place. You have to go and try this place!

What makes this place even better was the customer service. We showed up and explained to the server that we had tickets for a show and only had 40 mins until it started and asked if this was a possibility? She said no problem and we will make sure it happens with a assuring wink. 

Truth be truth. We got our food which was steak and the others got salmon faster then any other place I had ever been to. Very sweet server who got a huge tip and a large thank you.

Now the steak was so large that I shared multiple bites with others and everyone wished they had got the steak. Even after sharing I still had so much steak that I was stuffed. Thickest, juciest steak ever! 

Order the steak!!! Don't doubt but order this amazing steak! It is a must go to place people. Go!!!

Drinks were amazing too and the theme is not for children but adults only. The lights inside were perfect and great for close friends, spouses, or relationships.

Why are you reading this? Go already!

The server messed up our order,steak was overcooked,sat a very large party right next to us even though the dining room was 2/3 empty.After finishing dinner the party was still arriving and literally surrounding our table we decided to take the rest of our wine to the bar(the whole time no sign of our server).Told the hostess we were stepping out for a smoke,came in 5 min later and two full glasses of wine r gone.Ask to talk to the manager, she sneakily shows up with 2 glasses saying they were just moved into the back.Clearly not the same glasses,no lipstick,and not the same wine(more like there house pour).Finally came out with a 1/2 bottle, 2 years greener,still no apology.Server finally shows with check,even charged 4 the espresso, YUCK
I'm not a big meat eater but had the bet filet I have has in forever. And the black truffle creamed spinach is a must! Our servers Ryan and Kasey were also an absolute treat! Thanks guys!!
I have been to the Strip House twice and found it to be exceptional both times.  The portions are quite sizable, so both times we shared meals. The Potatoes Romanoff are to die for!

Ate at the Strip House for the 2nd time in 2 years and the service still goes above and beyond. We were a huge pain in the ass when it came to ordering (we had some special requests) the chef accommodated us perfectly.  The food was excellent and so was David!!  They also have a great wine list. We will be back again next year!

We were a bit disappointed that we were unable to get a reservation to Gordon Ramsey's so we settled for the Strip House.  As far as steakhouses go in Vegas, this place was really a lot better than I expected. We had reservations on Memorial Day around 5pm and there weren't many other people in the joint at that time, which made it feel very personal.  

We ordered the scallops for an appetizer and they were cooked perfectly. I did not try any of the bread selections as I am gluten free but the pretzel looked very inviting.  

For the meal, I had the aged Ribeye and sauteed mushrooms. My buddy had the 12oz Filet and steamed broccoli. The steaks were seasoned and cooked perfectly. The only real suggestion that I have for them would be to add creamed spinach, but that all depends on whether or not you enjoy it. 

The service was great, they were always there to refill our waters and etc. 

The price was a bit high  but then again it is Vegas and a up-scale steakhouse.  

Overall I thought the place was very solid and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a steak in Planet Hollywood.
Best steak house ever! Really, they have the most flavorful and delicious steaks imaginable!. Just about every time we are in town we eat here. You will not be disappointed.... Enjoy!
This place was incredible. Group of 4. We were all blown away with every bit of our meals. Went to Olives the next night. It was great but did not even compare to the Striphouse

Do not be scared off by the name or anticipated ambiance. The Strip House is extremely tastefully decorated with a unique atmosphere. More important, it is the best char on a steak I've ever had. Been here twice and they haven't disappointed. Their steak is prepared in special ovens with a perfect salt and pepper mixture that gives it a perfect combination of char and flavor that makes it easily among the best steaks I've ever tasted.
Food was incredible, drinks were incredible, our server Scott was incredible. Overall great experience - very glad we found this place!!

My husband and I booked this restaurant for our wedding anniversary dinner after our vow renewal at the Aria.   Everyone loved the food.   And we couldn't beat the price for group dining.   If you are looking for a dinner reception or a small private dinner this is definitely the place.
The truffle creamed spinach was awesome!!  I got the tuna (I know, at a steak house) and it was ok.  Husband liked his steak but preferred Delmonico's for the same price.  Overall, the food was ok.
Great food and service. It was loud the evening we went in because a busy conference was in the hotel. All and all, worth the money

YUM! To our surprise there were actually some boutique Napa wineries on their wine list! The truffle creamed spinach with pork fat back was amazing! The steaks were cooked perfectly to order and the giant chocolate cake lasted us several days!

Came here for a bachelor party after researching many of the strip's steakhouses. Happy to say that we made an excellent choice coming here. The staff was incredibly helpful in setting us up, even customizing the printed pre-fixe menu for us before our arrival. The service was fantastic, as was the food. Oddly enough, the entrees were perhaps overshadowed by the fantastic sides that came with our meal - the creamed spinach, specifically, garnered rave reviews from the group - including many folks known for their meat-eating prowess, not spinach. The vibe was classy, but fun - perfect for our event. Highly recommend this spot.
One of the finer steakhouses on the strip, out of the way in the Planet Hollywood Casino. Superb service and really great food

We lived down the street from the original in Manhattan and ate there many times, before and after the purchase by B.R. Guest. While the steaks remain fantastic, many of the little things that gave the restaurant its charm -- both in New York and Vegas -- have changed for the worse.

One obvious example is the Gorgonzola fondue. This was once the ultimate side item pleasure in the restaurant -- a cheap thrill, if you will, both on its own and as a decadent "dip" for your steak. (The servers and bartenders would ask if you wanted to keep it around, and recommend you do so.) You can still see the fondue mentioned prominently as a feature on the Yelp and TA reviews. Alas, it's a victim of corporate menu-engineering. Too cheap, even as it was a word of mouth item that gave Strip House its wry reputation.

Like the fondue, other minor things have changed that once gave Strip House its own unique charm. The lights? A little brighter. (You'll eat faster and order more.) The music? A little louder and BPMs a little higher. (You'll eat faster and order more.) The service? A little more... perfunctory, even while front-of-house staff remains on the whole talented, warm, and hard-working.

If these sound like nitpicks, they certainly are. But hunks of prime meat in a broiler are a commodity unless infused with some charm. And as Strip House is stripped of its own, it becomes just another very good steak house on par with many others -- that was once something great.

We went there late Sunday. The food was good. Our server's name is LESLIE B. and she was awful!!  Took forever to come back for us to order. It was late, only two other tables were there. For like a whole 15 minutes we had no idea where she went. 

Later we asked if they do anything for birthdays, she told us about this dessert but seem very annoyed by it. 

We asked for our CHECKS she brought one back. When we asked her to split it. She doesn't even remember what we ordered and made a face to us. 

The food was good but the service SUCKED!! You would think they have better service when they want to charge you 200 for 2 a meal? Totally not worth the experience.

Our family came here in the late evening for dinner after our early afternoon wedding.  We have a 13 year old child who is severely allergic to milk, eggs and beef. He is very rarely allowed to eat anything from any restaurant, as every utensil must be thoroughly cleaned, hands cleaned prior to cooking his food, after touching other foods, and distance kept between items is also a must, or something horrible could happen.
We asked to speak to the chef, and he promptly came out to discuss our concerns. He was very thorough, asked what he was allergic to, and helped us choose the perfect dish for our son. He assured us that he takes food allergies very seriously, and even had a separate area to prepare his food. He was able to safely eat the squash, with a huge main dish of chicken.
We ordered the steak and lobster, asparagus, and potatoes....Let me tell you, the food was out of this world fantastic! The potatoes had the most amazing flavor,  the lobster was superb, and I have never had more fresh, wonderful tasting asparagus in my life! The steak was also fabulous! By far our favorite was the potatoes. 
The fact that our son could be included in enjoying a delicious meal with our family made everything perfect for all of us. If you go late at night,  put blindfolds on your kids when you walk through the casino if you're worried about risqu√© attire, or perhaps go in the afternoon (we learned the hard way lol.) 
This is definitely a restaurant worth the price, and we will be going there first if we go back to Las Vegas. If you read these, thank you chef! Compliments from our family to you!

Strip House was a great splurge for a girl's night out! They have an X-rated Martini that will knock your socks off! The NY strip was perfect with their Garlic-Herb fries and Black Truffle Creamed Spinach. Sorry to say there was no room for dessert, but I would imagine it would be fantastic!

This is my top two restaurants in Vegas next to NoBu. Their calamari is super bomb. I always get the usual filet mignon is one of the best Ive ever had. The restaurant itself is super nice and red all over. The service was pretty good. Server was nice and respectful. Definitely recommend if looking for a great steak place.

It's been a long time since I've actually finished a steak on my own, I usually have a friend who ends up finishing it up for me. Not tonight! I ordered the bone in New York Strip medium rare and it was perfect. IT was so flavorful, juicy and tender I almost couldn't believe it. 

I think I might have to change my last meal on earth to be the steak at the Strip House.... Well at least this time around.

Although the food was delicious, we had some issues with customer service. We ordered a $70 bottle of wine. Pointed to it on the menu. When the bill came the bottle of wine we got was $115. We said we had an issue with the bill to our server he promptly sluffed us off to the manager who was bent on proving us wrong. She brought the bill along with the menu to show us what we received which was NOT the wine we ordered. We were adamant that we ordered a different wine by the same name which was less expensive. She wouldn't budge. Even after several times stating we did not order the more expensive variety she still would not budge. She ended up comping a drink but that did not nearly cover the almost $40 difference between the bottle we ordered and the bottle we received. Definitely feel as though it is the server's responsibility to clarify which bottle you are ordering if there are multiple bottles of the same brand. Left very frustrated.

I was super excited to try this restaurant based on the reviews. 
Unfortunately the service staff ruined the experience. 
The hostess refused to give us silverware for our dessert that we got to go. 
I asked if I could have a fork and she rudely told me to call room service... 
I had to ask for a manager and he came out in a huff and handed me a fork. I let him know I would make sure I would leave it in the room... He replied the hotel (planet Hollywood) would steal it..  
Make sure you come prepared with your own silverware.. 
3/29/2015 Las Vegas

During my most recent Girls-Night-Out weekend in Vegas, I wanted to take my friends to Strip House because I had fell in love with the one in NYC. I now have mixed feelings. I am a steak lover. I have pretty much checked out the most popular steak restaurants and thought the steak at NYC Strip House was by far, top 3. The steak in LV was a bit tough for me (I ordered medium rare). The mac and cheese was too cheesy and a bit bland. The cream spinach side was way too salty. My pinot noir was great. My gf loved her lobster pasta (it was pretty good). The overall ambiance is nice, but our waiter lacked personality. He was so serious! Unfortunately, I'd rather go to S&W because the sides there are way better and the people are more down to Earth.

We ate here on Wednesday night and it was really really really good!  I'm so glad we came here!

For starters we had the crab cake and it was pretty big and very good!  It was a very good appetizer.

For entrees I had the veal shank and it was delicious.  It was cooked perfectly.  

My boyfriend had the salmon and he liked it.  I don't like salmon, but he said it was delicious.

For sides we had the truffled mac and cheese and it was SO GOOD!!!!! OMG!!!!! 

We also got steamed asparagus and a side of Bearnaise sauce to dip it in.  Super yum!

For dessert we got the creme brulee and it was just okay.

I would have given this place five stars but we ordered a bottle of wine with a 2008 vintage and they brought out a 2009 instead.  When we called them out on it, they said they just got the shipment in that day and didn't have time reprint the menus.  I don't believe them.

Other than that, everything was great and I know that some people yelped badly about the waitstaff taking a long time, but when you go to a super fancy place it is standard for service to be slow so you have time to drink your wine and enjoy your food.  This isn't  "In-N-Out Burger" you know.

If you are in a hurry, this is the place to go. If you want to enjoy the 2-person $300 meal you are eating, this isn't the place to go.

Our main course came before we had even finished our before dinner drinks, and before that-our soup came before we had even ordered our wine.  

I don't know about you, but when I am spending this much on food, I expect the waiters to know how to "time" the courses better.

I called the General Manager to let him know about this, and he didn't seem to care.  Hmmmm, seems par for the course.

Much better places to go in Vegas......spend your money elsewhere.

Being a native New Yorker and having the ability to travel for work  I am fortunate enough to experience fine dining on many different levels.  One of my favorite places to eat when home is the Strip House downtown.  I love the decor and the illusion of stepping back in time with the velvet walls and vintage photos  I did not want to ruin that experience by experimenting with Strip House Las Vegas.  

We decided to gamble and give it try in the hopes that it would not be an over the top glitzy Vegas version of a place we love so much. On first approach, I could see flat screen TV and my heart sank.  I was pleased to see that they were just in the bar area and not viewable from the dining area.  Our hostess was very gracious, asked us where we were from, made pleasant small talk and sat us at a booth.  

We were greeted by our server John.  It was obvious that he has been in the service industry for many years because he was courtesy and knowledgeable not only of the menu but had committed the specials to memory.   He described each dish with his own personal experience and interpretation of what the chef was attempting to do.

John had suggested a bottle of wine which I would not usually lean towards...but the gamble was paying off already so we went with it and it was an excellent choice.  I usually don't order the specials because I am very particular about what I want and go to the places where I know it would be perfect.

In this case, John had beautifully described a bone in Filet Mignon with parmesan crust sitting atop a balsamic reduction.  The steak arrived and it was cooked to perfection and as complex and delicious as he had described.  

During the meal the manager came to the table and we explained that our dining experience to that point had been excellent because of the attention to detail and prompt service of the wait staff especially our server.  

John suggested and provided at the end of the meal a banana and caramel dessert which was not something I would order but proved to be outstanding.  

All in all our beloved NYC Strip House experience will be enhanced knowing that each time we travel to Vegas there is a home away from home with the same quality of service and five star dining.  Well done Vegas............NYC should be proud!

Wife and I had an incredible meal here.  Started with the oysters then steak and lamb with saut√©ed mushrooms and creamed spinach.  Service was excellent but the steak was outstanding.  The crust on the steak was fantastic.  Watched a group of four friends at the table next to us have the same experience - but with cake.  

Will certainly return when back in Vegas.

Great job Strip House.

A great place for a great dinner! The costumer service was outstanding. While being seated they asked if we were attending a nearby concert which we were and assured us that our food would be put in in a timely manner for us to enjoy our meal and still make it to our event. Which it was with plenty of time to eat without feeling rushed. The filet mignon was seasoned well although it was slightly overcooked and a bit dry. We ordered fries as a side and they were cooked to perfection. While the decor is not family friendly it is done very tastefully and I don't believe would be of putting to people who are less comfortable with nudity. I would highly recommend eating here if you don't mind paying a higher price for a good steakhouse.
The atmosphere and food were great, the service was amazing. The sides are big enough to share and after an appetizer you could easily just split the main entree.

Oh my goodness, this place was amazing!! It is expensive (Think El Gaucho), but definitely worth it! 

I had the 8 oz filet, my husband had the filet and lobster special, we split a salad and a potato side. The  seasonal cosmopolitan that the server recommended was excellent. My favorites were the Strip House Potatoes (twice baked potato gratin) and the Ginger Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e. 

Make a reservation through Yelp, it will save you some time :-)

It was my first trip to Strip House, but the food was phenomenal. Our table ordered two appetizers, both of which were delicious, and I personally ordered a 12oz filet mignon -- more than I could handle, but it was equally as delicious. To top it all off, our service was completely up to par with the food. Our waitress, Sarah, was highly attentive and attuned to our needs as customers. 

My steak had come to the table burned, but after I told them, they immediately offered to rectify the problem. Sarah, their general manager Gabe, and a couple other staff members stopped by to apologize and ensure that everything would be taken care of. They even gave us an additional bottle and asparagus appetizer on the house! 

I had a great experience at Strip House and, despite the snafu with my entree, I still highly recommend it.

This place has to be the worst steak house in all of Las Vegas in terms of food quality.  The steak was tough with no marbling.  I ordered a salad and got these three massive strips of bacon with a couple of pieces of lettuce.  Some of the things sounded good but they just weren't.

Our meal was comped and to steal a line from my boss "it aint worth free"...and truly it wasn't.

In fairness, the vibe is good and the waiter was very nice.

Excellent steakhouse, if what you're in the mood for is a great steak this place checks all the boxes. It's much nicer lookin in person than the pics online, although it's in a bit of an odd location and was pretty empty on the evening we were there. Nice and quiet surroundings for my wife and I to have a nice meal and celebrate our anniversary. 
I had the dry aged rib eye and it was excellent and at only 14 ounces not overwhelming like so many other steakhouses. They do use a pretty aggressive char and the meat is well-seasoned which I enjoyed but if that's not your thing keep it in mind. We had charred broccoli as our side and my wife had a salad and lobster bisque, both of which were great. I won't say anything here blew us away but a steakhouse is expensive comfort food and this place surely provides that. Enjoy!

My friends and I have been to most of the steak houses on the strip.  This one will be on our short list of places to return to again.  Service was excellent.  The pace of the meal was quite good.  Quality and preparation of the food was fine.  Only complaints - background music was a bit too loud, and the wine list is a bit pricey.  Otherwise no complaints.

Got a ribeye here, wife got a lobster pasta... both were really good, but man was that steak good.  I mean REALLY good.  Salt and pepper only for seasoning, cooked to perfection, but they didn't use a "spicy" black pepper, it was more savory.  Super good.  They also had a twice baked potato equivalent that had green chilies in it and it was EXCELLENT.  Potatoes were whipped well, well spiced, spicy but not burning stupid hot.  Wonderful overall ambiance and had excellent service from start to finish.  Waiters were attentive and really explained their steak process and the seasoning.  Would return in an instant!

Our plane had a 9 hour delay because of mechanical issues and we slept in the airport waiting for our flight, so we were tired and hungry when we arrived at Strip.  Though we were underdressed it was no problem.  The service was excellent!  So friendly and attentive!

Husband had dry-aged Ribeye, I had lamb chops, daughter had salmon, and son also had Ribeye.  We also have a 1.5 year old toddler and the restaurant, while not kid-friendly (restaurant is for adults, no kids menus or items) was very accommodating.  Food was great!  Husband said his steak was a little on the salty side, but he still enjoyed it.  Wine was really good, the sides were amazing--potatoes romanoff, goose fat potatoes, and sauteed mushrooms were all equally great!  Even bread basket was good--pretzel bread was so delicious!  Our toddler only wanted to eat the bread!  Oh and the dessert!  Daughter had the multi-layer chocolate cake--it was huge and soooooo good!  

The only thing I didn't understand was my husband had what looked like a head of roasted garlic on his plate with a rosemary sprig in it (you can see it in other reviewers photos) I think it was for decoration because the garlic wasn't roasted enough and I am not sure what he was supposed to do with a sprig of rosemary...so decoration i think, but not edible one. 

We would definitely come back again!  Thank you Strip for taking in these weary travelers!

YUM! 

The hubs took me here on Friday night. 

LOCATION: Mezzanine of Planet Hollywood, next to Koi.
DECOR: Very cool, vintage-inspired, lots of creepy/cool boudoir-type photos.
SEATING: Wtf - no booths? Seriously, all they have are those half-table, half-booth deals where one person gets shafted because they have to sit in a chair while you relax in a booth.
SERVICE: Pretty great. Water was refilled frequently, food came out in reasonable increments, etc. 

Now what you really want to know...
BREAD: Pretzel bread, sesame roll and regular roll type deal. Pretzel bread was the best. Whipped butter was good too. 
SHOTS: They gave us these shots of potato soup with an herbal garnish. Yum. I could've had 5 more of those. Would've ordered a bowl if it was on the  menu.
STEAKS: Two Filet Mignons. I ordered mine medium, but it looked more like medium well. Still it was soft and flavorful, so no real complaints. BUT! - if you don't love black pepper, tell them to go easy on it. I love it so it was fine, but the steak really had a bite to it.
SIDES: Mac and cheese and garlic fries. For $10-$12 each I was expecting bigger portions and fancier presentation. The fries were just OK, kind of reminded me of Nathan's for some reason. Mac n cheese was good, very thick and creamy. 
DESSERT: Skipped it. 
DRINKS: Had a Cosmopolitan which was OK but nothing to write home about.

THE VERDICT: Great place to take a date, and yummy food. Quite pricey at $40+ per steak and $10+ per side. For that price the food basically meets expectations but doesn't quite exceed them.

I was really impressed by my dinner here.

I'll cut straight to the beef: Got the bone-in ribeye and they nailed it. Great unique-flavored char on the outside and cooked to a juicy medium rare. 

Normally sides dishes can be throwaways but I liked all 3 we got: wild mushrooms, green beans and the Strip House potatoes (definitely get these)!

We got there kind of late, so by the time dessert rolled around we were the last people there. We decided against it, but the staff never made us feel rushed at all.

Chris Rosen is the bestest best server. His pairings are on point and service is unpretentious and spectacular. Ask for him. Every table in this restaurant is full and for a good reason. Do your taste buds a favor.

First off I have to say, be forewarned that this place will cost you an arm and a leg, but the good news is it's well worth it.  I cannot honestly say that I had the best filet mignon of my life here, but it was definitely up there in the top 5.  But their creamed spinach with truffles...my goodness.  The spinach was absolutely to die for!  It is a must if you go there.  We had the goose fat potato, but that was just ok for me. We also shared the bib salad, which was also quite good. 

We also tried the house chocolate cake, and I have to say that I was quite impressed.  We boxed most of it, seeing that it is a 24 layer chocolate cake, but it was well worth it.  We ate off of it for the next 3 days.  It was not too sweet, and the cake was moist, delish!

The service was also impeccable.  Our server definitely deserved his tip.  I guess the service should be amazing when you're dropping that amount of money.  But I definitely recommend this restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

Our waiter Scott was the best.  He offered up the special and we ordered that.    It's like he knew exactly what we wanted even through we hadn't dined there before.  Service was impeccable and we will be going back again.    We had just the right amount for us to really enjoy our meal.  Not rushed at all, yet attentive.  Good time, great service and super food.
Lindaaa :). She's awesome, everyone here is awesome. I just came back 2nd time since last week bc it's delicious. It's my favorite restaurant you should try it.
One of the best steaks I have ever had! Headed her before the brittney show a few months back. With all the steak houses on the strip, it's hard to decide which one to chose! Strip won't upset you!

Been coming to Strip House for a few years now off and on when I'm in Vegas. As always, the service is great and the food is quality. Great wine and drink selection. The atmosphere is warm, yet private. I'll continue to come back here.

We only came in for the Gorgonzola fondue with garlic bread, and we were so pleased.

Not only was the cheese amazing, but so was the bread. I literally don't think I'll ever go to Vegas again without hitting this spot. The only thing I'd do differently is to order two!

Wait staff was amazing. Best service I've ever had. My date and I ate here before the Britney show and had a great time. I had the calamari and filet mignon. Delicious. Tried the Moscow mule for the first time ever. Enjoyed it. Would definitely come back if I visit Vegas again.

My 'experience': twice visited, second was for the layered chocolate cake

We went here as a last resort since every "upscale" restaurant closed by the time we were able to eat. With great surprise, this place had amazing strip stake- which he got NY style. We shared an order of the creamy spinach (simply because I am not a fan of thick-heavy creaminess), I had the salmon steak which was amazing. It had a nice pan seared crust! yum. Then we conquered the I think 15 or 25 layered chocolate cake. 

This cake was amazing since it wasn't overly sweet. The icing melts in your mouth! Def try it.

Went to this gem with two complete Carnivors. I myself am vegan and was surprised when the waitress told me she would have the chef make me a vegan plate!! Then the chef came out and introduced himself and told me exactly what he would prepare for me. The food was amazing for both vegans and meat eaters! The service was fantastic. Our waitress was Sarah. She, as my husband kept telling her, was amazing!!!

My husband and I dined here Sunday evening. Strip House has a sexy classic steakhouse feel. We were seated in the corner booth with our backs to the bar. The restaurant had seven parties dining and we were all crammed toward the front of the restaurant - I never understand why that is. Service was terribly slow to start. It had us concerned, but thankfully once the large group beside us was served it improved. Our waiter was attentive the rest of the meal.

We snacked on bread while we looked over the menu. After making our selections, we were brought an amuse bouche of potato soup. It was smooth as silk, but it had the starchy potato taste. It puzzled my palette... in a good way.

We had a crab cake to start. It was nicely presented, with lots of crab - it'd better at $17. It was pretty good, but I prefer them spicy. My husband had the rack of lamb and I had the filet, we shared a side of their Romanoff potatoes. The steak and lamb were both very good, juicy and tender with a nice crust. The chops were the second best we've had. Aureole remains at the top. Frank enjoyed the potatoes, but they were too sour for my liking.

We skipped dessert. We were pleasantly full. The check came to $125 before tip. It was a fine meal, but spendy. Still, I'm glad we gave it a try.

Photos were added.
Really wasn't impressed. Completely forgettable filet.

The Strip House in PH was our second stop for steak during a week long golf holiday. After a poor experience at Gordon Ramsay's Steak in the Paris we were a bit hesitant. 

Our table decided on the Surf & Turf x 2 as well as the Porterhouse for 2. Sides were the mushrooms, mac and cheese and asparagus. Dessert - the 12 layer cake and Baked Alaska. 

Service was excellent, prompt and attentive. Carlos, was also knowledgable in what we were looking for in a good wine. The food was delicious and not too overly priced (unfortunately most places in Vegas are). The Porterhouse was excellent as well as the sides with the exception of the asparagus which was quite bland. The lobster was cooked very well and proved to be deliciously tender. 

Dessert was tasty and devoured by the table. Lastly, cocktails were well made and refreshing.

All in all, an excellent meal with excellent service. Definitely recommended.

Went there last night and let me tell you...worst customer service I have ever ran across in my entire life. Don't get me wrong, the food was great. But the experience of dining in there was totally unacceptable. I am not sure if they took me seriously because I am 23 years old, but the servers don't know I run three of my own businesses. So next time, please don't judge a book by it's cover. Would've spent a lot more money, but unfortunately the environment was not where I want to be again.

Came to Vegas for a mini vacation staying at Planet Hollywood!  This is by far the best steak house I have been to in Vegas and our waiter Brian was awesome. He introduced my boyfriend and I to a drink called a Full Moon.  Love it.   Thanks Brian your awesome

You will have a much better time throwing a couple hundred of your hard earned dollars into a trash bucket on the front porch, dousing it in lighter fluid, and lighting it on fire than eating here! The net result is the same and it will be warmer!

First of all, they ask for your CREDIT CARD to place a reservation for four people. I asked why and they said they would charge me if I didn't show up. Okay. So have a fake credit card handy when you call. In my case I "messed up" some numbers and they never said anything about it. 

We get there and the place is fricken freezing and empty. Glad they would have charged me for ditching a table when I would have been preventing absolutely no one from using it had we not shown. 

The waitress was frigid. I don't know if it was the extreme cold (it was seriously unbearable in there), her first day, or just her marching orders (be as stern and unapproachable as possible- and above all: no fun), or perhaps she was just having a bad day... But she was not in the mood for any bullshit. You will order. You will eat. You will die. Not necessarily in that order. 

Food was okay at best, cold when it came out (I wonder why??). Plus, the food is outrageously expensive and you get very little of it. Any review you read about "my meat was cooked to perfection." Get over it, I cook my steaks to perfection on a $99 grill every time at home too so we're not exactly curing cancer over here. 

A lot of people confuse pretentiousness with good food, and I found the whole atmosphere to be misleading. You're at planet hollywood, on the strip in Vegas, and here you have a restaurant with a silly name taking itself way too seriously.

Unbelievable. John was an excellent server. You could jot ask more from him.  Always attentive and helpful.  Prosciutto appetizer had great flavors from the salty to the power of both goat cheese and balsamic. Followed by the most tender bone - in filet with a special cheese and sause that you cut with a knife. Overall, it was the best experience I have had in a while.

Outstanding steak House.  Not only was the steak cooked to perfection, the truffle creamed spinach, twice baked potatoes, and 27 layer chocolate cake was to die for.  The only reason I am giving it a four star rating was the wait time after appetizer was way too long at 40 minutes, even though it was a large group.  Highly recommend. Better than Mortons and many of the other Steak Houses I've eaten

Absolutely the slowest service we have ever experienced. There was a nice waitress that greeted us but then we never saw her again. An apology from anyone would have sufficed but they forgot about us although we were in plain sight. The steak was overcooked, the steak I made tonight that I bought from Smiths was so much better sadly. Horrible food, weak drinks and the absolute worst steakhouse I've been to. What waste of my hard earned money.
Their 24 layer cake is the one for me. I want to marry it in a nearby las vegas chapel if I could.

We hosted a dinner for a dozen people. Limited menu with pre-ordered appetizers and dessert. 

It started off well, but it all went off the rails. The food was good but our waiter just disappeared. I don't know if the fact that some sports celebs came in and the entire staff suddenly seemed to be rushing around to make them happy had anything to do with the extremely poor service. We needed to have the dinner last a hour and a half, but when we reached the two and a half our mark, we were done. They never even got around to taking coffee and after dinner drink orders. We had to hunt the waiter down to get the check. 

We host dinners often and never had an experience like this anywhere else. And the restaurant was only 2/3 full during our dinner, so it wasn't that they were overwhelmed in the kitchen.    

We will not be going back

Let me first say this, you will not be disappointed!  The ambiance is perfect with the lighting and choice of color and decor..  We had the pleasure of meeting Scott who was outstanding!  Scott welcomed us and immediately engaged in conversation and assured us he would take care of us for the evening.  Scott went over the menu and the specials for the evening as well as his recommendations.   The goat cheese prosciutto rolls were amazing!  The dry aged rib eye was cooked to perfection.. a nice charred exterior while maintaining a medium rare throughout every bite.  The salmon prepared medium was spot on.  As Scott promised we would not be disappointed with the truffle cream spinach as well as the whipped potato pur√©e... delicious!!  
If ever given the chance to dine here..  do not pass on it!  The entire staff is amazing!!  If you are fortunate maybe Scott will be there to make it a great experience for you as well.

I had dinner at 3 high end steakhouses on the strip, and I felt the food was the best at this one. Went on a weeknight and the place was pretty empty. Ordered a 12 oz. filet, which was excellent and came out just how I wanted it. Interesting bread basket included a great pretzel roll.  Was given a complimentary sample of a delicious potato soup, I would have ordered a bowl if it were offered. Creme brulee for dessert was excellent. I was given a complimentary little nut-type dessert with my coffee also. 

My server was a little inattentive in the beginning. I sat for 5 minutes with my mind made up before he came and took my order, but it got better from there.

Also noted that the dinner menu was slightly different from what is on their website.

I had a better steak at Sizzlers.

I first saw this restaurant on a show on the Food Network so on our next trip to Vegas, my wife and I had to go and check it out.

The decor was as expected and the service started out good.

We ordered a rib-eye and filet.  We got our steaks and it was like eating something that had no taste and took forever to chew.  The waiter asked how our food was.  I responded with not very good and explained that I have had great steaks at many steak houses across the country and this wouldn't even come close.

The manager came over and asked me again what was wrong.  I explained that our steaks had very little taste and they were like eating cardboard.  He just went on and on about how they heavily season the meat and they are of high quality.  He didn't care.

I will never again step foot in that restaurant and I encourage all try steak lovers find somewhere else when in Vegas.

A good steakhouse can be hard to find even in Las Vegas. Strip House, however did not disappoint, not only were our steaks prepared exactly to our liking, they were also seasoned to perfection. The sides, salad, soup were also superb, I highly suggest the creamed spinach which is prepared with black truffle wow out of this world delicious!! Great cocktails, fun atmosphere and excellent service from our fantastic waiter Scott make this restaurant one of my favorites!

Very expensive, but it was delicious. My friend and I each ordered the 8oz. filet mignon which looks small but was just enough; so juicy and tender. The "ripped" potatoes had a parmesan seasoning that was incredible, and the whipped potato pur√©e was so cheesy and delightful. my friend ordered a raspberry martini that she really liked. I ordered the strawberry mojito that was good, but a little hard to drink because of all the chunks of strawberries & mint leaves. The chocolate cake/brownie was VERY rich.
Awesome Staff!!! Great water best cake!!!!!!bartenders were so nice especially Sean and Mark with a C!!!!

Went here recently and had a poor experience. Our steak took almost an hour and a half to come out. I asked the waiter if the kitchen was down or if there was something going on. He responded no. The problem is there was hardly anyone there so they were not busy at all. When the steaks arrived they were overcooked not at all medium rare. The manager I believe named Chris said just because the outside was blackened it was medium rare, no idea what the outside has to do with the inside of a steak? Either way there was no excuse from the manager why it took 1.5 hours to overcook a steak. My wife and I left to eat elsewhere. Sent a note to the GM there and no response. Gave them a chance to not post a neative review but since no response, here we are. Vegas is about fun and service, Strip House is neither.

Ate here after searching for the place for some time. I am one of those man's man guys that is too stupid to figure out where something is before just randomly looking...and heaven forbid I ask anybody.

But I digress.  I ate here because of the cake...believe it or not.  Yeah the zillion layer chocolate cake was good and they had to amputate my legs from too much sugar yada yada yada.  If you go here for the cake then you miss the point.  

The steak is amazing.  Other restaurants may be able to cook a steak perfectly like the Strip House, but they do not have the same seasoning.  It tasted like a salt/garlic blend of seasonings that enhanced the steak to a point that it was unlike any I have had.  I would be able to tell you more about the seasoning if I could have seen it in light...why is it so dark in here?

Decor and atmosphere reminded me of a place that is nice and dressy, but also a place where a major mob hit would have taken place.  That somehow appealed to me.  If you see some old guy in a nice suit in a dark corner then they are probably planning some point shaving scam or hasseling the teamsters.  But what am I saying?  Every corner in this place is dark...every inch of this place is dark.  Well worth the visit.  You will feel right at home if you just came out of the optometrist....good steak though.

this place was absolutely amazing!!!

my friend and i were just going to grab a quick late-night bite to eat at koi, but it looked like they were turning into a club for the night, so we decided to go to strip house, which is right next to koi.  we had no idea what this place was and had no expectations, but we were beyond amazed at how delicious EVERYTHING was.

the lobster bisque was TO DIE FOR, the scallop appetizer was so delicious that it still makes my mouth water when i think about it (two weeks later), and the lobster linguine was, well, GREAT!!  my friend at i still talk about how awesome the food was to this day.  

don't let the non-crowdedness of this place lead you to believe that this is not a great place to eat.  it's a hidden gem!!  a bit pricey...paid $100 including tip + two drinks and only one main entree...but it was completely WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!!

The staff were nice. And when i had a problem, the manger took the food of my bill. But overall, I was rather disappointed. Great reviews, but the bacon was bland and tasted like Charcoal, the Mac and cheese was less than average and the chicken tasted like home made lemon pepper chicken. I how my experience here was a fluke and that it its usually a good place to go

Exceptionally poor service and management has an extremely poor follow up; therefore all around bad on that aspect. Much of the food was delicious, but the bread might have been the best part of the experience. When service is rude, short, and ignorant of the customer obviously its much easier to do very poor work and/or miss things.. such as details of an order, etc. This part should not be missing as it throws off the experience of the restaurant. I watched and listened as many complained of the same bartender being awful in one way or another. I'm sure her tips suffered as did many customer's experience.
The ambiance here is pleasing and enjoyable; the steaks and service are.. no joke.. the worst of any supposed "high end" steakhouse. Much worse than any I have been to in what seems like a decade actually. I love and live for great meals and this one really, really failed. I promise you, this is absolutely not a premiere steakhouse. Do not come here if you're expecting to get your money's worth with a delicious meal or be taken care of whatsoever. I feel bad for them. Mastro's, Larsons, blahblahblah... any other place would have at least corrected the error. Lol. The last mistake and one that will not allow repeat customers and perhaps the people in those person's circles. Farewell forever awful "steakhouse."

I was extremely impressed with the service, atmosphere and quality of food for the price! My husband and I are BIG steak connoisseur's.  We've been to many upscale steakhouses across the country.  We love a great steak and don't mind paying for it! My husband and I ordered 4 cocktails from the bar and shared an appetizer, salad, entree, 2 sides, 2 desserts and our bill was around $150!  I was shocked at what a great price it was for everything... Other comparable steakhouses on the strip would be much more than that.  The steak was cooked perfectly, well marbled and juicy! Everything we ordered was very tasty!  I will be back for sure!

Absolutely delicious! We plan on returning very soon. 

TIP: although attire preferred is dressy, you can keep it casual in VEGAS :)
I'm the type that I says "anyone can make a great steak" but the 4 of us loved what we got.  Surf and turf.  Appetizers.  All good.  Place was great with a cool atmosphere!

One of the best if not the best ever Bone In Rib Eye Ive ever had. There wasnt a bad bite of that steak. It was cooked to perfection. Great stop on the book tour to a some what hidden away gem upstairs in Planet Hollywood.

Let me start off by saying I have gone to and had the Potatoes Romanoff as well as the NY strip steak at the Strip House and I have to say, despite its outrageous price, the steak and potatoes are truly outstanding.  With the portions they give, I took leftovers home and had the best steak and eggs and potatoes I have ever had in my life.
So, I was surprised and excited, after doing a search on the net, to find a couple of youtube type videos on the Strip House chefs doing their famous Potatoes Romanoff recipe; one being on the Today show.
I listened and played the videos over and over until I got all the details to the letter and number.  I then proceeded to make these wonderful potatoes only to be incredibly disappointed at my results.  And, there were repeated attempts and all failures to capture the wonderful Strip House Potatoes Romanoff.
One video said 15 minuets in the oven, the other said 25.  I tried both and even longer and every time the shallots came out crunchy and undercooked.  After multiple attempts, I decided to sweat the shallots a little.  This was better but not good enough.  Baked the potatoes, let them cool and rest for a day, grated and
got good quality sour cream and white cheddar, and of course the russet potatoes, but none of my efforts seemed to pull it off.
Funny thing is, as they say, it's easy to make using simple ingredients. My only conclusion is their ingredients are of a different caliber than what I can buy at my supermarket or gourmet market and or, they are doing something that they're not disclosing.

One of the best meals I have had in a long time. The filet was cooked perfectly and the drinks were very well done. The item that I remember the most though was the cream spinach with truffle oil. That was amazing. I will be stopping in here at least once every time I'm in Vegas.

Keeping this on short:
