4 stars?  LOL!  Very pretentious with music way too loud for a fine dining experience.  First third of the experience we were showered with attention from the waiter and bus boys.  Then they all disappeared for most of the rest of the meal, even had to move our own empty plates out of the way after 5 minutes.  The chateaubriand was a half ass piece of meat; I've had better taste from Walmart.  The cook likes to char the edges with salt and pepper and that made the outside of the meat inedible to myself.  All in all what a waste of money; we could have had 4 decent buffets for the same price.  The worst thing of all, going back to that pretentious atmosphere...the waiter committed the cardinal sin of not coming back and asking if everything was okay with our meal.  Even a diner waitress usually has this down.  I could stay in the hotel again, but would never set foot in this charade in the future.

We visited this restaurant for the second time and it definitely didn't disappoint. The food and service is wonderful! I had the 8 oz filet mignon which was tender and juicy and my husband had the 16 oz NY strip which was equally as good. We
ordered the mac and cheese and baked potato as our sides and both were big enough to split. We have eaten at many steakhouses on the strip and this is definitely our favorite. Well worth the prices!

I shall call this post, a "hairy" situation. 

I was in Vegas for the last week working at AVN. I felt pretty victorious and wanted to celebrate the occasion at Strip House since I had dined there the last time I was in town and thoroughly enjoyed it. 

Was seated at 9pm (my reservation time) in a nice booth and things were going great in the beginning. Our server was attentive and friendly and I was excited for the food. I tried to hold on to this moment later in the evening when I was pissed, but sigh, more on that in a bit. 

The food comes and I'm excited, and also starving because I basically worked all damn day without a proper meal. I ordered the 8oz filet mignon and a side of the duck fat potatoes. I was about 1/4 into my meal when I cut into the potato stack (which is crispy on the outside, soft and mashed potato-y on the inside) and I was treated to a rather disgusting surprise. 

A hair. AND NOT MY HAIR. 

Now, I was at AVN all week. I am not easily scared off by hair. But this hair was long, curly, and COOKED INTO THE BATTER.  I tried not to alarm the person I was with because I didn't want to ruin her meal, but I couldn't hide my facial expression as I figured out what had happened. 

I flagged over our server and quietly told him, "hey look, I don't want to draw extra attention to the situation (since there were parties around us), but I found a hair in my food. Cooked into my food." 

He was...not as apologetic or surprised as I thought he'd be. He was, oddly, flat in his apology, which irked me since I was purposely trying to tell him quietly to avoid ruining other people's experiences. He asked if I wanted another one (uh no, also it's like 10pm now) and asked about my steak, to which I told him that I didn't think I could finish my meal. Mind you, while this is happening, the pube is staring at me from my plate in front of me. His demeanor wouldn't have bothered me if it wasn't a big contrast to his friendly and attentive demeanor in the beginning of the evening. At his point, I offered to pay for the food I ate before-said incident.  

He took the plate away and I waited for a good 15-20 minutes for I don't know what. Finally a manager came, he apologized (which also seemed a bit flat) and offered us a complimentary dessert. He said our server would bring us a menu.

Here I wait another 15-20 minutes, at which point I see our server walk past us, and I also see him give a dessert menu to a nearby table. Our server doesn't come and at this point, I'd rather eat fast food then stay any longer. I flag down the manager and let him know that no one came by and that I'd actually just like the check. 

When our server comes by finally, I explain that the manager said he was meant to bring by a dessert menu, but we were going to pass on the offer and just wanted to go and pay our bill. The server then tells us he didn't bring a menu yet because they had to clear the table. I'm not sure if that's actually the policy or he was trying to cover up for the fact that he had forgotten, but either way, he could have updated us on what was going on. And honestly, there's no reason for us to be waiting so damn long.

As you can read in my other reviews, I can forgive a lot when it comes to restaurant service. Wrong orders, being mischarged, etc. as long as you are polite. But if I'm polite enough to tell you I found a fucking hair COOKED into my food and you are apathetic (at best), uhhh. No. Not okay at all. There is no reason why I was waiting for nearly another 45 minutes to get this shit resolved. 

 Then the bill comes. At this point, I'm thinking the meal will be comped because this was ridiculous. NOPE. It's nearly $100 with tip. Most expensive fucking hair I ever had. And trust me, I was working at AVN ALL WEEK.

NEVER FUCKING AGAIN.

Average food at above average prices.

Overall experience was quite poor. Booked a table for 8pm but did not get seated until almost 830 despite there being tables available. 

Food order took a considerable time. I order the 12oz rib eye and my wife the surf and turf. Her steak was overcooked by a lot and my undercooked, I asked for a medium and got a medium rare. The side dish of potato was very good and the steak itself was okay but just that. For $50+ I had hoped for better.

Wine selection again is okay but very overpriced. Service was mediocre at best.

Would not go again or recommend.

As a steak house, not impressed.  When the sides are better than the main course it should tell you something. I ordered the special Hanger steak, not good. It had a coffee rub. Pretty much tasted like burnt coffee on a steak. The potatoes romanoff was really good. Mac and cheese not bad. Vary expensive though for the quality of food that you get. Typical Las Vegas strip restaurant

We had a pretty large group of people that ate here late (16 people at 10:30pm).  In a quick search of places, it seemed like the only steak house that was open a little later (closed at 11:30pm on weekends).

The food here was good, but not good enough to make me want to go back there.  Also, the portions are pretty big.  Two people could probably share one dinner entree.  For example, their steaks only listed 16oz or 20oz sizes on the menu.

One of the best tasting filets I've had. If you like yours with a seared, slightly charred exterior and a tender center, give Strip House's filet a try. I thought the meal was very reasonable considering it's quality too. The shrimp cocktail was quite yummy also.

We made a reservation for Strip House for a Thursday night.  We arrived & were promptly seated in a roomy corner booth.  The first thing I noticed was the decor of red velvet wallpaper with old photos on the wall.  It set a nice romantic mood.  The service right off the bat was top notch.  The food was outstanding!  Everything we had from the tuna tartar, to our steaks & even the sides were delicious and perfectly prepared.  Next time we are in Vegas we will for sure be back here.  It was overall an outstanding dining experience!

Service was amazing. Atmosphere was top notch. Our waitress was funny and very nice. That said, we arrived on time but couldn't be seated because everyone was in a staff meeting. The lobster tasted like rubber and the Baked Alaska was off.
Brian C. Was the best server. Handled our bachelor party very well. Outstanding service and the food was great as well but Brian made the experience.

My visit to Vegas always has a high end steak place to try.  I hit some good ones and yet to give a 5 star until now.  In order to get that you have to cook the perfect steak, have a high quality rib eye and  have great service.  Perfect on all counts.

My brother taught me that the rib eye, not the filet migon is the best cut.  Sure the filet is tender, but a great quality rib eye has more fat, more flavor and is quite tender especially if the quality is top notched.  My rib eye hit on all marks.  If you want a Lexus, face it, you cannot pay for a price of a Chevy.  That goes with steaks too.  People's complaints about the expense is not warranted. Then, it must be medium rare, a hot red juicy center.  This was the quintessential rib eye.  The sides were equally tremendous as well.

Each good casino has a high end steak joint and this one belonged to Planet Hollywood.  If you don't look up from the casino floor, you could miss it.  And if you think the Strip House is a gentlemen's club (an oxymoron), you may ignore it.  Don't.  Take the escalator to the second deck and be prepared to be served the perfect rib eye.  I hope future repeat trips give me equal performance.  If they do, I may not try another place in town.

Chris was our server and he was friendly, attentive and provided great recommendations.  Ask for him and you'll likely get the same quality service.

This is one of those fancy steak houses I wish I could afford to eat at all the time. However for a special occasion or date night, it is worth every penny. 
Strip House, located near other fine dining inside Planet Hollywood, is an upscale, classy, yet modern and semi-sexual style restaurant. The lighting is dim, and after 8:00 PM the volume of the music increases. There are photographs from an earlier time frame of women in the nude, in a very presentable fashion. And the service is off the charts. There were literally people standing around, waiting for my plate to be empty so they could clear it, or my water to be anything less than full, so they could top it off. Impressive.  
Between my other half and I, we shared shrimp and crab cocktail, thick bacon, a ribeye, a filet, a side dish full of potatoes, cheese, bacon, and chilies, I was literally in food heaven. I am not sure how I walked out of there, or how my dress still fit me after this. Truly one of the more memorable steak dinners I have had in Las Vegas. 
The ribeye, and the potato side were my two favorite dishes. The ribeye has a seasoned rub on it that truly emphasizes the steaks already great flavors. 
Overall our bill with a tip for two people, came to $260. As I said at the start of the review, worth every penny. 
Live a little, step out of your comfort zone, and eat here! You will not be disappointed.

One of the best steaks that I have had. I was inspired to visit here based on a show that was on the Travel Channel showing some of the things to do while visiting Las Vegas. I was not disappointed!

The ambiance was fantastic! Very classy looking and intimately lit. They have tasteful pictures of pinup up models illuminated perfectly all around and it is very red in the restaurant. Someone proposed across from us and I think it was a great setting to do so!

I had oysters, the bone in NY Strip, and the chocolate cake with a double shot of espresso. Others in my party had the filet mignon and the boneless NY strip steak.

We shared the goose fat potatoes, warm garlic bread with gorgonzola fondue, black truffle creamed spinach, garlic herb french fries, and mac & cheese.

It was a bit pricey but being a great steak house right on the strip it's what we expected to pay. I will definitely be returning for a steak here when I go back to Las Vegas!

It's like a classic steakhouse and an upscale strip club got together and had a baby....minus the naked people.  Well, that's not entirely true.  Look reallllly carefully at the design on your napkins.  :)

I was here with a big group and we got one of the private rooms.  The servers were bend-over-backwards accommodating and the food was divine.  Really delicious steak and solid sides.  It's been a few months, but I seem to remember a soup amuse bouche that was phenomenal.  If you're in the mood for steak and want a fun experience to boot, I highly recommend StripSteak.

This is a very expensive steakhouse in Las Vegas that runs out of STEAK (as well as 4-5 other important menu items) & doesn't even apologize sincerely.  It was only 8pm and not even particularly busy. Epic Fail. There are plenty of great steakhouses in Las Vegas. Good luck!

It's all about the cake.  If nothing else, get the chocolate cake.  You will thank me later.

I needed to grab a bite after a long day at work.  I was staying at Planet Hollywood and didn't want to roam around the casino floor with the chaos that is Vegas.  I decided to walk into the strip house and sit at the bar.  

The bar tender was great - attentive but not overbearing.  While sitting there eating and enjoying my meal, a man walked up to the bar and ordered a slice of chocolate cake to go. GENIUS!!!!

Stuffed from my meal and cocktail...I simply didn't have room for dessert - but took a slice to go as well. As it was my first time ordering the cake, I had no idea how friggin' humongous the slice would be.  It had to have weighed at least 3-5lbs. 

OMG. After one bite, I wished I had taken three or four or five to go. HEAVEN. I love chocolate cake, and the 24-layer chocolate cake at strip house is the best ever. I guess you can share the ginormous slice, but that's just silly. This is one indulgence worth the calories.

I went back to see if the first visit, which I adored, was a fluke. I am thrilled to report it was not. 

I booked a special room- and let me tell you they did this right. I was taken care of at every step. They had the whole thing planned out. They took my card before so I would be certain to avoid a client trying to grab the tab. They asked for any special requests and they met each one. 

The wine room was a perfect setting. They had it set up with great flair and design. 

The service and food were exceptional. I could go on forever- but honestly I quit reading these reviews after a bit and I'm sure you do too. 

Do yourself a favor- go to this hidden gem.

Imagine this - you're the greeter at a really nice steak house.  A guy walks up to you and asks if there's a table available...in what is clearly a very full restaurant.  you say "how many in your party?" and the reply is "thirteen".

That's exactly what happened a few weeks ago at Strip House.  In this case, however, rather than sneer at us, she called the manager, who opened up a private room for us, and sat us within 10 minutes.  STELLAR.  He gave us our own wait staff....STELLAR.  And all this, mind you, at the drop of a hat, and without reservations.  Then, to really test out how far we could take this, i let them know that we were in a relative hurry, and we wanted separate checks.  No problem...STELLAR.

We ordered our drinks, and after perusing the menu, most of us went the steak route.  The wife and I split one, and it was perfectly cooked.  

In fact, this whole experience was about as superb as it could have been.  Kudos to Strip House (and double kudos for a great name, coupled with a great motif that plays on that in the restaurant).

A definite thumbs up.

Awesome service the steak cooked the way I ordered, wine was perfect, and the service beyond belief!!!! Skip the capaccino not spelled correctly but not prepared as well as everything else. I love the crust they put on the steak. Did not use a sauce. Manager visited twice unobtrusively and very friendly. 
Will be back!

Went here for my birthday on 7/9/15.  Wow!  Excellent, friendly service and the meal was fantastic.  The house Old Fashioned is perfect, actually worth the $20 and I'm typically frugal so that's tough to admit.  We had a prosciutto wrapped salad (daily special) to start that was delicious.  I ordered a 12oz parmesan crusted filet mignon medium rare (also daily special) that was certainly one of the best steaks I've ever had, likely the best.  The creamed spinach was wonderful too.  The duck fat potato dish was good but the least remarkable of the meal.  Our waitress actually recommended the potato romanoff instead and we should have listened.
Total bill for two with tip $266, and actually worth it.  2 cocktails, soda water, one app, 2 steaks, 2 sides, no dessert.
I have to say this steakhouse is truly amazing. The Chateaubriand which can be shared was so juicy and delicious.
Been here a few times and figured it was time to write a review. The filet is on point with the cream of spinach. Scott showed us a fine dining experience and we will definitely back.

Everything was great--except the steaks on the night I was there.  Waiter/service was great; bread was great; appetizer was great.  However, I had bone in filet--kind of tough.  My wife ordered her steak medium rare, but it was more like medium well and was kind of tough also.

We had a dinner reservation prior to seeing a show and we still had to wait about 15 minutes for our table. 
Oysters were fresh and delicious. Steak was a perfect medium rare with a fabulous crust, and the creamed spinach and Mac and cheese were amazing. 
Service at our table was spotty, with long wait times every step of the way, to get menus, order, take care of the bill, even though the staff knew we were going to a show. 
I may return if I don't have plans following dinner since the food was so good, but service needs to improve.

I had a wonderful experience at the Striphouse in Houston years ago and had received a gift card for the restaurant. I was excited to use it, but was unable to do so before the Striphouse in Houston closed down due to real estate negotiations that fell through (their lease was up, I believe). I looked them up online and saw they had locations in Manhattan and Vegas, so I figured I would be able to use the card at some point in the future. As it turns out, the Vegas and Manhattan locations had been bought out by BR Guest (from The Glazier Group).

Of course, as a patron, I was blissfully unaware of this when I went to use the gift card at the Striphouse in Las Vegas. My dining companion and I went to the Las Vegas location and had a pleasant time -- we had some great cocktails (the Seasonal Cosmo and the Manhattan), some delicious oysters on the half shell, a very nice baby iceberg salad (the stilton cheese vinaigrette was yummy), and then the entrees -- a great bone-in rib eye and a surf-and-turf. The meat was generally nicely done, although the outside of my filet seemed a bit overcooked (yes, they specialize in this -- but it seemed this wasn't their best effort). We also got the black truffle creamed spinach and a spicy potatoes romanoff. The potatoes were a little too heavy on the sour cream, but the spinach was delicious.

Our waitstaff was very responsive, although there was a misunderstanding at some point (may have been my fault -- I asked for horseradish for the oysters and I thought he hadn't heard the first time because he came back with spoons, so I asked again). He seemed like a seasoned server who had been doing this for a long time. It was, generally, a good experience -- although the food wasn't as delicious as I remember it (everything was a tad overcooked and the flavors weren't quite as distinct as my initial experience) and the weird misunderstanding (that again, may have been my bad). When we got our check, I slipped my gift card in excitedly. I had waited so long to come back to the Striphouse after the one in Houston had closed down and I was finally getting a wonderful meal!

Turns out, the gift card was not valid at the restaurant. We were told there was nothing they could do in the restaurant and that we needed to contact BR Guest, their parent company. I did, expecting a favorable, understanding response. After all, we had spent a good bit of money that night -- and were thinking we would be repeat customers since we are much more proximate to Vegas now. However, as it turns out, there was nothing BR Guest could do either. They were incredibly polite, but pointed out that BR Guest had not purchased the Houston location and therefore, there was nothing they could do for me. They suggested calling The Glazier Group (and even helped me out by trying to call for me), but as it turns out, they also said nothing could be done (The Glazier Group has yet to return my phone calls). I wish I could say I was still a huge fan of Striphouse and that I proselytized about their amazing steaks -- cooked so perfectly on the outside and still juicy on the inside -- but this experience with both the Striphouse Las Vegas and with BR Guest (and with The Glazier Group) has really disappointed me so very much.

Unfortunately, I would not recommend coming here, considering the other great dining options in Vegas -- and I would definitely advise against being a repeat customer, because I don't think that this restaurant (which is understandable, since there located in Vegas and it is mainly frequented by tourists) and their parent company are interested in retaining customers.

AMAZING STEAKS!!! Service was not so bueno...two days before dining here, my wife and I dined at The Steak House at the Circus Circus like we always do when we visit Vegas- There, the service was exceptional, but the our steak had no flavor at all. 

So, being that my wife wanted to go see Pitbul at Planet Hollywood, we decided to give this place a try. We didn't have reservations but they Sat us right away. I believe the managers name was Alex if I'm not mistaken very nice and professional man sad is that our table and told our waitress would be with us in a little bit. The restaurant was extremely packed from what I heard from one of the waiters was that almost everybody dining in there that night was going to the concert. About five minutes later we finally got our menus and met our waitress Tiffany.She either was overwhelmed very tired or just very moody that day. Again the WOW FACTOR was already ruined- but oh well- we were hungry and we were not going to go anywhere else to go dying so we had to suck it up. 

My wife and I always order and share everything. We got our bread which was very good we ordered a salad we both had a beer each and ordered a ribeye steak 14 ounce medium well with a side of garlic french fries. 

We actually got the steak faster than what we anticipated. The steak itself had a beautiful char to it and it was cooked perfectly. My wife and I both enjoyed our steak.  Our waitress Tiffany did check up on us quite a few times and towards the end she finally started smiling which kind of made a difference with our visit. Overall this place has amazing steaks I was very impressed I just wish the service was just as good as the steaks that's what we are noticing in Las Vegas in many restaurants now they either lack something their quality of food or the quality of customer service we spent five days in Las Vegas. 

Out of all of the places that we went to go eat there was absolutely no WOW FACTOR in any of the places we dined at- it's sad that we travel so far to come to Vegas to enjoy ourselves and get pampered, but something always has to ruin it. 

There are many steak houses in Las Vegas and in the surrounding areas that you can dine at. 

I d rather have exceptional service and ok food than shitty service and great food. Service sets the tone immediately with you and how your total experience will be while dining. 

I d give this place 5 stars,but the service ruined it-

Found this place on open table and four of us got right in with a quick reservation. The waiter was extremely helpful and nice. We ordered a couple of fillets and I had the dry aged ribeye. It literally was cooked to perfection with a wonderful pepper crust that sealed in the natural juices. My guests said the fillets were good, but once they had a taste of the ribeye they wished they had ordered that. 
The bread service and wedge salad's as well as the soup were all very good. This place feels a little out-of-the-way when you're walking the strip so maybe that's why they weren't crowded Because the steak certainly rivaled anything I've had in Vegas before.
I have a gluten allergy and the staff is very knowledgeable! Love the filet mignon with gf broccoli and whipped potatoes. And the gluten free garlic bread is to die for! Go here, it's worth it!

Came to the strip house before seeing peep show sat 10/6, love the d√©cor and ambiance, the service is absolutely amazing.
Mini ciabata rolls are great very fresh they give you three cranberry, garlic cheese, and sourdough maybe.
Strip house margarita it would have been ok but I forgot to tell them not to salt the glass (my fault, but ruined the drink for me) honestly I expected better drinks from a high end restaurant in Vegas
French connection was made perfectly
Caesar salad wonderful dressing anchovies were present and the croutons were delish nice cheese and garlic addition, fresh cracked pepper rounded it out 
Lobster Bisque I've had better and the portion of lobster left so much to be desired and was pretty disappointing for the cost
Crisply Scottish Salmon 5 stars! (The picture I've attached is of this dish) it was amazing and beautifully presented 
14 oz steak, my dinner companion said it was well worth the $54 price tag   

The above mentioned meal was $175 with tax and tip, we were in Vegas enjoying ourselves so why not but I think Morton's and Flemings are better (I don't eat steak so that opinion is based on seafood, drinks, and side dishes)

One of the best steak houses i've ever been to. The service is great and atmosphere of this place is fantastic. It's located inside Planet Hollywood right next to KOI bar and lounge. I tried the $50 20 oz New York steak and it was delicious i could suck the meat out of it.
Expensive but worth it.  Mac and cheese was the only disappointment.  Wish we had room for desert, but after apps, entree and sides we did not.

Surprisingly pretty darn good. Our group sampled a variety of dishes and everything was better than I had expected, with the bone in rib-eye and the house special pork chops being particularly awesome. It is certainly better than some of the other more "well known" steakhouses in Vegas....plus no wait (at least on a random Monday night).

I had a 23 person party for my bachelor party. Some of my table mates were drunk off their ass since they had to chug those yard-stick margaritas before being seated. I give Strip House at least 3-stars for not kicking us out due to my drunkard friends.

Our server was excellent, so no complaints about the service. I had a ribeye steak which was thick and delicious (and also $50). It was a bit peppery which was fine for me, but I'm sure my fiancee would not like it. Everything is a la carte, so you may be sharing side dishes and such. There is also a $7 sharing fee for meals.

Came here for my birthday in April and I am so glad we did. The service, food and ambiance was wonderful! Our waiter John and our wine sommelier Jarod were awesome!  My husband and I will definitely be coming back.

We had a large party that had a reservation at 6:30pm. We left at 10:40pm. The service was slow and lacking, food was good, but only got one drink in 4 hours. 

The server told us the specials and then disappeared for 20min for us discuss it. 

Drink order-delivered 15min later.

Dinner was hot and delicious.

Checks were delivered, then they were collected 25min later. 

Super expensive, service non existent and the place was empty. Save your time and money.

I'm so glad we chose to eat at a restaurant inside the hotel we're staying at! So many benefits- no spending on a taxi/Uber, walking distance, casino on the bottom floor, amazing food! 
Their steak is phenomenal.. great portions. Ambience is intimate- it was our date night without kids so it served us well! Staff is very attentive and professional. I had one of their Hibiscus bourbon drinks and it was DELICIOUS-the perfect blend of bourbon and sweetness.

I know that steak houses are a dime a dozen in Vegas but Strip stood out to me.  Not sure if it was because of the dark fancy ambience or the nice smell every time I walked by the restaurant.  It was our last night in Vegas and were sick of eating your typical quick dinners so we decided to eat at Strip House which was in our hotel.  Upon arrival we were seated right away and our order was taken right away.  Waiter was super friendly and quick to serve us anything we asked for.  My steak was cooked and seasoned to perfection.  No complaints what so ever as even the sides were cooked to perfection.  Now lets talk about dessert.  We ordered the 27 layer chocolate cake that was apparently featured on the Oprah show at one time or another.  I was like whatever its chocolate cake how can you go wrong anyways.  Cake was served and for those of you that know me you know that im not a huge sweets guys but let me tell you this cake made me change that quick.  The slice of cake was HUGEEE.  We could not finish it we had to bring it back to our room.

All in all I know that the steak houses are everywhere but let me tell you this.  If you are not going to try the steak at Strip House then you MUST try the chocolate cake.

Great service and delicious food.. the tastiest cuisines...pricey, but full filling.   The portions were not huge but surprisingly it filled us up.  Food that will fill you up and leave you satisfied.  Again the warm friendly service added to the food I believe .

Had dinner before a show we split a crab cake appetizer, 20oz steak and potatoes romanoff and the 2 of us could not finish it all! Great food
Restaurant decor was sexy and modern
Waiter was ok fast service but not personable

This was by far the best restaurant in Vegas.  Our drinks were delicious, the food was excellent.  Our server, Daniel, was very knowledgeable.  We will definitely be enjoying this place again next time we are in Vegas.  

We ordered ribeye, filet mignon/lobster combo, the goose fat potatoes, brussel sprouts, crab cake, calamari and the delicious 24 layer chocolate cake.  Everything was delectable!

Went with friends. High points and low points.

High point: scallop appetizer was excellent.
Low point: beefsteak tomato and bufala mozzarella was just average.

High point: filet topped with crab was excellent. Everyone enjoyed their steaks. The tuna was also good. Garlic green beans were also a winner, as were the loaded gratin potatoes (on special) and the mac n cheese.
Low point: asparagus was bland.

High point: brownie sundae and the torte were favorites. Cheesecake was very smooth and yummy as well, but needed extra sauce.
Low point: creme br√ªl√©e ...ick for me.

Service was great on a Sunday night. Atmosphere is nice.

I'm going to keep this one pretty short.  The restaurant is very lavish in a dark red intimate setting and conveniently located in the Planet Hollywood hotel/casino.  Service was really good and the food was excellent.  I recommend the filet mignon or the new york steak.  This place reminds me of Donovan's but a little more expensive (I wouldn't say this place was any better or worse though).  Overall, I was satisfied with both the meal and service.

Be careful when ordering a steak!  The bone in filet was so spicy I drank my $7 iced tea in two drinks.  Sides were solid except for the charred broccoli.  We ordered the mushrooms, potatoes special, and Mac n cheese.  All were good.  Last we had the chocolate cake.  It was fantastic.  All in all I wouldn't recommend this place for the price.  If you do come in, order your steak with light seasoning.

Everyone that works at this establishment was amazing. From the sweet hostess who was willing to help with anything needed to our perfect waiter Scott, you can't go wrong coming here. The food is amazing, the service is immaculate, the drinks are wonderful. Go here and get what you paid for!!

I have had better food at cheaper prices. The atmosphere was cool... quite loud. I was expecting more from the food... for the price. There was 5 of us and our bill was almost $500 with no alcohol. 

I have had better.

Not an Epic Steak Experience
----------------------------------

MLK weekend.  One of the highlights of a Vegas trip is an epic steak meal.  I make it a point to go to a high end steakhouse as a personal treat.  I decided to try out the Strip House.  I did not have reservations, and my friend was still in bed.  So I decided to go solo exactly at 5:00 PM opening since I was starving.  Plus, I figure I beat the holiday rush.  

One of my major pet peeves is when a restaurant is open at said time, and the staff don't  have their  sh*t together. I was seated near the bar and it was apparently obvious I was not welcome at that time.  Then the question begs "why the f*ck did you seat me then?"  The tattooed blonde at the bar was certainly not friendly as I seemed to have inconvenienced her at the opening hour.   But f*ck it.  I am here for steak

The decor was interesting.  It was quiet with lots of red/velvet furniture and old nude photos.  I imagine this is what a strip club in the early 20s would have been like.  

Lets focus on the food.  I ordered the New York strip 16 ounce.  Mind you, this is not dry aged.  It was disappointing there was no dry aged option for the New York strip.   The steak was pretty tasty and the special bbq sauce was quite exceptional.  However, it certainly did not exceed the  basic bench mark from your typical chain restaurants like Ruth Chris or Flemings. 

So did the Strip House satisfy my epic steak expectations?   The answer is NO.  It was good, but I will certainly not come back.  The steak did not exceed my expectations given the price point.  It was not below average nor above.  If I am paying $$$$,  you better believe the expectations will be that standard.   So in this regard it will get a 3 out of 5 stars.  And another bit of advice, don't come here at 5:00, one may get the stink eye.

I came to Strip House as part of a 14 person bachelor party. They did a great job with us in the private room.
 I got the Caesar Salad, Filet Mignon, Mashed Potatoes and Haricot Verts. 

Everything was well prepared and impressive. I enjoy peppered steak so I asked for a pepper crust and really enjoyed the preparation they made. The mashed potatoes were served in its own copper pot which appeared to be the same vessel that cooked the item. 

Dessert was a spectacular chocolate cake shared throughout the table. 

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone as a first class steak house.

Strip House is undoubtedly good and one of the top steak houses in Vegas, however I just don't know if I'd return.  Everything was cooked very well, our service was on the spot, and the ambiance was posh and comforting, but I just didn't get the WOW factor.

We go through the motions with our server (tap or bottled) and let him know tap is fine, order two glasses of wine, and were served bread.  All very standard in fine dining restaurants, blah.  Upon the arrival of our wines, we order our first course of either crab cakes or scallops (can't remember) and a caesar salad.  We continue on the order our entrees, a 16 oz. NY Strip and a 10 oz. filet mignon.  We also ordered three sides: whipped potatoes puree, potatoes romanoff, and black truffle creamed spinach.

Our first courses arrived in a timely manner.  The salad was fresh but wasn't the best I've ever had.  And as far as I know with the seafood, it was decent, nothing to rave about.

Shortly, after finishing them, our steaks and sides arrive and are cooked near perfectly.  The NY Strip was juicy and flavorful!  And even though my filet was cooked medium (the way I wanted), it was a tad on the dry side with little flavor.  Our sides were very good but perhaps a little on the "heavy" side.  My favorite being the whipped potatoes puree.  The spinach was very rich, creamy, and flavorful.  Though I don't recommend ordering it unless you have at least four people in your party.  The potatoes romanoff was rich as well, with a vast amount of cheddar cheese and sauteed onion.  Again, I wouldn't recommend ordering this unless your are dining with at least a group of four--too much food!

Strip House has a beautiful, luxurious red interior, which is reminiscent of a 1920s red light district.  There are tons of artsy, burlesque'ish pictures of girls hanging from the walls.  For those of you who are dining alone, they do have a nice bar upon entering the restaurant equipped with a large flat screen to watch the games.  Be aware there is music spinning.  However, the music is of a modern retro beat, that is very easy to listen to.  Somehow the music fits the vibe of the restaurant, since most of the clientele is between the ages of 20s-40s.  This is definitely a restaurant to be seen in!  But like I mentioned above, the food just didn't give me the WOW factor.

My boyfriend wanted to treat me to a nice steak and raved about Strip House in New York and said I would love it if Las Vegas location was same as New York. The waiter was awesome, but when we received our steak, it didn't taste the same. He asked for the steak to be split becasue it was a large cut. I am not a steak eater so I don't know when a cut is bad. His cut was great, but I kept chewing and chewing and eventually I gave him some of my cut to see. He noticed I was struggling, but assumed I was chewing slow. He spit his piece out and asked to speak to the Manager. He let the waiter know how he felt and was disappointed with my cut. They said it was from the same cut, but he disagreed. The Manager approaches and his response to our complaint was highly unprofessional. He comments were uncalled for when situation was explained. He said you ate it so nothing can be done about it even though he was told I wasn't a seasoned steak eater. He lied saying he came from new York location when my boyfriend mentioned names, he was clueless. He was very immature and childish and defensive. His hospitality skills were horrible, customer skills even worse and all he did was remove the side dishes ordered. We were not looking for a free meal, but something to be done to rectify serving a bad cut of steak which was a pretty penny. My boyfriend was outraged at the poor service the Manager gave portrays Strip House to be a place that doesn't care if a patron is satisfied or not. I cannot recommend this location due to his performance and will let the New York location know of our horrible experience in Las Vegas.

Beautiful restaurant with great food and amazing service.  Our server was Carlos and he was fantastic.  Near the end of our meal we complimented him for his serving skills and he told us it was his first day serving alone.  We were shocked he was a true pro and made our experience at the restaurant an unforgettable one.  We also complimented the manager Ken on the classiness and attentiveness of his staff, especially and he was friendly and grateful for the compliment and gave us some history on the restaurant which was a nice touch.  I highly recommend trying Strip house when u are in Las Vegas.   We found out they have one not far from home so we plan to check it out someday.

Unfortunately this steakhouse leaves much to be desired.  After two previous nights of simply divine dining at two other high dollar steakhouses, this one really pales in comparison.

I had the petite filet mignon and lobster tail.  As soon as I bit into it, I thought...wow...I have had better surf-n-turf at Outback!  I expect much better from a high dollar steakhouse.  

It also should have been a clear sign when the server brought out steak sauce.  I am a big fan of Mastro's, Morton's, StripSteak, Fleming's....now that being said, these other places NEVER bring out steak sauce unrequested.  They apparently stand behind the flavor and quality of their steaks without the need for "doctoring" it.  Strip House obviously knows their steaks need some "help".

I do want to point out that the service was excellent.  Unfortunately, I don't go to restaurants for their service alone.  A girl's gotta eat and this girl has champagne taste.  I won't be going here anymore.  If you want to spend the money, forget this place and go to one of the other steakhouses that I mentioned earlier.

Had dinner here tonight, party of 6.  My first thought was that the table (not a booth) was a bit small.  Felt a bit cramped.  After placing our drink order, we had some appetizers.  Crab cakes (awesome!), Caesars salad (so-so), roasted beets w/asparagus (nice flavors, but beets were paper thin!), bacon w/arugula (yum!).  I felt the waiter wasn't very attentive to our drinks, as the glasses were empty for a while before he offered us another round...really, a big pet peeve of mine.  On to the entrees.  Bone in ribeye was perfection.  Seared tuna was very generous and as expected.  Filets were spot on.  But the most spectacular dish of the evening was the truffle mac 'n cheese.  OMFG!!!!!  To die for!!!!!!  Tried the goose fat potatoes.  Just ok, a bit heavy.  Whipped potatoes were good.  Everything was satisfying, but yeah, keep dreaming about that mac 'n cheese.  I think I will go back JUST for that!  Over all, great meal, a bit pricey, and did I mention the mac 'n cheese?!?

I didn't think this place is anything special. The restaurant wasn't even busy and the server seem disoriented. 
The food was just less then good, not worth paying $40-60 for it.  
The only nice dish was the spicy tuna tartar. 
I would recommend Gordon Ramsey Steak, or Stack if you're looking for a nice steak dinner in the area.

So I came here for a random steak dinner, 1 hour before they were closing. I ordered the 16oz steak, pur√©e of potatoes, and saut√©ed garlic green beans. (All meals are a la carte) My friends got the filet mignon. When our steaks arrived they were charred horribly pretty much burnt. (I think we upset the cooks with our tardiness) the food was also very salty...we ordered the lobster bisque which was good and Caesar salad but who messes up salad. I was disappointed especially with the amount of money we spent $300 for 3 people....spend your money at Caesars palace buffet, more bang for your buck.

Exceptional steakhouse, such a wonderful dinning experience. Great ambience, delicious food and awesome service. We ordered salt pepper crusted filet, salmon, miso broccoli and saut√©ed spinach. Everything simply delicious. I'm not a dessert person but since it was my friends birthday I Ordered their 24 layer chocolate cake, Yes 24 layers!!! It was to die for. I highly Recommend this place and will definitely be back!

Great environment and the food was amazing. I go to. Head a few times a year and I'm literally mad that I haven't been here before. Italian chop salad and filet is a must! Daniel was our server and he was amazing, top service possible!
This is the 3rd time my Wife and I have been here and have yet to be disappointed. Service is nothing shy of amazing. As for the food, Bone in Ribeye medium rare. BEYOND BUENO!!!

Absolutely amazing! Wish I could give 10 stars. The BEST steak I've ever had. Our waiter was Carlos and he was awesome! Everything we ordered was delicious and the atmosphere was so nice and romantic. An absolute must when you're in Vegas! We will definitely be back!

This place was amazing, totally on point with EVERYTHING!
The decor was so very cool; very dim light, red wallpaper with raised velvety designs (with silhouettes of posing ladies), different sizes and shapes of nude and semi-nude  pin-ups from the 20's and such, back-lit frames, all just very cool. 
Our cocktails were all interesting and delicious  
 I can't say enough about how delicious our food was; we all shared steaks, spicy potatoes, asparagus, and creamed spinach. Everything was "eyes-rolling-back-in-your-head" good! 
The most impressive part was our server, I believe his name was John. To begin he smoothly explained all of the specials in intricate detail and made everything sound so appealing. Throughout the meal he checked on us consistently and was consistently easy to find. He seemed to have everything flawlessly under control. 
The only snafu ( a very tiny one) was that one of the food runners brought out my friend's steak very, VERY rare (they had ordered medium). John was there within maybe less than a minute (so on point) to check on our meals and once informed of the issue immediately took it away to have it fixed. He returned with it quickly along with a different side dish (as he had taken away the plate my friend had with her sides on it).  
At the end of our meal, we were treated to the most delicious and enormous piece of chocolate cake I've ever seen, along with vanilla ice cream and berries. We also enjoyed the caramelized banana tart. We were too full to finish them but OH MY GOD they were amazing. 
Definitely not something I could afford all the time, but definitely a place I would save up to splurge on. I was so impressed with everything.
AMAZING FILET!  Outstanding service!  And I'm pretty damn picky.

Good, not great.  Price was a bit high vs. food quality.  A cricket (yes the insect) showed up on our table right after we finished eating.  (Posting a photo.)

3 stars is being generous.

Well we used to love this place. My husband ordered his steak medium rare, it came med well, we told the server. They made it again, it took a good 20 min, I was done with my meal by the time it came. When we were charged full price for the mistake, we asked for the manager. He came, we explained the situation, he says "did you eat it?" 
And left. We will never return sadly :(

What a sexy place. My companion and I were staying at PH and figured we'd grab some dinner before seeing Peepshow. We were there right after New Years and Vegas generally was a ghost town. Our server was this cute girl from Utah who pretty much made the experience. I want to say her name was Mallory. Super sweet, super attentive.

The chef sent out an amuse bouche which I always love. It was a soup of some kind in a shot glass. We started off with a tuna tartare app and I ordered raw oysters. If I had one complaint, it was that the oysters were tiny. Personally, if I couldn't serve amazing oysters in terms of size and quality, I'd take them off the menu. The tartare was great.

We both ordered steak. My companion having the filet and I had the surf n turf. The lobster portion was small but oh so delicious. The steaks were cooked to perfection. Some how we were tricked into ordering dessert which was this gigantic chocolate cake for two. Very good - we had to take it back to the room. It made for wonderful drunk eating at 3am later that night.

Strip House offers sexy atmosphere, good service, and excellent food for the right price. When the check arrived I was pleasantly surprised.
My fiance and I came to Strip House Las Vegas for a romantic dinner and had a great time!! Service was perfect, and food was AMAZING!!! Best creamed spinach in the world!!

Yes it's a little pricey. Yes you should more than likely make reservations. Yes you should plan on spending at least two hours here. But oh boy... so worth it. Get the steak. Get the steak. Get the steak. You really don't need a side to go with it but if you do, try the potatoes raminade something. I'm not fancy but I know food. I also know good service and as I'm watching the room and listening to other servers, it's clear -that because it was my birthday -they sat me in the area with the best waiter. His name is John. Please make sure you sit in John's area. And make sure you listen to him.  He knows what he's doing. And tip him well. He makes this restaurant run...  that's all I got to say about that !  Happy eating !

Came on a Tuesday Night (literally just got back to the room lol) we were out for my buddies fianc√© birthday, service was top notch! We started in the bar while we waited for a couple of our party to arrive, the bar tender was fantastic and very knowledgeable and made a great drink, once at our table the Gentleman who served us was outstanding! Gave us plenty of time to get settled and talk over the menu which I like, I hate when you just open the menu at a new place and they're already pushing appetizers, he came back told us about a few specials and took our order. We got the Bacon which was good but not great, a special appetizer they were doing with goat cheese wrapped prosciutto with a lil spicy kick to it which were good and we got Oysters on the Half Shell that were awesome! Entrees and Sides were Top Notch, I ate probably the best Rib Eye Steak I have ever had, 20oz Bone In, crispy char on the outside with a perfect medium on the inside! Seriously I will be back just for that steak! The rest of our party had the Porterhouse for 2 which they loved, the 8oz Filet was terrific and our dieting friend loved the chicken! The Romanoff Potaoes are very good but the star of the sides we got was the Mac and Cheese! Give me that Rib Eye and a plate of Mac and Cheese and I'm good! Anytime I'm in Vegas I will be coming here!! From Hostesses to busboys (my water was never less than half empty ) managers the waitstaff and whoever cooked my steak tonight you were AWESOME!!!

Of course the food is wonderful! You get what you pay for.
The SERVICE, is what I'm talking about. My glass could never get close to low. The bread basket, same thing.
You want a really great dinner, this is the place.
Potatoes romanof,  filet and lobster, roasted garlic bulb, awesome across the board.
I don't even eat steak sauce, the waiter put it on the table. If I could buy this I would use steak sauce, you must try.
This place needs 6 stars.
Great SERVICE!
Almost fogot to give my waiter, Scott, credit for the excellent service, that made me want to write this review in the first place.

Perfect night. Quick seating in a great booth even though I was just with my wife for her birthday. I presume my request of a good booth with my reservation helped. The decor of the restaurant was very fun while also being tasteful. The booth we sat in was very comfortable, and we also loved the wallpaper that happened to match their napkins.

Service was quick and very professional and helpful. The only thing I would remove points for was being told they had a certain special (a bone-in rib-eye for two) only to be told they had run out when I chose to order that item. 

Wine selection was excellent, although a bit on the pricey side in terms of bottles. We didn't order appetizers, however, the chef sent us each a shot glass of a smoked potato soup garnished with herb infused oil which was a great free treat and tasted amazing. 

The steaks were perfectly cooked and I only wish all steaks would be cooked with the same crust these are. We had the bone-in rib-eye and bone-in New York, both perfectly cooked to medium-rare. The New York was surprisingly thick which allowed more of the aging flavor to come out, whereas the rib-eye featured the marbling of the meat.

For sides, we also got the goose fried potatoes and black truffle spinach. I wouldn't get the potatoes again, they only tasted like a fancy tater-tot although the rosemary was a nice touch. The spinach, on the other hand, is far and away the best spinach I have ever tasted, and likely the best side I have ever had. 

We chose not to order dessert on account of having no room, but the chef was still nice enough to send us a plate of candied pecans with happy birthday written on the edge as an extra surprise for my wife.

If you want steak in Vegas, there's no reason not to go here.
First time at this restaurant.  Daniel did a great job at taking care of us, made sure we were well taken care off.  We will be back because of the service he provided, oh and that porterhouse too!
We had Thanksgiving dinner here last year and it was excellent. This is a very classy, fairly high end place with great food and service!
Great ambience and killer martini. Steak was a little over done, but John was a fabulous server. On point service, and definitely knows his shit. Made dinner easy and fun. Thank you!

Spent Valentines here with my hubby and our bff's  who are also married! We got there around 11:00pm and that was excellent because it permitted us to watch a movie first! The food was phenomenal! We had fresh oysters, the prime age rib-eye, filet mignons, shredded twiced baked potatoes, whipped potatoes, calamari, GEESH, and creamed spinach.. I am a bit ashamed because i didn't know we ate so much. Oh geez and not to go without mention they have a fabulous full bar we indulged our selves in 
Coronas, Cognac/ Hen-dog, and Adios Mutha F*#kas!! All tasty and got the body warming. The food was cooked to perfection and the atmosphere was great. 


Our server was Sarah and she was great ! The manager was rude about us being there late, but ill take that up w her boss on Monday! 

$430 tab plus tip close to $500 for the dinner... id say it was worth the flavors and experience!!

I really wanted to like Strip House. They've got a great looking room, and a good reputation.

But the wine selection wasn't that great and the food was just kind of blah. It wasn't a bad meal, but it wasn't an exceptional meal either, and at the price they charge for a hunk of cow, I want my food and wine to blow me away.

Vegas has some exceptional steak houses. Strip House needs to up its game.

Sign me up for the Strip House Train.

This restaurant is tremendous. I've been twice and heartily recommend it. Why?  Because of the steaks. The New York Strip on the bone: there you go, twenty ounces of mouth watering juiciness, broiled to perfection and seasoned to within an inch of its former life, generously coated with coarse salt and potent black pepper. Oh, boy, this is going to be one of the best steaks you've ever had. Sides to go with the steak: the green beans in garlic sauce -- killer -- and the onion shoestrings, made from Spanish Onions and lightly breaded, the ideal companion for your steak. And for dessert? The 24 layer chocolate cake of course. Don't be scared, the layers are thin, and the great thing about it -- it's not that sweet, more of a semi-sweet chocolate... satisfying your desire for something a post meal treat, but allowing you to also remain in the glow of  a perfectly prepared steak.

I've been to four or five steak houses on the Las Vegas Strip and this one is my favorite so far. It isn't cheap, but the best things usually aren't..

Strip House was so good for my girlfriend and I that I had to go back when I had a business dinner in Vegas.  Both times I ordered a New York cut and both times it was cooked to perfection.  The second time I brought my own cab but also ordered a bottle off the list.  They were appreciative and waived the usual $35 corkage... completely unexpected and very appreciated.  Service was perfect.  Oysters perfect although I was surprised we had to ask for horseradish... something which regularly accompanies the cocktail sauce when one orders oysters.  There are so many great restaurants in Vegas that it would be nearly impossible to commit to a specific steakhouse.  Not sure I can go to any other steakhouse.

Very good steak house.  Really enjoyed the food...nice 'stuffy' atmosphere.  Not the type of place I would visit often but enjoyed a fancy meal in a fancy place.  Loses one star for crazy high prices and fact that it is located in planet Hollywood...which is set up more like a mall than a casino...which makes the walk to the restaurant anything but enjoyable.

Had dinner here on a last minute reservation because Stripsteak was booked. I only like to eat steak at somewhat nicer places. Not a snob but just am a little particular about steak. I was staying at Planet Hollywood so figured I would try it. 
Was a pretty good meal service was excellent food was great the menu was nicely laid out with a good selection of cuts of meat and accompaniments. no real complaints just thought for eating a good steak but maybe 3 times a year it hasn't made my top five, but really close.

aged ribeye
goose fat potatoes
red wine
good service
equals one great dinner

Not sure how this place isn't busier- it was amazing! Starting with the cocktail- I got the ruby mule which was a Moscow mule but with red grapefruit added to it- omg! It woke us up with the perfect ginger spiciness! 

Ordered the salmon, was cooked perfectly- the sides were delicious too, mushrooms, potatoes Au gratin and whipped potatoes. The hubbies loved their steaks.

Services was perfect and the espresso creme br√ªl√©e was a nice change from the traditional dessert.

The place is on the second floor of the casino but really nice and swanky as far as decor.

Not much that was wrong with our dinner. First of all the most positive experience we could offer was the staff. Our server knew his menu as well as the chef that created it. Right down to where the animal was raised and how it will be prepared. We prefer restaurants that keep the experience simple. And that was our experience last night. Simple. We arrived and were promptly seated. We were offered a very extensive menu presentation. Every single question we had was thoroughly answered by our server. And the plates that were brought to us were exactly how they were described. We ordered the ahi tuna and chateaubriand. There wasn't a chewy bite on the plate. Sashimi grade ahi and an extremely lean tenderloin. We will definitely be returning!

Too many times people only leave negative reviews. In our case I have no issue taking time out of my day to commend an exceptional employee. Our server was Billy. I suggest you add his name to your future reservations.

Never have I been so happy at being disappointed by the name of an establishment.

As I put my dollar bills away and sat down for my meal, I knew I was in for a treat. I had spotted a waiter bringing some food to a nearby table and damn did it look delicious.

Seriously...anything better than a steakhouse? (For you vegans it is like a great salad bar with meat instead of lettuce.)

So for starters I tried their lobster bisque. This delectable mix of Maine lobster & red pepper ravioli was a match made in heaven. Wow! Absolutely perfect...or as close to perfect as you can get with this treat. I wanted a second bowl. Of course I am a glutton, so maybe that was just my chunky belly speaking.

Moving on, I then tried some lump crab cakes that had potato salad, corn salsa & remoulade stuffed inside. I am a sucker for crab cakes and these hit the spot. Not since my visit to Baltimore was I so pleased with the crab cakes I had been given to inhale.

Then the main event.

The 20 oz. bone in (of course) New York Strip medium well. I ordered some sides of black truffle creamed spinach & sauteed wild mushrooms to compliment the massive steak.

Holy cow...literally. This blessed piece of meat was made to perfection and I surely wiped that plate clean. The 2 aforementioned sides were also great. I went to loosen my belt, but had realized I had not worn one. So instead I just unbuckled my top button. Hey I need to make room for dessert.

I enjoyed a slice of their layered chocolate cake and a cappuccino. Like a good smoke after a romp between the sheets, this sweet treat really ended a perfect night of dining out.

Do I recommend this place? Well remember those dollar bills that I had tucked away earlier? They wound up in the front pants of the chef.

What a great dining experience, enjoyed the decor & atmosphere, attentive awesome wait staff, we got the porterhouse for 2 it was the most delicious unbelievable steak I've had in a long time!  You won't be disappointed!

This was an interesting experience for me since I do not eat steak.  I was a little caught off guard by all the naked photos on the wall - not something I'm usually accustomed to staring at while eating.  I moved to a different seat to avoid the photos actually.  I had calamari as an appetizer and I have to say it's the best calamari I've had.  Absolutely excellent.  For my "entree" I ordered side dishes since I just can't eat steak.  My aunt had the filet and enjoyed it.  I had mac and cheese (good), asparagus (good) and strip potatoes (good).  I would honestly come here again just for the calamari - it was that good!

Dinner for two was an ok, decent experience but at the price and with all the other steak house options in Vegas, I wouldn't go back. Everything was a little underwhelming. Nothing was terrible but nothing was amazing either. Bloody mary's were insipid, like tomato juice with a dash of tabasco. First appetizers were Lobster bisque with  Israeli couscous and the scallops. The Bisque was very good, rich full flavor but the couscous was at best a distraction. It didn't add anything good to the soup. One scallop was amazing. It had a deep heavy char and full rich flavor. The other scallop was ok but not nearly as charred or as good as the other. Had the one not been so good, the other would have probably been fine. You could not look at the plate and not notice the glaring difference in how the two were cooked, but it was still delivered to me mis matched. We split a caesar salad. It was good but way over dressed. The croutons were seasoned with paprika and distracted more than they complimented. Too  much cheese too.  Steaks have an odd crust. It's good and tasty but not what I expect on a quality dry aged steak. Felt like camouflage.  It just wasn't for me. Also, the steak was not evenly cooked. One end was a little more done than the other.  Au Poivre sauce was rich and tasty. The NY Strip Oscar was good but a little undercooked, the crab portion generous and well executed. Sides really bothered me. Truffled creamed spinach and Potatoes Romanoff were just so over the top  that the the main ingredients were totally lost. The spinach could easily have been any leafy vegetable or even news paper. It was just a thick rich gooey overload of cream and truffle overkill. Same problem with the potatoes. Just too much cheese. It was cheese on cheese on cheese covered with melted cheese.  The famous 20some layer chocolate cake looked amazing and the very top layer of chocolate was really good. Otherwise it was dry and heavy. It's a giant slice for 2 or more people to easily share but it's not good cake at all. It's a lot like one of the giant cake monstrosities at Cheesecake Factory or a similar chain. The wine was excellent. They have a "bucket list" of wines by the glass that I plan on returning for but I'll just have that at the bar. I don't think I'd eat there again.  I do get the whole steak house experience and LOVE a decadent over the top meal but they lost track of flavor and balance along the way.

I am so happy our other reservations didn't work out because it led our party here and this dinner was nothing less than incredible!! Our server was probably the most impressive out of all the food and drinks - he was so on it, knew everything that was in the food, how it was prepared, gave amazing recommendations without giving you the most expensive items on the menu, and lastly, had the entire wine list memorized down pat and gave us a wine recommendation since we drink wine rarely. We ordered the New York strip, filet, black truffle creamed spinach and whipped mashed potatoes. Everything was 10/10. We didn't have room for dessert, but wish we had! Thank you for an amazing experience, we will definitely be back when we return to Las Vegas!

Ate here for a bachelor party.  NY Strip cooked medium- rare had great flavor but was a little tough (not overly so, but more than some other prime strips I've had).  The mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and macaroni and cheese were all very good. Great environment, suitable for a bunch of guys or a date with your wife.  Not stuffy like Prime at the Bellagio, but not as laid-back as Stripsteak in Mandalay Bay.

Delicious!  Was it expensive? Compare to what, Ramsay's in Paris Hotel? Not at all.  Ramsay's was good, but to me, Strip House blew them away.   I had the long bone to share with my daughter and we both love it.    The food, the service, the presentation was outstanding.

This place had one of the best steaks I have ever had. We got to dinner late, since it is vegas but they were still open! Thank goodness because this place was phenomenal! I ordered the New York Strip and a side of Mashed Potatoes along with a home made Mac and Cheese. Medium rare of course, and when my Steak came out it was perfect! Juicy, with a slight pink center. The crust that was on that steak was delicious, and the sides were cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were silky and the mac and cheese was rich and you could taste truffle oil! I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone without  a budget because the pricing is a little steep but worth every penny in my opinion. Ill be back for sure. Cheers!

Everything was great, we had apps, steaks, salmon (my wife says it was the best she's ever had), sides, even the garlic french fries were amazing. My favorite was the crab topping (on the steak) with the bleu cheese sauce. Can't wait to go back.

We did spend $400 though... without dessert.

Visiting the Strip House is a reminder to me of two things. How much I love a good steak house, and how amazing it is to experience professional waiters!

I've been to this restaurant on several occasions, and I walked through the door knowing pretty much what I wanted. After five minutes talking to my waiter Brian C, I had completely changed my order. 

He recommended the Prosciutto Rolls, prosciutto wrapped around fluffy goat cheese, with shaved parmesan and spicy balsamic. Without hyperbole, it's the best appetizer I've eaten. I also ordered the dry aged rib eye and the spicy au gratin potatoes. 

Every recommendation was spot on. The food, the service, the wine (Arrowood Cabernet FTW!) were all spectacular!

This is what makes visiting a high end restaurant well worth the cost. I highly recommend the Strip House, and even more, Brian!

WOW!!! So glad my husband wanted to eat here! Unfortunately neither of us actually got a steak, but what we did get was amazing! The hostess was very friendly, our waitress was very attentive and patient, and the entire wait staff was always around to help us out without standing over us. We were sat in a coveted corner booth, which was a really great surprise. We were greeted with a Watermelon juice and Mint  "shot" (I don't remember what the waiter called it) as a welcome from the chef, which was followed up by a selection of bread and the largest ramekin of butter ever! Paula Deen would be jealous lol. 

For our first course, my husband and I shared the most delicious crab cake of our lives! I was not feeling so great at this point (heat stroke?), so I took it slow, but I think it worked out in my favor lol. I got to taste all of the elements of the crab cake and really savor it, it was so good! The mustardy potatoes they paired with the crab cake were a bit intense by themselves, but paired with the crab cake they were really good. 

For our main course we both ordered the Crispy Skin Organic Chicken Breast. I know, why come to a steak place for chicken?! Well my husband was all set on a steak but changed his mind last minute, and as I said I was not feeling so good so chicken seemed like my best option when I ordered. So glad we ordered that dish! My husband ordered his chicken with crispy onions and I ordered the garlic fries. My fries were a little over done (it cost them a star), but my husband's crispy onions were amazing! Not greasy like onion rings - very light and delicious. And they served the chicken with a chicken au jus which made it that much better. Sadly we were too full to try the famous chocolate cake, but there's always a next time! 

Overall a really great experience! The best part was that there were no kids in sight! I know it's Vegas, but omg we saw kids EVERYWHERE! It was nice to have an adults only restaurant for once! We will definitely be back for the cake and some of the sides!

Saw all the positive reviews and wanted to give this place a try for my friend's birthday. Huge disappointment. I've been to plenty of steakhouses to be able to compare and this place did not hit the mark. My boyfriend and I both offered the bone in ribeye, medium rare and it came out almost medium. There was a good crust on the outside but the inside was not as we ordered. Maybe it was an off night. Don't think we will be trying this again.

I wasn't really impressed with Strip Steak. We started with the garlic bread with melted Gorgonzola cheese. It was pretty good, albeit not a whole lot of melted Gorgonzola cheese. Where's the cheese... apparently not on my plate. We also ordered the jumbo sea scallops with edamame succotash. This was a great dish. The sea scallops were seared to perfection and the succotash was an interesting base. We each got the 10oz filet. I ordered mine with the bordelaise sauce and she got her with the bernaise sauce. Here's the issue. She specifically asked for her steak to be cooked medium-well, no pink and butterflied. What she got was something more on the medium-rare side. My steak was good, cooked as I wanted it and tasty. I ordered the raspberry tea and she had the striphouse cosmo. Well I took one taste of the drink and couldn't take another. Have you ever tasted glucola or had a diabetes screen? Glucola is the sweetened liquid you drink for these tests and it is nasty....well in a word that describes my raspberry tea. I wanted to throw it up. 

For what we paid and what we got I wouldn't go back. I like the hip vibe, but for me it's all about the service and food...oh did you see me mention anything about service? No, well that's because the service sucked!!

for a $100/person dinner (with 2 appetizers and a side - drinks excluded), pretty disappointing. 

ordered the chef's special filet mignon (6oz) and lobster plate. asked that the steak be cooked medium rare, but it was weirdly dry. the color when i cut the steak was purplish pink, and there was no blood. i like a bloody steak for the moisture and taste. they may have grilled it correctly but drained the blood. the steak was way overseasoned and caked with whatever they powdered it with. i found myself scraping the burnt seasoning off the steak. furthermore, the meat itself had a weird processed taste to it. needless to say, i was not impressed. 

the lobster was alright. it could've been served hotter though. they may have left the food sitting in the kitchen before serving it. 

friends ordered the crabcake, calimari, and garlic mashed potatoes as well. standard fare. nothing shined through particularly. 

if strip house were a stripper, it would be a stretch-marks-on-belly, and flabby 45-year-old who thinks she deserves kate upton money. 

if you want an expensive, tasty steak dinner in a "sexy" and sleek environment in vegas, go across the street to the cosmo and hit up STK instead.
Love the ribeye. This steak is perfect. not the greatest service, but the meal made up for it. Everyone at the table got a steak and all were very happy. Its all about the ribeye.

Went on Sunday evening. Had reservations but still had to wait ten minutes. I ordered asparagus, mushrooms, and broccolini. Steak was good. A solid four out of five. Veggies were delicious. Service was excellent.

5 stars for the service.  Our waiter was friendly and we constantly had our drinks replenished, etc.  As we should!  Considering we are at a $$$$ restaurant, I expect nothing less than extraordinary service.  

I've never eaten so late at a fancy steakhouse, although we are in the city that never sleeps, so I don't know why that should surprise me.  So note, if you want to eat at a nice establishment after a show gets out or something, and it's like 10PM, consider making reservations here.  I think this would be a great place for special occasions as well, romantic evening for two who enjoy steak, inquire within.

I will forewarn you, I'm not a big beef or steak eater, in fact, I think the last steak I ate was in 2005.  My critique is on their salmon dish.  It was cooked to perfection, that is, it wasn't dry, it was perfectly moist and fell off with each fork swipe as it should.  The flavor however, was not so memorable for me.  I thought it was bland, really, and with the creamed sauce whatever it was, I still couldn't really make out where they were going with this.  So pardon me, for ordering the fish entree at a steakhouse, but even so, I thought for the amount of $ I was going to fork over, my stomach should be happy.  We tried a variety of their sides because we had a large group and could do family style.  I thought the majority of the menu was all potatoed, creamed, or did I mention potatoed?  I suppose this is typical of steakhouse sides.. but I wasn't utterly blown away by the flavor either.  I think my favorite item was the creamed spinach, though my friend argued it was overly garlicky.  But that was the only thing that actually tickled my tastebuds. 

We were there for a special occasion, so our group ordered their famous 24-layer chocolate cake and I will just say they don't lie about the 24 layers.  This thing could stand in a room on its own.  I noticed on their website they say you can order this and have it shipped out to you for $100.   I wouldn't say it was THAT good that I would need to eat it again.. but it was interesting.  I think if you're some crazy chocolate-aficionado, probably more your thing and sharing is caring.

Note, I'm also not the regular 5-star michelin-type restaurant frequenter.. going to these places is once in a blue moon if any.. and perhaps I expected too much from all the hype this place was getting.
Super fun, super sexy date night.  5 star food, 5 star prices.

Food was amazing however the service was the absolute worst service I have ever had in a 5 star restaurant.  Food came out before the cocktails and the server could only say "I don't make the drinks".

Best steak house experience ever! Our waiter, John was very attentive and detail oriented. He took the time to explain many house offerings without rushing. We ordered some of the items that he presented, and were absolutely delighted!
My compliments to the chef, but mostly I'd like to extend my deepest thanks to John for making this a dining experience to remember!  I'd recommend The Strip to everyone looking for the consummate steakhouse dining experience in Las Vegas!
We will most definitely look forward to returning on our next visit!
Thanks again!

I came here for the famous 24-Layer Chocolate Cake and overall it was good.

The cake is dense and it's nice to have the layers of cake with the rich ganache.  It's tough for cakes to be moist, but this one did a pretty good job of that.  It also wasn't too sugary-sweet like a lot of other cakes are.  The issue I had with this cake was that it wasn't chocolaty enough.  I could taste the cocoa, but I was expecting a bit more with the decadence or richness of the cake, especially with all the ganache that was there.  I saw this featured on the Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" and I can't say this would go anywhere on my list of the best things I've ever eaten...it was good, but not great.  Many other reviewers mention the same thing and I should have listened because they were right.

The d√©cor of this place is fantastic and also has great service.  We also tried a Caesar Salad, which was good and their Duck Fat Fried Potato, which was really good.  I would definitely come back here to try one of their steak options, but I don't think I'd come back for the cake since there are so many other options out there for incredible chocolate desserts.

This was a nice steak house that any man would Love! I took Mike for his birthday and lets just say he enjoy himself. I think any man would appreciate a good steak! The ambiance was so nice it was like being in a cool lounge with a great steak, lol! Its a Must Go!

Amazing place!! Went here yesterday for my boyfriends birthday and starting from the very beginning they provided wonderful service and delicious food. Every single employee we encountered was friendly and ready to help us with anything. We both got the New York strip, lobster, and goose fat potatoes and it was all so delicious. Our server was awesome and attentive and when we were too full for dessert, he still went out of his way to bring my boyfriend a small piece of brownie with a candle. I would definitely come back here when I come back to Vegas again. 5 star experience! :)

I was here for dinner on a Monday night with co-workers because we were in town for a convention. 
The decor is kind of interesting....the whole restaurant is covered with black and white pics of strippers from the 50's. 
I was with a group of 6. We made reservations in advance and were sat immediately. Our waitress was very nice....but very s l o w. 
Our drinks took forever and she would randomly disappear so we didn't really see too much of her. 
I started with the Caesar Salad. It was your average caesar salad but it was topped with paprika croutons which gave it a little spice...I enjoyed that. I don't eat meat so I asked the waitress if they could make a vegetarian pasta for me which she said wasn't a problem. 
The pasta was surprisingly delicious! It was linguini tossed in a light lemon cream sauce topped with fresh asparagus, mushrooms, tomatoes and peas. It was very flavorful yet light and creamy. I loved it. 
We ordered a variety of sides for the table to share:
Black Truffled Creamed Spinach- a little too creamy for me but still good
Garlic Herb French Fries- can't go wrong here
Sauteed Wild Mushrooms- great!
Sauteed Green Beans w/Garlic- excellent
Potatoes Romanoff- dry, crumbly, and didn't taste very good

The sides were good, but I felt for the price they could have tasted a lot better. Two of my co-wokers ordered steak which they said was decent, but came out lukewarm. For $50 a plate I think the steak should be served hot don't you??
Anyways, I was just really disappointed in the service. Our waitress didn't pay much attention to us and everything took forever. For the prices you pay here, everything should have been perfect. 
Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

My girlfriend and I came to the Strip House for a great dinner, and we were not disappointed. Starting off with our server Chris, which was fantastic. The rib-eye was amazing and the 24 layer chocolate cake was out of this world.

Excellent service! Started with the lobster bisque. For my entre, the filet and lobster with a side of the potatoes romanoff. I wish I could remember the martini the waiter recommemded because it was good. Priced about the same as every other Vegas steakhouse....but come here for the quality and service. Had dinner before watching PeepShow (very convenient, next to the theater).

It was our first night in town and wanted to a good steak. We were directed here by the concierge. We asked for a good steak place where you didn't have to dress up. When we got there, we found that we may have been underdressed. After a double look from the hostess, we were seated in the back.  It was about 7 PM on Friday night and the place was near empty (should have been a warning sign).

Drinks - The waiter was a bit slow to come over but when he did we ordered cocktails. Drinks were watered down.  When I asked for regular water it tasted like it came from the bottom of the ice machine. I had to buy bottled water. I later tasted local water and it was fine. Another instance where they played the customer. 

Staff - The waiter was not unpleasant, just not pleasant. Other waiters there seemed to have better personalities.
