Food - I ordered my steak medium rare but it came out medium. I would have sent it back but everyone else at the table had their food and were eating. I find that unless it is uneditable it makes no sense to send back as everyone would be finished eating by the time you get your food again. One of the other guys in our party ordered the "surf and turf" and said it was perfect, another had rib eye and said it was average. Everything is al a carte, even the sauces. We had the creamed spinach with bacon and it was probably my favorite for the night.

Everything in the place is an upsell and pricy.  I don't mind paying for good food and service, but this place left me regretting the money I had to put out.

The steaks are phenomenal and way too large for a normal person. The highlight was a tiny glass of potato soup with a drizzle of green leek puree. I wish I had a bowl of this delicious soup. 

Beautiful wine collection.

Excellent service and a beautiful place. Very reminiscent of a classic Las Vegas steak house. 

Would definitely visit again.

This is a great steakhouse. I have been raving about it and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good steak.  We got the New York Strip and both agreed that it was by far one of the best steaks we've ever had. It's a little pricey, especially if you have a few drinks with dinner, but it is well worth it and I will definitely be coming back!

The only positive for this evening was the service. What one would expect from a place like this. 

However I came for the food and this was a major let down. 

I ordered the day special filet mignon medium rare and even just touching it with the knife could tell it was not. It was rare, almost blue in the middle. How this got by the chef is disappointing. 

I sent it back and a few minutes later the waitress said that it won't be long it's back in the oven. Now I'm very fussy when it comes to my steak and reheating a steak that's already rested, cooled down and cut in half is not acceptable for a $60 piece of steak. Absolutely changes the texture. 

I ended up cancelling the order. Surprisingly though not even an apology. 

Another surprise was that my wife was unable to order any fresh juice as all they had was from a bottle or tap! Finally, not very busy and yet the seats they gave us were very uncomfortable. There were plenty of seats which had cushioning/padding. 

All in all a very disappointing meal and would not recommend.

I read about the 24 layer cake on other people's reviews and I figured, hey, I'm in Vegas and it also happens to be my birthday, so why not. Luckily, the restaurant did take out, so I was able to just get my cake and take it back to our room, since we were also staying at PH. The cake cost $16 for a slice, but I swear it could feed a 3rd world country. My boyfriend and I both dove into the 24 layers, only to be taken down by the massive slice. Sadly, we only finished about half of it. I had plans on eating some for breakfast the next morning, but we had to check out at 4:30 a.m. to catch our flight and since I was so half asleep, I left the cake on the table. 

We will definitely have to try conquering the cake next time we are in Vegas (and based on the reviews, I would like to try a whole meal here too)!

I just had an amazing dining experience with Scott this evening . His recommendations on food , cocktails , and wine pairings were no less than superb . I had the New York Strip and the black truffle spinach that paired fantastically with a full bodied  Cabernet that he suggested . The meal ended on a high note with the Baked Alaska , another one of his recommendations . I will definitely suggest this restaurant to my fellow colleagues .

The food and service is nothing less than outstanding at this restaurant. The prices are expensive but are relative for a steak house. I highly recommend the Buffalo Milk Burrata which was fantastic pairing with the balsamic and creative squash. We then ordered a 40 Oz tomahawk rib eye served table side which is out of this world. Our other guests ordered the lobster pasta, white asparagus and potatoes Romanoff side, all which they claimed were also very appetizing. The evening dinner service ambiance is amiable. The location is fairly hidden on the level above the casino in the planet hollywood, and my only suggestion is if you didn't know this is a steak house, the sign visible to guests on the casino floor just reads "strip house" implying it might be something different frkm a restaurant.

I went with my fiancee and another couple, they split up our salads to share and even split up our steak as we requested without issue. Service was very good though the wait staff could be a little less attentive to be honest. 

Every course was very good and though pricey, it was worth the cost. My major negatives would be the dark lighting could be improved and they pack tables in to get as many customers as possible, a pet peeve of mine.

Would definitely go back to.

Level of service did not exactly match the prices, even for busy Vegas hotel standards. We had better service for a third of the price at Holsteins across The Strip and at other less expensive places. Overall, we had a good time, but mainly due to good company :)

I made reservations for my girlfriend's bday and I even received a phone call confirming the reservation and asking if there was a special occasion. They did do one thing special and that was to write happy birthday on the plate they served the piece of cake I ordered for us. Unfortunately, that was the end of the good part.

The food and service were not what we expected, and we are by no means high maintenance! She ordered the lobster linguine and almost chipped a tooth on a nickel-sized piece of shell! Our waiter, who disappeared for a while, didn't even apologize or offer any comps when I called attention to the shell, which was very disappointing. The guy who cleared our table spilled butter sauce and nearly got it on my shoe. Others at nearby tables seemed to have more engaging and better service.

I make it a point to visit a nice steakhouse when I go to Vegas. This place is not worth the money. Yes it's nice, but for the price they charge I expect to be blown away. The filet mignon was amazing! However I found the bone marrow and the tuna poppers appy too rich and oily. The potato pur√©e trio side was decent, but not amazing. The ambiance is nothing special. In my opinion skip over this place and head to the Paris to Gordon Ramsey's STK. it's worth the money. I was there with a party of 5 and we all agreed. Amazing cuts of steak, but nothing else is impressive here.

A group of friends and I stayed at Planet Hollywood Westgate for NYE's weekend and we chose The Strip House cause 1) it was conveniently located on the premises 2) reviews were excellent here on Yelp. (Thanks Yelpers) & 3) we wanted to have an excellent last dinner of the year. They accommodated our group of 10 nicely. We had an awesome waiter, Andrew. He was helpful with what was on the menu and I almsot believed that he was the one who created the menu. He memorized that menu down to a T with all of the night's specials. We started off with two of the Seafood Plateau appetizer. This is based on market price so it's worth it if you're a seafood lover and all of us were. Everything was fresh and good. I got the 10 oz. filet mignon, medium well with a butterfly cut. The sides are table shared sides (if you want to, that is). The side I got to share with the table was the Black Truffle Cream Spinach. Both dishes were delicious! I pretty much cleaned up the plate. It was worth every penny spent. Oh and I can't leave out that the table got a slice of the restaurant's infamous 24-layer cake. It was super rich in chocolate and milk would have helped out a lot. Ten people and we couldn't finish that single slice.

The place is a bit on the high end but that's what you get with a steakhouse. Let's just say our ten person bill was 2 bills short of a grand.  

Overall, I give this place 5 stars for service, food, and atmosphere and of course the great friends that made it even better.

Phenomenal steaks in a cool environment with vintage pinups lining the walls. Very accommodating staff that was attentive to a large group.

My 20 oz. bone-in ribeye was cooked to perfection which seems to be hard to do these days. The sides were great such as the creamed spinach and the green beans as well.

1920's naked pin up girls on the walls and steak?  i am so there!

was in vegas for a conference, and night out to dinner featured this restaurant located in the planet hollywood.  
service was fast and friendly...but the waitress just kept pushing stuff...'everyone else is getting an appetizer...do you want one too?'...oh, peer pressure always works.  
i got the bibb lettuce salad...which sounds healthy, except it was covered in a good 2000 calories of bacon and dressing...which made it exceptionally tasty.
my lobster pasta was awesome.  (now, i was going out on someone else's credit card and had twinges of guilt....otherwise, i totally would have gotten the amazing looking steak!)  the sides are not a waste of time...i would recommend the beans.  and the onion rings (if you want to feel like you just greased up your entire body).  desserts...mmmm...we should have started here...and when they tell you that the cheesecake it meant for sharing...yes...you could share it among the whole restaurant, as it was the size of my head.

overall bill was way too much...but hey, i wasn't paying.

3 days later, i am still attempting to digest everything i ate....

Me and my significant other are not big "steak" eaters; but our time in Vegas was meant to have lots of fun, spend tons of dollars, and to enjoy ourselves, more than usual at home. My aunt asked me what I would prefer eating before our show at the Mirage (LOVE). I told her that anything her and her husband chooses is fine. She ended up setting up reservations at this Steak House...

As we walked in the d√©cor had pictures of women in random places, images of different body parts and the most interesting wall paper. 

The menu was short and sweet and the "specials" that night included twelve raw oysters that we could not resist! After receiving our appetizers, the chef gave us a sample of their potato soup. The soup was amazing but, I wanted to save my stomach for the meal that I've been dying to try. 

The oysters were PERFECT. Size, shape, taste, temperature, everything about them was PERFECTO. We also have the lobster bisque dip with garlic bread, which was delicious. 

Main meal: Main meal consisted of prime rib, Ahi Tuna Salad, 22 oz steak (forgot which kind) and wine. FOOD was amazing. I can't accentuate anymore how great the food taste. 

Service: Service was on top of my list; I've never been to a restaurant were my glass was never half full; someone was always there to fill our glasses and take away our plates. 

Never the less, I give this restaurant five stars, their service, d√©cor, food quality and location was all up to my expectations.

I would totally give this place 5 stars if it weren't for the terrible service when we first arrived.  We'd made a 7:30pm reservation for my birthday before the Backstreet Boys concert.  Upon arrival we were told they were just prepping our table and it would be a few minutes because they were running behind.  They offered bar seating while we waited but there wasn't room,  however a high top table was.  We ordered our drinks and after 15 minutes of waiting the gal came back and said it would be another 5-10 minutes because the table still wasn't ready.  We explained we had a concert to get to so time was critical.  After 5 minutes they sat us at a table that had been prepared and vacant the entire time we were there.  It was clear we'd been lied to and I was not happy!  Luckily enough our waiter Ricky was top notch,  the food was fantastic and the service was unbeatable.  I had the  shrimp cocktail and a ribeye both were A+!  They then brought me the best birthday cake ever and we still made the concert just as the band took the stage.  All in all it was fantastic,  but I'm still under impressed with the hostess!

If I had the ability to give 6 stars, I would.  What a great place.  We were on our way to Jeff Dunham next door and told them that.  I don't know if that had anything to do with the promptness, but lightning fast service. Started with some apps....the lobster bisque and the stuffed prosciutto....fantastic!  Entrees: bleu cheese crusted Wagyu ribeye and the surf and turf, (filet and lobster tail)......off the hook!  One thing that I do not order out very often, is a steak. Mainly because I can cook one better than I usually get served. However, the ribeye was well trimmed and had a great crust on it.  After my dad had removed the lobster meat from the tail, a guy was right there to grab the carcass.  As for the sides.....potatoes Romanoff and the mac and cheese. I like mac and cheese about as much as I like eggs benedict, I will get it about anywhere just because!  Well, as much as I loved the truffle mac from Gordon Ramsey's Steak.....this place was better!  (Sorry Gordo)!  Very creamy! (An adjective I don't like to use)  ....but it was! 

The service needs a column of its own....

The waiter was cool yet very knowledgeable, 2 thumbs for that guy!  All of the table assistants were impeccable too.  The restaurant was elegantly dark and decorated in a roaring 20's look.  

In a nutshell, if you have the scratch to go for about a buck fifty a person for supper, do it!  That was with a $100 bottle of wine.

We walked in at 5pm and were seated immediately. It was pretty slow but it was a Tuesday night. We were seated in an awkward booth, I would've preferred a half booth or a table for a business dinner. 

Service was excellent throughout our meal. My merlot paired well with my ribeye. My coworker ordered the special of the night which was the 6 oz. parmesan crusted filet mignon with a balsamic glaze. I tried some of it and it was ok. The meat was tender, however, I did not enjoy the parmesan which added no appeal to the steak. The balsamic glaze was nice, however, the overpowering pepper killed the flavor of the tender meat. The same with my 12 oz. dry aged ribeye steak which was overcooked and also was over seasoned. This prevented the meat to really shine.

As far as side dishes go, we ordered the split potatoes, potato romanasco, and black truffle creamed spinach. The split potatoes were overcooked and tough to chew. I really enjoyed the potato romanasco and the truffle creamed spinach which were delicious! 

We were too full for dessert and had to forgo on it. Overall, food was ok. However, for the price ($310+ for 4 ppl), I expected higher quality and consistency in cooking and seasoning. I was sorely disappointed.

The food was great and service was ok but came to desert & found hair in the ice cream waitress was nice and kind about it but i saw her show the manager who looked at it and walked past us like it wasn't a big deal... absolutely disgusting and ridiculous never ever going back at least a little sincerity would be kind you are in charge of the damn place the waitress was more professional

Loved their side dishes but i've had a better steak. was quick to get into the lounge but it took forever to get the food. took 30 min to get wine and another 45 to get our food after we ordered. With a $300.00 bill for two people i want good food and service. both were worth $100 at most

I met up with my sister, her husband, and their friends here for dinner before getting ready to go out for the night.  We were afraid that there would be a wait since it looked crowded but we were seated right away.  

They served us complimentary bread and butter while we waited for our entrees.  The bread was a little dry so they tasted as if they weren't fresh.  My sister ordered the filet mignon while I ordered the salmon so we could share.  Both dishes were very good, but I couldn't finish mine because I got so full!

We also ordered the creme brulee and brownie with a scoop of ice cream for dessert and those were very good too!

I like the atmosphere of this place but for the price the steak did not taste as good. I ordered a medium well steak and it was overcooked to well done and the garlic mash potatoes were too garlicy. The meat was a bit dry and was not seasoned well, I definitely did not enjoy it as much as some of the best steak house i been too. Service was good however and the host was very attentive.

My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. Where to start... 

We had the porterhouse for two which was divine. It is rare that I eat steak but when I do, I look for top of the line. This cut was spectacular and was full of flavor. It comes with a house sauce and roast garlic but this steak did not need anything extra. 

Our servers, John and Alexis were fabulous. They were very knowledge about the menu. They were friendly and made us feel like we were the only people in the place. When they hear it was my birthday, they hand wrote out Happy Birthday with my name and gave us the largest piece of chocolate cake. It was very nice. We had to take some back to our hotel and I was further impressed that they provided us utensils.  Thank you for making our night even more special. 

The atmosphere was very nice. Classic old Vegas charm. Low light, red, romantic decor. Very classy Vegas. 

I read several reviews that said it was too pricey. The price is a little expensive, but you are receiving quality. Come on, it is Vegas and it is a fine dining establishment, the prices reflect the quality and ambience of the food/place. Over all, I think it was reasonable for Vegas prices for fine dinning, in fact it was a little more on the reasonable side for a steakhouse. 

In the future, we will make sure to come back here while visiting Vegas.

We discovered the Strip House Restaurant in NYC about 5 years ago. When we discovered that there was a Las Vegas location, we immediately made reservations!

Our group started with Oysters and the Mixed Greens salad - both were great. The salad came in a wonderful crispy parmesan bowl.

For entrees, our group had the salmon, the ribeye and a filet. All of the entrees were better than we remembered in NYC.

All the sides we tried were incredible!  Creamed spinach, green beans, potatoes romanoff... YUM.

This restaurant is a bit expensive, but worth every penny!!

I am not a steak person however after almost 3 weeks of eating junk food throughout America my husband (who is a massive steak lover) and I just wanted something non greasy. The lady at planet Hollywood reception recommend us to go upstairs and head into strip house and we are so greatful she did I have never had such a soft, juicy, perfectly cooked steak in my life! By far the most amazing steak in the USA!! Highly recommend to eat here! It is more so 5 star dining so it is expensive! But it is so worth it! Our waiter was so lovely also and so helpful with selection of sides ect! I would fly from Australia to Vegas again just for the steak!!!

Best steak I have ever eaten. Table side carved NY strip for 2. This place isn't cheap but worth it. Plan on spending 2 hours as this is leisurely diner. 24 layer chocolate cake is big enough for 4 people. It is gigantic. Scott was outstanding as our server.

Cat was a phenomenal server and paid attention to ever detail. Atmosphere was as great as always, but the food was mediocre at best. What happened to this restaurant? Grass fed filet with Stilton crust was prepared perfectly but the quality of the steak was just OK...sure did not taste like prime. Surf & Turf was just OK also. Sides were also not prepared as well as expected. Charbroiled broccoli with miso sauce was not cooked enough and I love my veggies barely cooked/grilled/steamed. Goose fat potatoes had so much grease I couldn't eat this side. My son loved the French fries, our drinks were delicious and our coffee at the end of the meal was superb.

Didn't know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Rather than having steak I have the crispy chicken which was half a chicken on a bed of couscous which was outstanding!  Had the potato in duck fat and greatly enjoyed that as well.  

Their wine list seemed very shallow but found the Chardonnay from France - Chablis to be delicious but expensive at $18 per glass 

Also began with Lobster bisque which was extremely tasty with a dollop of cream 

The service was good as well. Next time I'll try a steak.

The ambiance is just great I love the 1920's burlesque photos all over and the sexy red and black. My fiance and I came in for an early dinner at 6pm on a Sunday and we were seated right away in a nice table along the wall with booth seating on one side. our server was nice and prompt. I ordered the watermelon martini which was just ok, its funny because our amuse bouche tasted just like my martini mixture since it was made with watermelon also. We started off with new england scallops, wow! it was one of the best scallop dishes I've ever had. Just melt in your mouth and the sweetness from the corn and the sauce was amazing. The scallops were enormous and perfectly seared on the outside. Next I ordered the filet and my fiance had the Ny strip both were cooked perfectly nice medium rare with a nice char crust and coarse salt. lso wanted the potatoes romaneoff  but they weren't able to make them so we settled for mashed potatoes. We were both so full and had no room for dessert. Its a bit pricey but  I did it enjoy everything very much!

My husband and I love Strip House.  We've eaten at other popular steak joints in Las Vegas, but we keep coming back to this one because of the amazing food and phenomenal service.  We celebrated our anniversary here a few weeks back and, as usual, had an amazing time.  The steaks are out of this world, and there are so many yummy sides to choose from it's almost overwhelming what to pick!  Our waiter, Brian, was awesome!  He was super on top of everything and had great recommendations for new things for us to try.  Oh, and he had great hair ;)  If you're looking for a solid choice for a steak house, you simply can't go wrong with Strip House at Planet Hollywood.

The service was perfect! The dry-age ribeye and the way they salt and pepper the steak was amazing. There was something special about how simple the steak was but incredibly flavorful. I'd highly recommend spending an evening here.
Great steaks, salads, ambiance, decor. Highly recommend coming.

Came here for NYE dinner 2013; This was our second go-round from the previous NYE. Strip House was a good choice because it is centrally located on the strip where all the NYE action goes down.

The service was absolutely awesome. They waited on us hand and food. Loved the complimentary bread basket. That bad boy is as endless as you want it to be. Unfortunately, I think I ate one too many pretzel rolls. Oh well...the heck with it! The jury is still out on the food. The bone in rib-eye was ok. There are definitely much better renditions in Vegas, which is steak house mania. Personally, I think N9NE and even THE Steak House in Circus Circus are better. Surprisingly, the lobster bisque was bland. This was disheartening to me as I love a good lobster bisque. We also order the Caesar salad which was delicious. 

Unfortunately, something we at here left us with a bad case of food poisoning. We know because this was the ONLY thing we ate all day. No bueno.

Sorry Strip House, you're officially off my Vegas "A" list. For now, N9NE steals the show. We'll have to see if Crafsteak or STRIPSTEAK take the crown.
This place is a gem! We had an amazing dinner. I ordered the lobster ravioli plate and it was just perfect. We dine in a private room for 15+ guest. Excellent food and drinks. Service was incredible!

It was a better than average steak restaurant. There was a lack of staff which caused our night to be not so good. 20 minutes to get a second round of drinks is unacceptable. My steak was ordered medium and came out well, but the staff would not do anything to correct that issue.  I will not be going back to this restaurant on my next trip to Vegas.

Went here for my husband's and my 60th birthday while vacationing in Vegas.  All staff was very friendly and our waiter, John, couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  He recommended a great wine and even brought us some wonderful cheese that brought out the wine's flavor.  The food was very good, however the steak was a little over seasoned for our taste.  It wasn't a big deal though because it was easy to remove some of it.  We were very surprised when we were gifted a huge slice of their decadent chocolate layer cake with two candles and Happy 60th Birthday written on the plate in chocolate.  I would totally recommend this restaurant!

expensive but actually not TOO expensive for Vegas. Plus if your in Vegas your usually on vacation ssoooooo why not. Ok the steak and all the appetizers were amazing and different Butttt the desert!!! There were I think four of us and we all wanted a little something sweet. Being on the verge of Explosion we all agreed on a little piece of cheese cake for all of us to share. ...let me finish by just saying the cheesecake was the size of my head literally.

Waited until 5pm to try the delicious 24 layer chocolate cake. It was fantastic! The one slice we got was big enough to feed 4! All you need is a tall glass of milk and you got a party!! Yum! The top layer of chocolate is sooo creamy and yum, def make sure you get a layer of that with each bite!

I love the 22 ounce bone-in ribeye at the Strip House.  And their goose fat fried mashed potato ball.  Heaven.  The first time I ate there, I literally ate until I threw up.  Literally.  I didn't even know I was capable of doing that at this age.  I'm not five years old but their food made me lose all self-control.

Came in the other night to have a nice expensive steak dinner in Vegas. Gotta have expensive steak in Vegas, right? First thing you notice about the decor when you walk in: Reddddddddd. It's not terrible though. Also, cool vintage/pinup portraits on the wall, and as a photographer, I enjoyed that.

We were greeted by our server Ryan, who proceeded to take care of us perfectly the whole night, without coming by too often. Doesn't that get annoying sometimes? Thank you, Ryan.

The assorted breads came out hot and fresh, and were tasty. The butter was spreadable, unlike other places with cold, hard butter. This is a pet peeve of mine, so I'm glad they do butter right. 
Bone-in Ribeye - yes! Good flavor, not hidden by sauce.
Sea bass - yes! Nicely cooked, not over-seasoned. 
Seared scallops - yes! Wish there were more of them! 

Truffle creamed spinach with bacon - almost. Nice idea, but execution was very salty, perhaps too much parmesian cheese? Couldn't eat more than a couple of bites.  Too bad. This ruined their perfect score for me.  

It was still a good experience here, particularly because of the great service.

Very attentive staff, but the food took a long time. Granted it was a party of 15. But nonetheless. Overall... the food was delectable and the ambiance was most excellent excellent. I would revisit this place. Thanks for the excellent attentiveness and service.

The best experience on the strip- Adrain was outstanding.
We were celebrating a birthday- she made us feel beyond special.
Her service was hands down attention to detail and she is so professional and personable.
We will be back!!!

What an amazing experience.

14 Oz. dry aged ribeye cooked to medium. A burnt tasting seasoning I had to scrape off since it was too salty for my taste. Our server Cat was attentive and agreed that the in-house steak sauce tasted like filipino banana catsup, the sauce was trippin' me out since it was sweet, but I was addicted to it. I've had been to steakhouses here in the Bay Area and I compare all steaks to what I had at Alexander's steakhouse in the South Bay. I give the steak a 3 stars, but the service boosts it an extra 1 star.

I mean texas steakhouses you get more for your buck but with the exception of prices the food was just ok, I would recommend it to a friend the service was good seemed under staffed but I have no complaints , my girls are picky and the servers got it right

WHO WANTS TO GET LUCKY TONIGHT?!?!?
 
VA VA VOOM...Sexy, Sultry and Sensual; Strip House Steak House are ALL of those things and more. If the food doesn't give you a FoodGASM, the ambiance will set the tone for something else later in the night. *wink wink*

On Saturday, 2/19/11, our party of 9 arrived 6:48 PM for our 6:30 PM reservations. We were promptly seated in our own private room. 

F O O D:

*COMPLIMENTARY BREAD BASKET: 
-Pretzel bread: warm, soft, chewy and salty

-Raisin bread crusted w/ sesame & poppy seeds: my fav; crusty on the outside and pillowy soft in the inside. A slather of the butter added a creamy rich decadence while the raisins a touch of sweetness and the seeds a savory nuttiness. 

-Sourdough bread: I didn't try it.

*COLORADO LAMB RACK w/ Dijon Breadcrumbs & White Bean Stew ($43): AMAZING!!!

The two thick lamb chops were crusted w/ a Dijon bread crumb mixture and perfectly seared, then finished off in the oven to cook to a medium rare. 

As I took the first bite, I got a nice crunch from the seared crust and then the soft tenderness from the lamb. The lamb was not overly seasoned and a small ring of fat was left which helped "dress" the lamb in its natural juices producing a piece of meat that was juicy and full of natural lamb flavor w/ a hint of gaminess. The Dijon brightened the lamb by giving it a punch of tang on the palette. 

The white bean stew was the perfect accompaniment b/c of its neutrality which let the lamb shine in this dish. The al-dente beans were stewed in a rich and savory gravy which had a slight smokiness from the bits of bacon. I mopped each bite of lamb w/ the gravy and it was like a FoodGASM in my mouth!

*BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED SPINACH w/ Bacon ($13):  OMFG! *Eyes Roll Back*

I was too consumed w/ scarfing down my lamb to even notice the sides until I started hearing a bunch of "Ohhhhhs" and "MmMmms". My friend said, "OMG, YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS!" and gave me a spoonful.  I took a bite and HOLY SH*T it was BOMB!!!

The creamed spinach was insanely rich and velvety. It was well-seasoned and savory w/ a subtle  woodiness from the black truffles that wasn't overpowering. And, the best part? THE BACON!!! The crisp bacon bits added yet another layer of richness w/ a hint of smokiness.  A DEFINITE MUST ORDER!!!

*MAC 'N CHEESE ($13): SINFULLY DELICIOUS!

The elbow noodles were smothered and intertwined w/ a thick and creamy oooeeegy gooeeey b√©chamel cheese sauce. As I scooped the mac 'n cheese from the bowl, the sauce was so thick and gooey that you can see the cheese stretch and pull from the bowl to the spoon.  *drools*

The noodles were perfectly cooked to an al-dente and b√©chamel cheese sauce was packed w/ bold flavors. You can taste the sharpness from the cheddar, nuttiness and creaminess from the gruyere, and you get a nice crisp texture contrast from the breadcrumbs. The ratio of butter, milk and cheese created one MOST mouth-watering Mac 'N Cheeses I've ever had! Every bite, I felt like I was committing a sin; well a Lo-Carb Dieter's Sin to be exact.

S E R V I C E:

IMPECCABLE and ACCOMODATING!

My friend informed SHSH that we were running late due to traffic on the Strip and also told them we were in a huge time crunch and would have to be done w/ dinner at 8 PM. They said, it would be very tight especially w/ such a big group but would try to get us out of SHSH by that time. 

Our waiter and the other staff were very professional, friendly and attentive. They knew we were in a rush, so our waiter promptly took our order and everyone's apps, entrees and sides were out w/in 25 minutes! Keep in mind some of us had red meat which takes some time to cook and rest, so kudos to the kitchen staff!

We threw SHSH's staff a curve ball and they definitely went above and beyond the call of duty! They got a party of 9 fed top-notch fare and out of there w/in an hour!!! At fine dining establishments, I normally spend 1.5-3 hours for a party of 2-4, so this is definitely unheard of for me.

A M B I A N C E / D √â C O R:

SightGASM for the eyes, SHSH is one of the MOST sexiest, yet classiest restaurants that I've ever been to! 

Reminiscent of the SULTRY 1940s w/ dim lighting, scarlet red walls w/ gold decal, mahogany furnishings topped w/ crisp white linens, vintage black and white burlesque photos and LCDs w/ shadow box images of a woman's curves, SHSH will set the tone for one of the MOST sensual and romantic dinners you'll ever have!

FELLAS...*ahem ahem*.

If you're looking to tantalize every one of your senses, look no further, SHSH will satisfy ALL of them! The aroma and taste of the delectable food will please every taste bud and the ambiance will excite your eyes. As far as the other two senses: hearing and touch? Like I said, SHSH will set a tone for what will unfold the rest of the night, if not, I'm sure the alcohol will... ;)

The service here was excellent.  Our waiter timed everything perfectly.  The drinks were good and most of the food was good.  The steaks were cooked perfectly but in my opinion they could have used more seasoning.  Our waiter recommended the garlic fries which were only okay.  Actually, not even okay... they were a bit overcooked and dry.  I make myself some better garlic fries from the frozen section at Trader Joe's!  We ate here several years ago so can't remember exactly what else was ordered, but if it isn't memorable, than it wasn't that good.  At any rate, the bill came to around $180 and while cheaper than Craftsteak, wasn't nearly as good.  We probably won't return here, but I do have to say again that the service here was great and maybe it was just a bad night for us to try this place out.  I'd say go ahead and take a chance.

Two of us:
24oz filet for two. Not bad, a little tough. Expected better. Was not tender as expected.    3.0/5

Au gratin potatoes. Very good 4.6/5
Garlic string beans. Very good. Buttery and garlic. 4.6/5
Chocolate cake. Must try.  Rich, but not too much so. 4.6/5
2 glasses wine 
-----$200

Overall: solid 3.7/5

Everything was a hit but the meat. This could be a deal breaker for many, and at paying $200 it's understandable.  They will get another chance with me. Would recommend for someone to try.

So what's a nice gal like me doing in a Strip House like this? 

Eating anything but red meat lol

Strip House Steak House (it's like a children's rhyme! One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish...) is inside of Planet Hollywood casino--with parent location(s) in NY. All have the similar red walls, sharp, black contrasting decor, low lighting, and backlit picture frames of old-time celebrities/public figures from way back. If you squint your eyes, you can picture cigarette smoke hanging in the air and imagine Bogie coming around the corner with Lauren. There aren't any strongly-themed steakhouses around me (except maybe the chain El Gaucho in Seattle) and I enjoyed being transported to another time. It didn't feel hokey at all. 

Steakhouses are not my thing since I don't eat steak, and I never seem to get the quality of food that my beef-eating crew eat when we do go to one. I find something vegetarian/poultry/fish, pay an arm and a leg, and end up feeling dissatisfed. 

Strip House changed all that for me. We started off with bread: cranberry, pretzel, and sourdough. The butter was room temperature WOOT! and in a giant ramekin. I do love butter!

I then had the tuna tartare special app: Spiced raw tuna over avocado (FML) with a cucumber wrap, over cucumber (?)-scented water topped with two different kinds of caviar. HEAVENLY. And BIG! I'm a very expressive person, especially when eating, and it must have been weird to listen to me from another table. My only critique is that the spice was not evenly mixed through the tartare, but all is forgiven :D

For my main dish, I had the Scottish salmon over red quinoa with cream sauce and it may have been the best salmon I have ever eaten outside of me making it at home. I live in Seattle, with amazing seafood, and I eat a TON of fish. BOOM. Some of the top salmon in Vegas? I would never had guessed. It was a thick slab of salmon, and was the perfect doneness where the line between cooked and raw is as small as a splinter on a flea's foot. Flawless. Marvelous.

And though I could reflect on all the great salmon I've had in my life for a while, I know for a fact that the black truffle creamed spinach was the best creamed spinach I ever had. It was a shame that I couldn't take the leftovers back to the hotel with me. 

No room for dessert, my bill (alone) was $64, which was almost $10 less than my friend who had the steak and mac and cheese. I cannot believe I had all of that, with the quality it was, and excellent service on top of it. 

So on my next trip, I'll save some room in my tummy so I can eat MORE! 

#100/100 for Yelp Challenge 2013! *wiping brow*

Took my grandson here for his 21st birthday before Brittany concert.  I saw the various reviews so was pleasantly surprised to get a waiter, Daniel, who really knew how to make the dinner special.  Andrew ordered the filet which he described as the best steak he had ever eaten.  I had the bone in ribeye.  The pepper crust preparation and the quality of the beef made this the best I've had and I'm a pro on this cut.  Next time in Vegas I'll bring the entire family.

Phenomenal. Great food. Flapper era photos and dim lights gave it a speak easy and roaring 20s feel. Ma Barker and I right at home. Good food. New staff dialing in but did well. Inside 0lanet Hollywood. Homerun

UGH so disappointed!!!!  For the price of this place, I definitely expected wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy more.  

I liked the lounge, so that place I'll probably go to again.  But I will never ever have dinner here again (unless you comped it and everything was absolutely free).  I've never seen a place charge a per person fee for splitting a meal.  (Though when the meal came out, it was portioned out for each person so I guess that was OK.  But still).  It's kind of like a Ruth's Chris, but more stuffier and less comfortable.  I kinda felt like our server was wondering wtf we were doing there since we didn't look like everyone else.  Geez.

Open up the menus and WOW.  Can you say sticker shock?  I was expecting pricey but cmon.  So with that being said, the food better match up to the cost of it.  

My BF and I split the ribeye and ordered 2 sides to go with it, the onion straw things and creamed spinach with truffle oil.  Good, but the truffle oil definitely over powered the dish and it was all I could taste.  The onion straws were done just right, and provided a good contrast for the creamed spinach.  But my steak was cooked completely wrong.  I asked for medium rare.  Not well done on the exterior and raw on the interior.  That's why this place is uber dark.  So you can't look at the color of your steak and send it back for them cooking it wrong and trying to trick you into thinking your tastebuds are wrong.

Ever since then I've been cooking my own ribeyes to make up for the horrible experience.  I'm going back to Ruth's Chris.

Very nice ambience, and a nice bit of quiet in the sea of crap and noise at Planet Hollywood.  Very solid wine list with surprisingly not crazy markups (something Vegas is legendary for, sadly), we had a Ridge Geyserville and an Au Bon Climat Chardonnay, both very nice and not insanely expensive.

As a vegetarian, the real merits of these places are lost on me, but the sides were very solid and the portions were generous.  The asparagus was nice, not too loaded with butter, and the whipped potatoes were very light, if not slightly bland.

The real story here was that I tried steak for the first time in my entire life (a piece the size of a dime), really my first meat-eating experience in at least 20 years.  It was OK, I really don't know what all of the fuss is about haha I didn't run vomiting or anything.  Needless to say, happy to be a vegetarian, but now I can proudly say that at least I know what I'm missing :)

We went exclusively for dessert - specifically the 24 layer chocolate cake that they're known for here... 

Since we sat at a table in the bar (where we got quick and friendly service, by the bartender - as we were the only ones in the bar on a Tuesday night), can't speak to the restaurant or the rest of the food, although we've heard good things about both - but then again we heard the same thing about the chocolate cake, now about that cake... 

The cake looked great and was HUGE! Five stars for presentation - but after all four in our party dug in and actually tasted it, we all let out a collective sigh of disappointment. The icing was rich and fudgey, but the cake itself, (all 24 pencil thin layers) was dry and surprisingly bland, not very chocolatety. For a cake we've seen talked about as a must eat desert while in Vegas this desert was extremely disappointing - WAY below our expectations. 

The cake, a few coffees and a tea the bill came to a whopping 40 bucks plus (the cake slice itself is $14). WAY OVERPRICED and everyone in the party agreed (and we know good chocolate folks, we've been to Europe). 

Honestly, we had better chocolate cake in a buffet (Le Village Buffet at Paris) during the same trip.
Long wait for food to arrive and probably the worst Filet Mignon. No flavor at all. I was really surprised on how bland it tasted.

Really great food but incredibly slow service. Two hours to serve dinner for 5 is extreme. Beautiful presentation and tasty flavor profiles but the wait to get our food and check was not worth the $$$$

With a culinary and hospitality background, I've been told on more than once occasion that I'm overly critical of restaurants.  But when you're paying upwards of $75/head for dinner (app, entree, dessert, and drinks), I believe you have a right to be critical.

My 2-star rating comes primarily because of the service.  In a recent conference at the NRA Show in Chicago, Steve Carley, CEO of El Pollo Loco, said about service, "Bad service can make good food taste bad."  Forgive me for stealing a quote, but that just about sums up my experience at Steak House.  It had come highly recommended, and given my background in steakhouses, and my LOVE for a good steak, I was REALLY looking forward to it.  We had a group of three on the 4th of July (and yes, I do understand that eating in a restaurant on a busy holiday isn't exactly the best time to dine, but the restaurant was not busy!), and our entrees were a filet mignon, bone-in veal, and ribeye.  I ordered my filet medium rare, and the same with the other two cuts.  The veal and ribeye come out perfect.  My filet?  Not even close.  Medium-well bordering well done.  But no biggie.  I hate sending food back, but in this case, the filet was so bone dry, I just could not eat it.  After waiting about 15 minutes for the server to come check on our table, I asked him if there was anything he could do.  I showed him the steak, and showed him it wasn't done the way I ordered it, and this is what got me: instead of simply offering to take it back and refire it, he pushed a steak sauce on me and insisted that the sauce would make it more to my liking.  Seriously?!  At this point, I just insisted that it be sent back and he woefully took my plate from me.  A couple minutes later, the dining room manager came to my table and asked me if I would consider a different cut of meat (which I expected).  I simply explained to her that it wasn't done to the temp I had asked, and that I still wanted the filet.  No argument, a simple apology, no harm, no foul.  She even brought out some more of the cheese fondue appetizer we had ordered to hold me over.  All was well for the time being.  

But then the meal went on.  My filet came back as the others in my party were finishing their entrees, and it was done perfect.  But then our server suddenly disappeared...again.  I had to ask a busser for our check, and when it came, I noticed I was charged twice for the filet.  10 minutes later, after being yet again ignored, the server came back expecting the card in the bill, and I explained to him what had happened, and sure enough, he blames his manager for not taking care of it.  Really?  I wasn't even trying to put blame on anyone, just trying to take off a double charge on the bill.  At this point, I was just over the meal, and when I finally settled my bill (everything fully charged, no comp, no discount), the manager came back to my table, and totally acknowledged what had happened and apologized for everything that had gone wrong during our dinner.  She handled the situation very well, considering, and I have no problem spending for a meal whose food matches its service, but in all honesty, I was expecting my filet to be comp'd.  Given her acknowledgment of the dinner, she admitted they screwed up, but you CAN make it right.  Problems are an everyday occurrence in restaurants, and especially fine dining, but most of them are EASILY manageable.  An overdone filet is no exception. If you call yourself a steakhouse and charge more than Ruth's Chris, Fleming's, and Morton's, your service standards should be at least comparable.  Not only are these chains better, but their service is head over heels Strip House.  At least I don't get talked down to by the servers and pushed steak sauces when I eat there.

That being said, their bone-in veal is TO DIE for.  It was cooked perfectly and is the only reason I would even consider going back there.  The veal alone is the only reason I gave Strip House 2 stars instead of 1.

We went for the 24 layer cake, so that's all I can speak to. Dollar ratio to Calorie count it's the best deal in Vegas and darned tasty too.  So much of Vegas just doesn't live up to the hype... lines for $24 celebrity chef Hamburgers - Meh - why bother when you can a giant slab of 24 layer cake for $17. 

We had eaten dinner a a celebrity chef's pub at Caesar's  for for between $50-100 per person... then the four of us couldn't polish off one slab of cake. Should have skipped the so-so dinner and headed to the Strip for cocktails and cake.

Strip House Steak is nothing short of life reaffirming beef. I had a late dinner Friday night at the bar, and enjoyed every bite of my meal. 

Mark, the bartender, was extremely jovial, entertaining, and offered an exceptionally high level of service. I began my meal with the scallops. The order came with two large scallops over a buttery froth with some grains and soybeans. Every bite was perfect, the slimy texture of the scallops was complemented by the crunch of the beans, and the heartiness of the grains. 

Next I had their version of a wedge salad with blue cheese dressing. It was delicious, a whole chunk of wedge covered with shaved red onions, chopped bacon, and a creamy Stilton cheese dressing. It was one of the best takes on a classic steakhouse wedge salad that I have ever had. 

Lastly, I had the 12 ounce filet mignon cooked rare plus. This was the crowning jewel of the meal. The steak was thick and heavily crusted with the perfect amount of salt, and black pepper before being seared at what I can only imagine was an extremely high temperature. The steak shredded with only a fork, and melted in my mouth with an exquisite texture. To accompany the steak there was a roasted garlic clove, which combined in sparing quantities with each bite of steak added an extra dimension of flavor. 

Overall, Strip House Steak is somewhat of a hidden gem for being right on the vegas strip. I found it to be a little bit more reasonably priced than some of the better known alternatives, and every bit as good.

We had reservations and was sat property but we did wait 5+ minutes to even see our waiter the porterhouse for 2 was amazing and I had the best cream spinach I ever had the 24 layer cake was awesome just didn't like having to wait for a server to come to us and especially since it was a Monday night
Been here to Strip House Steakhouse 4 times and it never ever disappoints! The Rib eye is as good as it gets and their sides ( mac and cheese, creamed spinach) are DELICIOUS

Amazing food and service!!! Go- you won't be disappointed! The restaurant has a great atmosphere. The food was delish! The service is beyond great. Our waiter was on time with everything. This is a top notch restaurant with impeccable service!
Oh my gosh, I Love their Filet/Lobster! Tender, hot & seasoned perfectly. I actually came back the next night and ordered the exact same thing. I'll come here again!
I return here every time I'm in Vegas. The steaks are great. The sides are fantastic. It's a very intimate setting and the service is spectacular.

With a name like Strip House you know you have to be into something decent! And not to forget its located in Planet Hollywood. Strip House was indeed that and more. This place was great, period!. 

Decor:
Well it indeed has a nice swanky design, dark lit, and covered with pics of nude females. The photography is awesome and no I'm not saying that because there are naked females from floor to celling. LOL If you know a little about photography you'll know these are actually nice shots. So from an decore/artistic view the place is set up very nice. It has just as much eye candy as you'll need. I guarantee you'll spend a lot of time looking/scanning the walls.

Food:
Well first and foremost, I was shocked. Sure I knew it would be good but I had no idea it would be to this caliber. I tried several appetizers; used this spot as a jump pad before going to Prive (just across the way). The food was prepared great! Everything I had was delicious. And thats coming from someone who is a picky bastard. I had scallops, prawns, fondue with bread (yumm), and I had the Crab Cakes. Each item was huge! I was surprised to see scallops that big. 

Overall this is a must. Give it a try!

So before I start this review, I just want to mention that I've never been to a steak house before and it was my birthday soooooo . . . yeah. 

That being said, this place was amazing. We were staying in Planet Hollywood anyway and I wanted to eat somewhere fancy for dinner and then place did the job. We were late for our reservation but they were about to still fit us in and sat us quickly, which they definitely didn't have to do. rThe place is decorated with 1920's models thats range of clothed to quasi nude models in way that was kinda classy but didn't interfere with your dinner either. The low lights and red interior gave it an intimate feel too. 

Our waiter was a combination of charismatic and creepy, in a way that was very entertaining to me. I don't know if it was on purpose or not but either way he was very good at his job. One of my friends suggested I get the ribeye steak medium well so I went with that and I was not dissappointed! No one was in fact, not even the vegetarian! (She ordered a 2 sides instead of steak and still didn't finish everything). Probably the most surprising item was the grean beans cause they were freaking delicious. I was stuffed and could stop eating them. In fact, many of the sides that we ordered could be shared with at least one other person. They are kinda big and so flavorful, so they were also pretty filling. 

We decided to get the 25 layer chocolate cake for dessert. That's right. 25 LAYERS! Again, I couldn't stop eating it and I don't even like cake that much. I had mentioned to the waiter and supervisor that was working that my birthday was my favorite holiday, so when the cake come out, it had a candle in it and Happy Birthday was written on the cake. They waiter and sup even came by and said "Have fun on your favorite holiday!" It was something simple and easy that they didn't have to do at all but they did. 5 stars!

Had a great meal here and it's consistent with New York.
The Caesar salad is fantastic. As a main I ordered the Crisp Organic Chicken which consisted of porcini rub, market vegetables, and truffle jus. I loved it accompanied by the black truffle creamed spinach as a side.

A little conflicted about the rating here as the food was really good.  But where the food merited a better rating, I couldn't bring myself to rate higher than three for the value.  And not 'Vegas' value, but compared against other high end steak houses it prices against.  That being said, here we go: 16 Oz NY Strip, medium:  very good, pink throughout with no trace of red, cooked to perfection.  Seasoning for me was fine, but I like things with a little zest, others may find it overly seasoned or salted.  Even so, it really only served as a crust and did not detract from the flavor of the meat itself.  Good cut, minimal marbling, but enough to provide some flavor.  The creamed spinach with bacon was simply amazing; flavored with garlic, truffle oil and large pieces of bacon throughout; I would highly recommend it.  Whipped potatoes and Potatoes Romanov were good, but paled in comparison to the spinach.  ides are served in very small portions, probably enough for two but no more.  Which, for the spinach was a crime.  No dessert tonight.  Service was excellent as well, Chris was our waiter and he was attendant and professional and as good as any I have seen at any similar establishment.  Liked the Vargas girl styled photos throughout as well. To summarize: Food was 3.5 stars ( down from 4 due to the 2 sides which were 'meh')'  service was 5 and value was around a 3 at best, hence the overall rating.

Our first time here & WOW the FOOD is Amazing! Thank you to everyone working here, especially Carlos our head waiter who made my daughter's 21st bday celebration a success! And also a big Thank You to the chef for the incredible dinner!

Happened to stumble upon this place because we wanted to eat and not be rushed before seeing Peepshow.  The decor was really cute (old photos of 30's-40's pinup girls) and the waiter offered to let us taste most of the wines offered by the bottle, just so we could choose easier.  For dinner we ordered filets and potatoes romanoff, the mushrooms, and a daily special of baked bacon creamed spinach.  Now, we had pretty high standards, as we have eaten at steakhouses in the wynn, endore, casars, etc.  and let me tell you this place blew them all away!  Every bite was heaven!  we were way too full for dessert, but it was worth it!  We now have a new favorite steak house in town!

Went here last Friday night as we were staying at the hotel for 3 nights.  We had the scallops and beef jerky for appetizers.  The sauce with the scallops was stellar and my gf ate a bunch of the bread with it also.  The beef jerky was better than mine and I make stellar jerky.  Then we had the twice baked potatoes romanoff and split steak and lobster.  We were amazed by the potatoes and the steak and lobster was fantastic also.  The service was fantastic and we took a piece of the 24 layer chocolate cake back to the room as we were stuffed.  I broke into it at least 3-4 times overnight and still couldn't finish half of it.  I was glad they didn't get upset that we split an entree as it is a waste for us.  The bill came out to around $130 and I tipped $30 to compensate and because the service and food was awesome.  The light music and ambiance made for a very romantic evening for us.  We both agreed it was one of the best meals we have had in years.

Food, service and ambience excellent here.  The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is that it's in Planet Hollywood.  Taxi service there is bad.  But other than that.....food is excellent.  They make great steak and side dishes.  Been there several times and enjoy going back.  Make reservations though...it gets crowded. More of place you want to take friends or clients.  Not really good for kids.

I went to striphouse while on vacation. I was a little hesitant because of the prices but after an amazing experience it was definetly worth it. We started with the gorgonzola fondue and it was a perfect start. With a recomendation from our server Ryan we tried the surf and turf and bone in ribeye for dinner. They were both cooked perfectly and some of the best steaks i've ever had. I wish we had room for the 24 layer chocolate cake our server suggested but we had to go back another night to get it because we were so full. But he was right, it was to die for. Can't wait to go back next time were in town to try it again. Service was amazing! some of the best I've had in Vegas!

Wanted some place in town that had baked alaskan. Picked this place.  Greeted immediately by host. Sat right away with reservation.   Server was very prompt and attentive.  Cool decor with lots of pictures on the walls.  Dark romantic atmosphere.  Good menu.  Wanted the bacon app but were saving room for dessert.  The table next to us got it and it looked amazing.  That will be one regret I will have to live with forever...get the bacon app.  Four huge slices of bacon.  
Started with bread service witch was nothing special.  Go the dry aged ribeye.  Was amazing. One of the best pan sears I have ever had on a steak.  Crisp and seasoned, tail trimmed well, just perfect  Way better than other steaks I have paid way more for.   
Delay with the sauces.  Got the steak first then was a waiting  for sauces and sides.  They brought out our sides, steak sauce and peppercorn sauce.  Both delicious. were missing the bearnaise.  Said the chef was making a fresh batch.  When the bearnaise came out it was perfect.  Fine diced tarragon instead of leafs.  Not too thick not too thin.  
Sides, got the mushrooms-ok and the crispy duck fat potato- good.
 Baked alaskan-ok meringue was good but ice cream was too hard and just a small slice of frozen cake on the bottom.

OK so I don't eat red meat, BUT everyone in my party did, so I was fine with coming here to try.....and I was pleasantly surprised! the Decor was very cool, the service was very attentive but not annoying, and the food was great. Everyone loved there steaks BUT the highlight of the evening was the appetizer- the bacon salad thing- OK its NOT a salad- but its SO DELICIOUS! The best bacon I have EVER had- These GIANT slices of thick thick apple smoked bacon came out and they melted in my mouth- the flavor was amazing and i didn't want to order anything else it was that good! I did end up getting the salmon, which was great, but the bacon still lingered in my mind...in fact I'm tasting it right now....anyways if your a bacon lover you MUST have this!

Prologue:
My fiancee and I had tickets for a show at Planet Hollywood and wanted to find a fantastic restaurant to have dinner before the show.


The Plot:
We began by sharing the Goat Cheese Prosciutto Rolls, followed with a 12oz Filet Mignon along with Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes and Saut√©ed Wild Mushrooms.
This sumptuous meal was concluded with their signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake.


The Scene:
The portion sizes were very good and there was plenty of food for the both of us.

You know the meal you're about to enjoy is off to a great start when the basket that first arrives at your table is filled with a variety of hot rolls that are even better than anything you've purchased at an artisan bakery.

The Prosciutto Rolls were stuffed with Calabrian-Infused Goat Cheese, Wild Arugula, Fris√©e, and Shaved Parmesan and were served with a Twelve-Year Aged Balsamic Glaze.
To begin with, the exceptional quality of the prosciutto was immediately apparent.
The spice from the Calabrian Chile was well balanced with the chilled goat cheese and greens yet still delivered enough heat to excite our taste buds.
My fiancee commented that she would have been satisfied with just this dish alone for dinner.

The Filet Mignon was cooked to a perfect medium rare (see photographic evidence below) and had been allowed to rest appropriately prior to arriving at our table.
The steak also had a nice crust on it with classic seasoning.
My fiancee appreciated how it was moist, tender, and pink in the middle but not at all bloody.

The Potato Croquette had great texture;¬†firm yet tender and perfectly seasoned on the inside with a lovely and very yummy crispy crust on the outside. This was a much nicer compliment to our steak than a baked potato would have been.

Personally I enjoyed the Sauteed Wild Mushrooms most of all. The portion size was very generous and the variety, texture, and flavor of the mushrooms was absolutely outstanding; perhaps the best I've ever had.

Twenty-four alternating layers of chocolate cake and chocolate mousse topped with ganache comprised their signature dessert.
One could not help appreciating the time and effort that went into creating this dessert.
The piece we were served was monstrous and was easily enough chocolate bliss for 3 or 4 people.


The Rest of the Story:
The serivice was excellent, of course.
We arrived early in the evening, were seated at one of the best tables in the house, and were cared for very well.

The ambiance and decor were classic steak house crossed with Sin City.

The tab for the meal was very reasonable for fine dining at this level in this location.


Epilogue:
We happily award 4 stars for our most satisfying and memorable dinner in Las Vegas to date.

Photo Design:
by Billie Z.

It's what you expect of a steak house in Vegas.  Food was expensive, but great quality.  Service was good, but not quite the best.  I went with a group of coworkers.  We spent about $150 each.  I had steak, wedge salad, 2 bourbons, and we shared several sides.  The special mashed potatoes with bacon, sour cream and some sort of spicy peppers were excellent.  By far the best part of an overall good meal.  I didn't like the Caesar salad that my coworker ordered.  Overall, good meal.

First time at this restaurant and have to say very impressed!
We ordered the chateaubriand for two and it was amazing! tender , flavorful  and cooked to perfection!
We ordered one side to share which was more then enough.
No room for dessert!
Daniel our waiter was spot on!

We decided to try out Strip House since we were going straight to Peep Show after.  I always forget it is there since it is upstairs.

The ambiance and decor are nice.

The service was good.  Our server was attentive and friendly.

We started with the Warm Garlic Bread.  It is long rectangular strips of fried bread.  It comes with a Gorgonzola Fondue for dipping.  The taste and texture of the bread is great.  The fondue is creamy and mild.  We all enjoyed it.

The house bread basket comes with three types of bread.  I only tried the pretzel bread, but it was excellent.  The others seemed happy with the other two options.

I chose the 8 oz. filet for my main course.  It was prepared as requested, medium rare.   The meat was tender and tasty.  The seasoned salt and pepper crust gave it added flavor and texture.

We ordered a couple sides.  The Potatoes Romanoff were tasty with nice contrasting textures.  The others tried the Steamed Asparagus and told me it was good.

They have diverse options for wine.  They also offer some unique mixed drinks.

Of all the steakhouses I've been to, this is the best. 

Fillet mignon melted in my mouth.
The lobster tail was perfection.
Perfectly chopped salad.
And best of all, the drinks were nice and strong.

We were attending a concert at the PH and wanted to enjoy a relaxed dinner before our concert.  The place has a modern "Mad Men" feel to it.  I could totally imagine Don Draper sitting in a corner table drinking an old fashioned! The food was really good, but the service was outstanding!!! I hope to be back on our next visit to Vegas!

We went to see the Jeff Dunham show, which was at the Planet Hollywood. We decided to have an early dinner before the show. Food was delicious - steak was tender and flavorful, just prefect. Service was good. Our waiter was professional and attentive. However, it took him a long time to give us the check - we were worried about getting to the show on time and had communicated the same. But, he seemed to be taking his time.

I wish I could give Strip House Steak House 6 stars! Located in the Planet Hollywood Hotel on the second level this restaurant has a dark/trendy atmosphere. Price range $$-$$$. I went with a group of 5 people and we shared various appetizers and each had filet steak for our main meal. Appetizers/Entrees shared:
- Spicy Tuna Tartar
-Calamari
-Oysters
-French Fries
-Caesar Salad  
-Asparagus
-Broccoli
-Lobster Pasta
-12 oz. Filet Mignon

Food was absolutely amazing, service was superb, experience was memorable.

Part one.  We were greeted by an less than warm welcome.  Jarad, some guy claiming to be a manager was rude and snotty about the wine policy.  Aka. They don't have corkage.  If you bring a nice bottle for a special occasion, Per Jared, there is no way they will break policy.   The policy is that you have to BUY another bottle from the wine list which is more expensive than the entire dinner. 

No exceptions, with attitude.  Jarad should not be in a customer service position.  If we had not committed to this reservation and location near our show, we would have turned and walked away.  
Shameful as a part of Planet Hollywood, that this kind of rude behavior can impact a guest.  

Sad. Jarad looks to be about 22, and acts like he has no experience with a high end restaurant.  There are so, so many choices in Vegas.  I urge you to go somewhere else where I am sure they will appreciate your business.

Part two

The food was decent, somewhat average for a high end steak house.  Mastros, STK, and Ruth'sChris have better steaks.  The food was slow.  We waited 20 minutes after a salad for the entree.  
The waiters were ok, not great, not bad.  Just sort of off on timing. 

My overall thought.  While I had good experience here in the past, things have changed and they are not close to the previous high standard.  Also for the money at a minimum expect people to be nice.  No so much here.  

Try STK at Cosmo.  Much better.

very nice ambience when you walk in. you get greated by 2 host. the bar and the dinning lounge are decorated with black and white picture of topless woman from the 50's-70's. all very tasteful with the theme. you can eat at the bar where you can get a tower of fresh seafood and wash it down with an ice cold cocktail.

great service all around from the host, bartender, too the waitress. the ribeye is great and the filet migon is a must!!

great place to take a date. very relaxed for anyone who wants to go to an upper scale steakhouse. no need to where a suit of you know what i mean.

enjoy!

I have never been to a nice restaurant. From food, service, decor, atmosphere. So impressed from start to finish.
We had heard about the Strip House before, as we stay at Planet Hollywood every time we are in Vegas, but have usually made it too late in time for dinner. 
We were sat right away, and our waiter who served us was extremely helpful. He told us all the specials, and came back quite frequently to check on us. The wait staff of the entire restaurant was so quick and helpful, I felt like I was in a Disney movie. If your water glass got less than half full, it was instantly filled, bread was replaced quickly (which it needed to be, because it was fresh baked and delicious!), and every item we ordered was brought out almost immediately. It was fantastic. And everyone was very polite. 
For our appetizer, we shared a jumbo ship cocktail which was extraordinary. I ordered a lobster linguine, and my boyfriend ordered a new York strip with onion strings. My lobster linguine was good, but it wasn't as amazing as I hoped. My boyfriends steak on the others hand.. Was absolutely MOUTHWATERING! As soon as I tried a bite, it melted in my mouth and I had to check if it was unicorn because it was so magical. 
I tried a few bites with onion strings and the pairing of the salty bite with the perfect savory steak was just amazing. 
For dessert we shared the house cheesecake, which had a hint of citrus and a sweet, almost white chocolate topping, also amazing and perfect. My boyfriend had a glass of Knob Creek and I had a small Baileys Irish Creme. Perfect ending to a perfect meal.
The decor of the restaurant was styled like an old fashion burlesque hall, with red printed wall paper and dim lighting, and lots of framed black and white photos of silent film stars and burlesque dancers. The beautiful restroom had rose wall paper on top and tiled red bejeweled brick on the bottom, the entire place is gorgeous.

Received a call from the manager about the issue. I will say that he handled the situation very well and offered to take care of us personally whenever my wife and I make it back to Vegas. Very respectable management in my opinion.

Went with a friend for dinner. Had the lobster bisque which was presented very nicely but tasted just ok. Also had the 12 oz filet mignon and the broccoli for the side. The steak was cooked perfectly and the broccoli was in a tasty sauce. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a fancy dinner in Vegas. Can be on the pricey side so be prepared to pony up some cash.

Really surprised at all the five stars on here. It was OK, but much better to be had for the $$; prices are in line with every other high-end steak joint on the strip.
Everything is a la carte, no surprises.
Caeser salad for $11 was tasteless; bone-in veal chop for $45 was a very nice cut of meat, but not properly cooked (ordered medium and it was very rare). Server was none to happy about bringing it back to throw on for another few minutes.
Great peiece of homemade cheesecake.

This was our last night in vegas dinner. 4 of us had no plans and no reservations. We walked up to look at the menu and a very sweet hostess Invited us in and said we could take a table in the bar/lounge. It was very comfortable, fun decor. A nice homage to the New York steakhouses we all love. White dinner jackets on the bread boy etc.

The food was great. We all had steaks. All were perfectly seasoned and cooked. No salt or pepper was necessary. Even their own steak sauce wasn't needed, it was good, but not needed to drown a bad or poorly cooked steak.

The creamed spinach...well...let's just say I had to take a moment. It was a sort of religious experience. But seriously, it was really good. A great play on a classic steakhouse side.

Good food, good service, definitely a do again.

We had reservations here which were made on Opentable. We checked in a few minutes early and were seated right away. 

Service was a bit slow and at time inattentive but overall was ok. The drink and wine choices were great. The food was good. Baked potato was great the filet was ok. Pretzel bread was pretty awesome. 

If you like a dark atmosphere this is the place for u.

If your looking for a high end steak house to entertain clients or an intimate dinner, look no further.  The Strip House is by far the best.  I've used them for two years now on 4 or 5 occasions only to be impressed more and more.  The food is excellent!  Steaks cooked to perfection and simply delicious.  My favorite has become the dry aged ribeye.  The filet mignon is also a winner.  Well worth the price.  On the service end, blown away.  One nigh my wife was handed a Tide pen along with sparkiling water after spiling sauce on her dress.  The next night, one of my guests was handed reading glass after having trouble seeing the menu.  This place really covers all angles.  Brett was our waiter and kept everything organized, moving and efficient.  I can say enough.  Just try it and you'll keep coming back.

We decided to partake in some gentlemen's shenanigans during a bachelor party in Vegas.  After walking in with a stack full of ones, we were surprised to find out the full name of the place was Strip House...Steak House.  Wakka wakka.

Undeterred we decided to have prix fixe dinner in one of the private rooms.  Our event planner Gabe was awesome and we were able to have some tastefully Photoshop'd artwork affixed to the menus.  As for atmosphere, all I can think of is red.  TLC Red Light Special red, which I suppose goes well with medium rare steaks and red wine flowing.  It's more club chic than steakhouse really.  The private room itself was nice as it pretty much shut out all outside noise once the door was closed.  This proved vital as a fellow female patron was apparently 1 or 5 cocktails in, but who's counting.

If you're hungry you're going to love the prix fixe menu.  The 14oz Dry Aged Rib Eye is not bone-in.  So yes, that is 14oz of pure unadulterated bovine ready to make sweet love to your cheeks.  One of the salad selections was the Roasted Bacon salad.  The term "salad" being used very loosely.  Okay, it was essentially three big slabs of bacon with a small mound of greens because the chef thought "why not, yolo."  Simply brilliant.   I haven't even gotten to the desserts, which include a chocolate cake bigger than some household pets.  If you do a prix fixe menu here, there's is no way you will leave without a food baby gestating in your stomach.  So if you're planning to go to the club after, leave a couple hours buffer to drink some coffee and flush your system.  Otherwise that $1000 bottle minimum will be no bueno.  Trust.

The service itself is top notch.  Our waiter shared some war stories and everything came out fairly fast and on-point.  As for price, I'd say it's reasonable considering all the food, the private room, and the customized menus.  

Overall, great place to have a bachelor party dinner.

My boo and I decided to come here for a date night not too long ago and loved it. When you walk in the ambiance is sort of an old school mob type feel. The seats are spread a nice distance from each other and the lighting was very dim and romantic. 

Once seated our waiter came by to express the restaurant concept and specials. Throughout the meal he was very nice and helpful. After hearing some of his recommendations we decided to start with the prosciutto appetizer special of the night. It was absolutely delicious. The meat was cut very thin and stuffed with cheese then topped with arugula and balsamic. Very unique and not too heavy of a first dish.

For my entree I choose the lamb chops while my boo stuck with steak. Both dishes were cooked perfectly and didn't even require any additional sauce or seasoning. For a side we shared the spicy potatoes which was the only thing I wasn't a huge fan of. The taste was somewhat bland to me and not enough spice. 

Can't forget the best for last, the dessert. We shared the brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. So good!!! Three exclamation points worthy for sure. If you're a chocolate fan, do not pass this up! 

Overall we both really enjoyed this place and would come back again soon. It's perfect for a romantic date night and they also have private rooms for group events too.

Crab legs are insanely expensive. Didn't realize until the bill came. Look - crab legs come out of a box from the north and they are warmed slightly. The menu said market price. But 79 dollars for 4 chunks of the upper legs. For a pound (two full big ones) they are 20 bucks. For that kind of money I could have had a decent something. I never expected that! Good place though.

I was at Strip House in Vegas a couple weeks ago (oddly was in at NYC location just a week before - this review should mirror that location as well).  This place was solid.  As steakhouses go, really good, however, I have to say, and yes it was my first time, but the wagyu was freaking ridiculous!!!  So many props to the Chef.  

Our waiter was fantastic, directed me to a tasty single malt, took care of my friends, didn't BS me or my friends on their preferences, and our server took care of the bachelor, and us, like we were much more important than we really were.  Oh, AND the mac and cheese was superb. 

The ability to have such high standards and consistency from NYC to Vegas is really a nod to management as well.  

Server.  Bus.  Chef. Host.  Bartender.  And anyone I left out - Cheers.  Well Done!

Hello everyone. This place is easily one of my favorite steakhouses. I have always had fast and friendly service whenever I visit here. They have these French fries that are fried in duck fat that are soooo addicting! 

So I am a huge fan of their rib eye steak it is sooo juicy and made very well with just the right amount of char. 

My wife normally gets the filet which is well seasoned that she really likes. 

We also tried the porterhouse one time which was also very flavorful. I think I still like rib eye more than the New York's strip but not by much!! Really recommend this place!

Have fun everyone!

We went here expecting good service and good food. Our server, John, was VERY good and extremely personable. We ordered filets and added a side of Black Truffle Creamed Spinach. 
I don't usually like vegetables but this sounded interesting. It was AWESOME! Very flavorful. 
I told John, after paying the bill, that I usually dtip for wine but that I thought so pleased with his service that I tipped on the total bill. 
Ask for John!

We went to Strip House, but we did not have a great experience. The service was slow and it took a while to get our food. We ordered the Lobster Bisque which was not very good. It lacked some flavor. For our main entree we got the Fillet Mignon which was soft and very tender. The only problem I had is that the crust had a lot of peppercorn which made the dish a bit overwhelming. We also ordered the Tuna dish. I personally enjoyed that dish a lot. The Tuna was perfectly cooked and fresh. For our side dish we ordered the saut√©ed mushrooms. They had a good flavor, but they were very average. For our final entree we got the Chocolate Brownie. The portion of the dish was very good for sharing. However, I was not impressed with the flavors. The brownie was a bit cold and the flavors were just ok.

Overall, I would most likely not come back to this restaurant. The strip has so many great restaurants that it's easy to find a restaurant with better service and delicious food.

This probably isn't a fair review because it's really only on the 21 layer chocolate mousse layer cake. 
Although the food smelled Devine and I wished we had time to stop and eat.  
The next time we visit Vegas we will be sure to eat here.

The service at this restaurant was outstanding. Daniel was our server and he was spot on in all of his recommendations from the wine list all the way through the desert menu.  My wife and I were both very impressed with the presentation and taste of the food.

Definitely a splurge, but a whole lotta fun.  Classy and tasty, of course I really enjoyed my meal.  It was all ala carte which I'm not such a fan of...I like when the chef pairs your entree with some unique and complimentary side dish.  and i don't really get the whole $75 steak with nothing on it and no sides...

I think I was most impressed by my waitress- some stuffy guy kept bothering her while she was helping us because he was all "important" and big time or whatever, and he wanted to be seated.  She took no mind to his big timeyness and looked at him like "I'm helping these people right now so why the hell don't you get off your high horse and wait for your table like everyone else ahead of you in line."  Haha, great!
Food quality, portion size  , & garnish is not as expected . Cant compare to ruth chris !
