This steakhouse is a hidden gem in Vegas!
The seafood platter was fresh and awesome.  I loved the lobster bisque and they gave a few chunks of lobster tail in it.  I had the bone in ribeye and she had filet mignon.  No complaints from either one of us.  Been here a few times, never disappointed.  Just never had room for dessert.

We are from the Midwest and have a lot of great steak restaurants. This place does it right. Both of our steaks were cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing.  Daniel was great and very informative. It was a great experience all around!

I would come back here any day.

The food is delicious. The service was awesome. We accidentally came 15 mins before close and they still served us with awesome food.

We mostly ate the chef's special for the night:

- tuna salad
- surf and turf
- seared salmon

Everything was beyond perfect. I was so glad I wore a dress so I didn't have to unbutton my pants. 

Their filet is amazing. Try it!

Went here for dinner on 3/5. This place was happening on a wednesday evening. Must have been the Nascar or other convention that brought in the troops. 
Ambience: nice setup and vibe. Can be flexible with different type of dinners (ie romantic, business, etc. ). Noticed some nice private rooms. Not your typical stuffy steakhouse. A tad on the noisier side. But all in all, nice vibe. 
Service: for the most part, it wad pretty good. We were seated right away when put party arrived. When another friend joined us late, a seat was quickly added. Our server came right away. However, service started slowing down as the restaurant got more business. We actually had to flag someone down for the dessert menu. Food came out at a decent pace. 
Food: was pretty good. Highlights for me included the seafood combo appitizer (2 jumbo shrimp and jumbo lump crab meat). Loved the crabmeat (2oz). I got the dry aged ribeye (medium rare) and it was a tad over cooked to a medium. Still very nice flavor. Friends really enjoyed the salmon (not sure i would ever order salmon at a steakhouse). Best sides were the mac n cheese and the bacon cream of spinach. That spinach was phenomenal. 
Value: typical high end steak house prices. 

I would visit this place again if i was staying at PH

OMG!  Best meal in Vegas!  Where do I start...first you MUST have a glass of their Seasonal Sangria!  You know to clear the palette, hehe.  We ordered the oysters, which we were a little skittish about considering we're in the middle of the dessert.  Oysters were delish!  And the mignonette was perfect!  Then we got the special appetizer they were offering that evening, prosciutto wrapped pepper goat cheese.  Again, SO delicious!  The waiter shared with us that this was so popular that it might make it on their permanent menu...let's hope!  For our dinner, we ordered the Porterhouse for two and my husband could not stop sharing about how tender the meat was, he loved it!  Mac and cheese done, right!  Not all watery and saucy, and not too stiff.  Lastly for dessert, we had to get the famous chocolate cake.  Such a wonderful dinner experience.  We will be back!
This is my favorite please in all of Vegas!! Some of the best food in town thats for sure! the service is amazing as well. i would say come check this place out!

What a wonderful experience we had for Valentine's Day! The service was impeccable and the food was over-the-top! Truly one of the best dining experiences ever! The bartender, hosts and especially the server, Scott, knew  exactly how to make a guest feel welcome! They all went above and beyond to make our evening great! I highly recommend going and trying out this gem of a steakhouse! 

PS - Order the Manhattan - you'll be happy you did!

Awesome place for a nice steak dinner. We had tuna tartare for an appetizer, which was very delicious and flavorful. For entrees we ordered New York strip which was out of this world amazing and rack of lamb, which was good, but not outstanding. For sides we had goose fat fried potato, it was just fine, but creamy spinach with truffle oil is a must,  Incredibly delicious!! Overall 5 stars for food and incredible service. Highly recommend this place!

I had a wonderful meal with exceptional service at the Strip House.  It is expensive, but I feel was well worth the cost.  Low lighting and old (very risque!) photos adorned the burgundy walls.  My filet mignon was cooked and seasoned to perfection while my husband's lobster was everything you'd expect (bonus was they shelled the entire lobster for him).  We ordered the black truffle creamed spinach and goose fat potatoes for our sides.  Whew...very rich meal, but so delicious!

Because we'd seen the 24 layer chocolate cake on TV (which is really 12 thin layers of cake amidst 12 layers of mousse and topped with ganache), we had to try it, but after such a decadent meal, it wasn't possible for us to eat anything more.  Our waiter packaged the cake for us to take back to our room and when we were ready for our midnight snack, we dug right into a delectable, creamy and moist dessert.  We couldn't finish the cake, but I loved it so much, I actually saved some for breakfast, lol (I know, ghetto!).  Very memorable dining experience :-)
Great steak house, one of my favorites.  Everything tasted lovely and the servers were so courteous.  No complains what so ever, top of my list for sure.

One of the top dining experiences on the Strip! Amazing ambiance (rated mature), delicious cocktails, stellar cuisine and excellent service. We sat at the bar and shared the Italian Chopped salad and the Surf 'n Turf entree with a side of Sauteed Wild Mushrooms. I could go on and on about all of it -- simply amazing! I managed to snap a pic of the salad but when the surf 'n turf and mushrooms arrived, I lost my mind and dug in immediately ... it was crazy good.
We make sure to dine at the Strip House each time we visit Vegas -- can hardly wait to return!

We came here before a show at Planet Hollywood. The food was fantastic, the service was great and we loved the atmosphere. We ordered the Filet mignon's. My Mom is pretty picky about how her steak is cooked - medium well but not quite well - but this actually doesn't exists. However, they cooked her streak to her expectations which in in itself is a miracle. We also ordered some sides which were large enough to share and delicious - asparagus and Strip House potatoes.  Our server Ricky was very knowledgeable and friendly. He asked if we were going to a show and I said we had one at 9. Ricky was so considerate to watch timing of our meal to make sure we left in time which I truly appreciated. All in all it was a great experience. Can't wait to return to dig into that famous chocolate cake.

Best dinner I've had to-date. My fianc√© and I stopped here on a whim, clearly underdressed but that didn't matter, service was still on point. We shared a 38 oz porterhouse, loaded baked and broccoli. Appetizer was calamari. Everything was exceptional. Steak literally melted in our mouths like butter. Only downside was being in a food coma in Vegas and in bed by 11 pm. Oh well, it was worth it.

I recently hosted a large dinner group here and Dawn Hammond made it easy and comfortable.  Everyone had a wonderful time and  the food and  service was excellent.  John and Tiffany did a great job making sure everyone's wine glasses were full and that everyone was happy and well taken care of.  Overall I would recommend the Strip House for a fabulous evening.

We tried Strip House on our trip to Vegas. The staff is very attentive.  Our waitress was really helpful and looked like a supermodel.  The food was great and the staff cared about my wife's food allergies.

The goose fat potatoes are truly amazing.  The crispness is out of this world.

Best rib eye I have ever had - and that's an understatement. The black pepper crust on these steaks is unreal. Makes the meat infinitely better. The meat is tender, juicy, and every bite is better than the last. They cook the steaks to the exact temperature you ask for. And the service is UNPARALLELED! Do yourself a favor and ask for Ricky. RICKY IS THE MAN! He provided us with one of the best table experiences we have ever had. Such a gentleman, addressing us with "yes sir, yes ma'am". Everything he suggested tasted amazing. We would come back here for Ricky and for the black pepper crusted rib eye. Ps...when he suggests the famous 24 layer chocolate cake, don't say no even though you think you cannot possibly eat another bite. Like Ricky says, you won't regret it

Very good food here! Great wine/drink menu, and the appetizers are huge and easily shared. We had a table of 5 and everyone seemed happy with the portion sizes. I recommend the lobster pasta and the goose fat potatoes. It was your typical expensive and decadent steakhouse menu, but they delivered big time on quality and flavor.

Looking for great service and food on the strip? This place really shines. I've eaten at many of the nicest place in Vegas and was pleasantly surprised.  Service was outstanding. 

Decor was nice. We came on a Tuesday night so it wasn't loud or overly full. 
We had a party of 2 and ordered the seafood plateau. It was a nice portion of seafood from the raw bar and worth ordering if you plan on ordering two+ seafood options as appetizers. The ribeye was fantastic with a nice pepper crust. They provide plenty of sauces for dishes but you do not need sauces on this food!

Our server, Chris, was very attentive and made great recommendations. He was also a very social server which we appreciated. He made pleasant small talk while he cleaned up our plates and delivered items. We felt right at home.

Overall wonderful experience and we will be back.

Pricey and the food was Ok. Nothing to brag about. Went on a double date here and I like the fact that it is isolated from the casino area of Planet Hollywood. I also liked how the chefs brought out a dish they made to us. Made for a more personal feel. I also liked the dimly lit area which gave more intimacy to the dinner. It was definitely a positive. My cousin's portion though bothered me. For being a pretty hefty price for a surf and turf, it was pretty dinky and small. Nothing really stood out for me meal-wise. It was more the decor and more personable staff.

Absolutely the best ribeye steak in town - aged & cooked to perfection and just melts in your mouth. The potatoes Romanoff are delicious, creamed spinach is velvety, the lobster bisque is a meal in itself full of tasty lobster bites. The service is impeccable. No doubt, this is our favorite restauran in LV. We dine here every time we're in town.

Aaaaah Vegas. Home to splendid vices including great food! I was in Vegas at the time staying at Planet Hollywood. Always favoring a steak house just my luck was a joint inside properly named "Strip House Steak House". 

Lets start with the decor...I dig it. Dimly lit with red hues and classic black/white pin up model images. Breathes a classy yet seductive vibe (unfortunately some of the pin ups are nude so not the best place to bring little joey and elizabeth for dinner). We sat at the booth facing the bar but theres another seating area behind. Vibe was laid back and quiet which I cherished. Great setting to enjoy a lovely meal and unwind whether you just lost or won at the black jack table.

The food is great! Ordered the New York Strip with Mac and Cheese. Side orders can respectfully serve 2-3 so keep that in mind. The NY Strip medium well was fixed delightfully and tasted amazing. Mac N Cheese probably the best ive had at any steak house and I've knocked out the top 5 in Houston and Chicago. For drinks had the Apple martini (nicely done) and a strawberry mojito(little lack luster, could have done without). Dessert was a soft chocolate brownie w/ warm fudge draped across it and vanilla ice cream ontop. The sensation upon eating it made me feel not too guilty about the calories it packed and I slept guilt free ha!

Service was top notch but hey with steak houses that's a must! Intend to go back next Vegas trip. cheers!
Surprise there is a good steak house in Planet Hollywood!  Food is excellent and the steak was great.  Sides were perfect I felt like I was in a an NYC steakhouse.

Our last trip to Vegas was to celebrate the BF's birthday, and his heterosexual life-mate's (A.K.A best friend) birthday.

I decided I wanted to take them to dinner - someplace that the boys would dig, and someplace I could enjoy as well. Naturally, I turned to Yelp! 

What did i discover? Strip House!!

How can you go wrong with: steak and walls covered with photos of half nekkid ladies???

You really can't!

Everything from the service to the meal was exceptional! The cuts of meat were wonderful, and the boys barely grunted a word during their carnivorous devouring (that's how you know it's good!).

The wine list was really substantial - something for everyone! The waiter recommended a very good bottle of wine that I wouldn't have considered. 

Some of the dishes we grazed on: Rib Eye, New York Strip and the Filet Mignon. Sides we shared: Truffled Creamed Spinach, french fries and sauteed mushrooms. ALL DELICIOUS!!!!

Strip House Steakhouse was everything I expected from a Vegas hotel steakhouse. I can only speak for what I had, since I ate there alone, but from the look of the other customers' faces, the entire menu is top notch. Starting with the bar, the drinks were expensive, as can be expected in Vegas, but well worth it and well made. I had a Sapphire and tonic and a glass of Bordeaux. Dinner itself was top notch. I was served an assortment of bread with butter to start. The mini- French loaf was great and the butter was soft enough to spread without any difficulty. As an appetizer, I had the lobster bisque. At first I found it a bit salty, but it somehow became more delicious with every spoonful. It had a nice thick consistency and had a good amount of lobster that seemed to almost melt on contact. For dinner, I had the 8oz filet done medium and asparagus. The steak was wonderful, slightly salty and crispy on the edges, soft, pink and full of flavor on the inside. It was served with a Bearnaise sauce, but there was a variety of other sauces available. The steak also came with a roasted tomato half and garlic off to the side. My only disappointment with the food came with the asparagus. For $8 I was expecting something a little more exciting. It was served with Hollandaise sauce on the side, but it was still just ok. It was carried by the steak rather than complimenting it. The waiter was a 10 out of 10. He balanced making sure I was ok with not annoying me perfectly and brought everything to the table quickly . My only other dislikes of this amazing place were the noise from the casino and a slightly wobbly table. I know, that is a minuscule thing, but that is what separates amazing from very good. I can't rate this place against other Vegas steakhouses because I haven't been to any others, but I would rate this in my top five ever, but probably #5.  And if it's any indication of other Vegas steakhouses, I am in heaven.

I'm very conflicted in writing a two star review for the Strip House. On one hand, the service was maybe the best I have ever enjoyed. Jasel (sp?) and later Olivia were incredibly courteous and worked very hard at rectifying a bad situation. However, some things just can't be excused no matter how nicely the staff behaves.

We went to Strip House for a bachelor party dinner and they were nice enough to set us up in a private room. The restaurant has a very cool vibe where it isn't stuffy like most steakhouses but is still very elegant. We arrived a little late and they were nice enough to save our private room for us despite our not showing up on time which was very appreciated. 

Jasel (sp?) was our waitress and she explained the menu perfectly and was very professional and cordial to us. Orders were taken at the right time and the team of other staff members made sure we never had to ask for water refills or anything.

So... what was the problem? The food. I went to Strip House based on the recommendation of my Casino host who had been there 10 times and said it was incredible every time. My steak, a 10 once fillet was good but not great and instead of being cooked "rare plus" was cooked more "medium rare plus" but that kind of thing happens with so large of an order. What was NOT acceptable was a few people had steaks coming out well done or well done plus when they had ordered medium rare. The guy to my right had ordered medium rare and his steak had no red or pink whatsoever. It was cooked over well. Other issues included one steak which was completely dry when brought out and more completely improperly cooked steaks. All told, of the 11 steaks we ordered 6 were cooked correctly or at least close enough and 5 were nowhere close to right. 

We had reservations that night at LAX and were already running late so we didn't have an extra 45 minutes for them to cook new steaks and to eat them so we basically all shared everything we'd ordered and they brought out maybe one or two new steaks. It wasn't the ideal was to start the evening and it isn't cool to make your patrons pass pieces of steak all over the table so everyone is able to eat. 

Olivia, the bar manager, came to our table and apologized and was generous to bring us a complimentary bottle of Cristal which was VERY nice of her and highly appreciated. We knew that the mistakes took place somewhere in the kitchen and were not her fault nor our waitresses but both of them apologized and did their best to smooth over the situation. Now, none of the steaks were removed from the bill but the given the free bottle of Cristal I guess that isn't so large of an issue. 

Most likely, based on my last experience, I wouldn't return to Strip House but it is entirely possible that my experience was anomalous and your experience will be better.

Fabulous atmosphere. Delicious drinks. Amazing food. Fantastic service. This wasn't second time here, and it was as great as my first! I brought my son for his 21st birthday, and he LOVED it!! Scott made the entire experience memorable with his shining personality and his on point service!

I was surprised by how much I enjoyed my dinner at Strip House.  To begin, it's got a cool vibe.  It is dark, which I usually don't care for, but here I was cool with it.  There are also pictures of pin ups around which added to the vibe.  

We were immediately approached by our server and ordered a bottle of wine.  Strip House has a decent selection, certainly not the best when compared to some steakhouses on the strip, but I've seen much worse.  The prices were what you would expect to pay on the strip.  We split the crab cake to start.  This was a solid dish, the cake was crispy and came with plenty of tangy remoulade.  I also liked the corn salsa.  It was also a good size, so each of us had several bites.  

To eat, I had one of the specials, the dry aged 14 ounce ribeye.  To begin, all steaks are served with a bulb of roasted garlic, which I love.  The steak was excellent.  Cooked to a perfect medium rare, it had excellent crust on the exterior.  To be able to achieve such a crust without any burning is an impressive feat.  It added to the flavor without adding a charcoal quality.  The steak was juicy and the dry aging was noticeable.  I'm glad I ordered it as opposed to the bone in ribeye on the menu.  The dry aged steak may be smaller, but the flavor more than makes up for what you lose in ounces.

On the side, we had the mac and cheese and the potatoes romanoff, or twice baked potatoes au gratin.  The mac and cheese was solid, it was very cheesy and had the requisite string of cheese when you spooned it out of the dish.  Also, a serving contains more than enough for 2 people.  But, the real star was the potatoes.  The parmesan in this dish was fantastic.  It had a nice crusty top and was smooth throughout.  I wish I could create this dish at home.  It's a must order if you are a cheese and/or potato fan.

We had a great evening and were well taken care of by our server.  Strip House may not get the pub of some of the other more famous steakhouses on the strip, but it can more than hold its own.
This is one of the best steakhouses in the country. Every time I come to Vegas, I make sure to book a table.

When visiting Las Vegas one must have a at least ONE meal at a high end steakhouse! On this visit the Strip House at Planet Hollywood was the winner. My buddy had raved about this place, so we went with it. Since we didn't have reservations we just moseyed up to the bar. Excellent service by both bartenders throughout the dinner! Started with the Cocktail Combo, which features two jumbo shrimp and two oz. lump crab. Fresh and delicious! As for the main course, we both went with the 20oz. Bone-in Rib Eye. Cooked and seasoned to a perfect med-rare. Saut√©ed Green Beans and Garlic Herbed French Fries were the perfect Sides to this meal. No room for dessert after all that! Had to work off that great meal at the black jack tables!

Strip House has a great location in the middle of the Strip in the trendy new Planet Hollywood hotel.  Strip House's original restaurant is in NYC and I hear it's one of the best steakhouses there.  So my bf and I went there before seeing a show and it was pretty tasty.  We have been to Strip Steak by Michael Mina at Mandalay Bay and I think this is better.

We ordered a steak each and a two sides to share.  I ordered my usual FILET MIGNON med rare to med and in comparison to my boyfriend's bone-in NY strip it was just ok.  The filet had a good crust but I would have liked it to come a lil warmer or at least a warm plate but was still good.  The bone BONE-IN NY STRIP he had was EXCELLENT, great crust seasoned to perfection with a lil spicy (we always like anything with a some kick) but did not  overpower the flavor of the beef and not too fatty.  Now the sides were great additions to the meal, one of the better steakhouse we've been to with exceptional side dishes.  We ordered GOOSE FAT POTATOES (recommended by many reviewers of the NYC lcoation) which is a big ball of mashed potatoes fried with a super crispy crust.  It was good different potato side dish.  We also had their BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED SPINACH which was richly flavored.  If you like creamed spinach then you'll love this version.  FInally, we tried their CHOCOLATE CAKE.  Definitely THE BEST chocolate cakes I've had and it's HUGE.  It is 24 layers of moist chocolate cake and rich ganache; and that's it.  No nuts nor  fruit or any other extras, just chocolate.  We did however make ours a la mode, DELICIOUS!

It's a new restaurant in Vegas so try when you're in town and please save room for dessert.  Overall it was a 5 star meal!

More like 2 1/2 Stars for me. 

I do love my steak, and I have to be honest, I've had better. Yes, the ambiance and decor are impressive as expected being in Vegas, but what matters most is the food. 

I ate with a large party (15+). I ordered the 10 oz. fillet (medium rare) as well as a recommended glass of their Riesling. The meat was prepared well and I did enjoy it, but for some reason I usually get an intense reaction whenever I have impeccable steaks during my first bite and I just didn't get that same reaction this time. 

What I can compliment is their service. The waiter consistently made sure that everyone in our party was being attended to. We even had a situation where a few people left the table to go outside and the busser assumed that they were finished with their plates. When my friends returned they told our server that they weren't finished, and what did they do? They cooked a full meal for each of them (whatever they ordered, of course) and boxed it up to-go! So, they basically got a whole new meal for free! I don't know of any other place that would do that. 

And although the service was extremely impressive, I still had to push for 3 stars because of the food. Sorry. =/

Excellent dinner at Strip House.  Burrata appetizer  was excellent. Large rib eye cooked perfectly rare. Well seasoned with a great black pepper crust. Very tender, great beef flavor.  Excellent creamed spinach. Twice baked potato side was a disappointment.  Prices are expensive but reasonable for a Vegas steak house.   Wine list is steakhouse standard at expected prices.  Favorite of Vegas steak houses thus far.

We were recently in Las Vegas to attend the IBS Trade Show and we were staying close to Planet Hollywood. There was four of us and we had trouble deciding on food! Casual and cheap or dressy and no so cheap! Well this was the place! I only gave it four stars versus five due to the cost of this fantastic dinner! Yes, it was fantastic! I have posted a few items that we had. First of all, the waiter was exceptional! I think his name was Scott, but wouldn't swear to it due to alcohol consumption! He was extremely helpful with explaining the menu and what would best suite each of our appetites. Love the chic d√©cor with the red vintage feel. We had a corner booth style table that was private and allowed for intimate conversation. I felt that the food portions were overall generous. Especially being a high end steak house. My favorites were the Maine Lobster Linguine and Lobster Bisque (Picture that is posted doesn't do it justice!). Obviously I am a lobster fan! My girlfriend had the surf and turf. Again, there was lobster involved! Her steak was cooked perfect for her and she is picky! We had the Baby Iceberg Salad. Always one of my favorites and they didn't miss a beat with this one. Broccolini was nice, but the Black Truffle Creamed Spinach is the best ever! The waiter recommended the perfect wine to pairing with our entrees. I am now on the hunt for one of the wines to purchase by the bottle locally in the Phoenix area.

Highly recommend Strip House Steak House! Budget accordingly. It is well worth every dime! I also feel like they would go the extra mile if you had a special occasion going on. Just call ahead! Perfect place for a celebration of some sort!

As I always do at every steakhouse, is start with the lobster bisque. 
Broth was awesome! But no lobster! And had some sort of pasta textured tiny balls in it! Lose that, and put some lobster in it, and it would be great!!!
Had the 8oz filet oscar, cooked to perfection! Great service!

Hey Tilman,

Question:   How do you go from having one of the BEST steaks - to having the WORST night in 30 minutes?

Answer:  Order the 20 OZ bone in Rib Eye, cooked to perfection, where the next bite is better then the last and you even pick up the bone to savor the flavor - and order the cream truffle spinach.

My wife and I are guests at Planet Hollywood this weekend and made reservations at Strip House, looking forward to a fabulous meal.  As our reservation time approached, we were gambling (and winning) but we stopped so we would not be too late. (Mistake #1)

We were seated and the ambiance, music, wait staff, etc could not have been better!
The bread plate consisted of a variety of breads, all which were excellent.

We ordered 2 of the $52 Bone in Rib Eyes and since everything is a-la-cart, we ordered the spinach. 

The Rib Eyes (I wont call them steaks as that would be insulting) arrived and were cooked to PERFECTION....the first bite AMAZING. As we worked on them, we also took bites of the spinach.  As we were finishing our meal, I started to feel a little queasy,so I excused myself to the bathroom. When I got back to the table, I asked my wife if she wouldn't mind taking care of the bill as I wanted to go up to the room.

When I got to the room, I barely made it to the toilet before (sorry for the graphic) barfed my guts out.  When you throw up, you can usually taste what the cause was and all I could taste was the truffle spinach.

My wife arrived a few minutes later and immediately did the same thing I did, afterwards telling me she had the same taste.

After we regained our composure, we debated what the cause of our puking (and ruining an otherwise good night) and both agreed it was the spinach.

I called the restaurant and spoke with a manager. I identified myself and told him what happened.
He apologized and indicated that he understands that the spinach can be a little rich at times and that he heard of a similar problem happening with the spinach in the past.  He then asked what did I want him to do about it?

I answered I did not know (wanting to see what he said) and he offered us to have us back. That was a nice jester, but at that moment the LAST place I wanted to go back to. (Maybe on another trip as we frequently stay at PH, but certainly not back to back)
I was a little surprised that the offer was not to remove it from our room charge, but I don't know if he had the authority to do that.

Rather then going out and having fun gambling, we spent the night in the room.  .

In hindsight, perhaps we should have stayed where we were winning earlier rather then leaving a hot streak for dinner here.

I guess you can say we did gamble....on the spinach.....and lost.


We are at the hotel until Sunday, If anyone wants to contact me.

Great food here. 

Came here with a large party of all hungry guys for my bachelor weekend. Service was very good and the food was great. We ordered everything from onion strings, to their spinach, mac & cheese, duck fat fried potato, sauteed mushrooms, a nice wine, lamb, and of course steaks galore. Everything was good.

They even had us in our own little corner of the restaurant where we were really allowed to enjoy ourselves. Got a little bit pricey at the end of the night, but the quality and service of this joint was worth it for our Vegas trip. It was a nice way to start off the evenings adventures.

I thought this place was OK. Cute little old school stripper gal kinda theme. The food was good but not great. Service was great though. I would come here again- problem is there are soooo many nice restaurants close by to choose from that I think this one gets lost in the mix.

My daughter and I made a reservation on Christmas Eve for Christmas Day and it was not a problem; I also received a call on Christmas Day to confirm our reservations. Staff was so personable and kind. Carlos was our waiter and he gets 10 stars by himself for delivering great customer service. Carlos is so attentive. I enjoyed the bone in filet mignon which was full of flavor with potatoes twice baked; I think they call it Potato Ramonoff. My daughter had a Caesar salad which was so fresh with calamari which was great as well. The flavor of the food made me eat slowly and enjoy every moment. I was so satisfied but did not have room for dessert. Our bill was a little over $100 and well worth it.

Ahh it's like I can still smell the wonderful smell that only a good steak can give.

**rewind back a few weeks**

We enter the steakhouse and was warmly greeted by the hostess.  No fru fru, snotty feel to this place.  Instead, it's warm, red, and with nice pictures of past glamour.

an aperitif came first that was sadly forgettable...then...the courses began.

First:  Warm garlic bread with gorgonzola fondue.
Good beginning, but if I could do it all again, I would order something lighter to prepare my stomach for the incoming assault (in a good way) of hearty red meat.  A very large appetizer that was shared by two but should have been shared by three or four.

Then came the meat we were waiting for.  We had the center cut chateaubriand that was carved tableside.  Amazing stuff!  The crust on the steak not only had a nice texture, but was full of flavor.  The inside melted in my mouth.  It was juicy and cooked just right at medium rare and the thought of it is making me salivate.  We ordered a side of truffled creamed spinach which was the best creamed spinach I've ever had.  Once the spinach touched my tongue, my eyes closed in joy.

Sadly we were too stuffed to order their 21 layer cake and I blame this on the delectable, but heavy appetizer we had ordered.  Next time layer cake, next time...you are mine!

I came here on the night of my 21st birthday with my boyfriend and the awesomeness started when we walked right in. Where can I start? We were seated right away and our server was Ryan. He was awesome! Very prompt and informative. Throughout the night we never waited for our water to be refilled. It seems like the guy was almost waiting in the wings to refill the waters. Which was very impressive. The atmosphere was great. The bread basket was nice with a variety of different breads to try. I ordered the lobster bisque for my appetizer and was pleasantly surprised. The way that they brought it out and served to me was impressive and it was divine. my boyfriend ordered the Crisp Organic Chicken and it was really good and moist. The flavors were married together beautifully. I ordered the Colorado Lamb Rack and I was floored by how moist and tender they were. The dijon crust with the au jus was just completely amazing. We did not stick around for dessert, unfortunately. Hopefully next time when we decide to indulge.

Thank you Strip House...you were amazing for Restaurant Week!

The service was excellent, glasses were always half full, and everyone had a smile.  The server didn't have the restaurant week menu up front though, so I thought we were going to start off on a bad foot, but the rest of the night went smoothly.

Starting off was the comp bread platter :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#M64Hy_zMuIusbCGE0v6_RA

There were some good ones there, including pretzel bread, onion bread, and something mixed with cranberries.  The bread came out lightening fast...within a minute or two of us sitting down.

Then came the salads...

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#e3ZQxqsw96YtGaayUjh76Q

Caesar was a nice rendition of the classic.... It had Hearts of Romaine, Paprika Croutons, and Shaved Parmesan.  You know it is good if you catch me eating lettuce...I hate lettuce!

But this is when I knew the night was going to be amazing....check out the Strip House Roasted Bacon Salad :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#aXUMZua2dF2xG6vz4uy5FA

More like pork belly salad! Look how thick those slices are....and great meat/fat ratio!!!  Came with Baby Arugula and Russian Dressing.  A MAN'S kind of salad...amazing!

On to the entrees!  Wife went with the Filet Mignon and added two Seared Scallops (+$12) :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#A9XfCIn3WoY9mNCL2xLzCQ

The steak was cooked perfectly and had a beautiful char on the outside, but a little heavy to taste with the salt/pepper/mix and the char.  Takes away a little from that yummy steak, but not enough to really complain about it.  The scallops were amazing though and cooked well with great taste!

I ordered the 28 day dry aged Ribeye :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#BCKElERFaMQBWuKn1oCtPg

It was also cooked perfectly cooked, but with that same char on the outside.  The fat was pretty tender, and I ate a good bit of it on purpose lol...but overall it was a 4/5 for me!

The sides, Crisp Goose Fat Potatoes and Black Truffle Creamed Spinach :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#19xyxl1DFKOEBxe_Zc5VDA

The potatoes were good, with the crust being almost hash brown like, but the Truffle spinach was out of this world!  Amazing mix of creamy goodness, with a bite of truffle flavor that was outstanding.  You HAVE to order these...blew my mind!  They also gave us a side of their steak sauce, but it was WAY to sweet for me...almost BBQ sauce like.  I wouldn't order a sauce for a good steak anyways!

Dessert...Warm Chocolate Brownie...

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#iRri0RfZjWsza3vDkf-S_Q

Just like it sounds, a warm choco brownie.  It was good, but not amazing...unlike the Cheesecake with Berry Sauce!!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/strip-house-steak-house-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#nj7KTLBgNnGIbW8M47NtlQ

Best cheesecake I've had! The consistency was like whipped butter....super tender and amazingly flavorful!  This was the clear winner of the desserts, and an amazing way to end dinner!

This is a great steakhouse in town, hiding inside PH!  It won't be the best steak in town (unless you really love that salt/pepper char), but it will be a night to remember!

We had the New York Steak, it was PERFECTLY made, and the Filet Mignon which was also done perfectly. Our sides were asparagus and the scalloped potatoes. 

I also had a few glasses of cab. 

The decor was so pretty. I love anything with reds in it and it had bountiful topless women pictures  everywhere. And even the guests sitting next to us were extremely nice. 

Wow, it was delicious. My steak melted in my mouth. I am definitely going again.

This place is hard to find and the menu is a little too simple, BUT the service was out of the world.  Our waiter was amazing and the hostess had communicated the food allergy and the fact that we were going to a show in advance.  The manager made his rounds checking on tables and regulars without being disruptive or unwelcome.  Great experience!

Wow. I realize sending a vegetarian into a meat palace isn't going to turn out well...but, the meatatarian was with me and he wasn't impressed either. 

D√©cor - great d√©cor, great theme, standard dark, red, plush steakhouse. The staff was aloof at the door and the waitress was as well. 

We were 20 minutes early for our dinner reservation so we were going to have a cocktail in the lounge which they didn't direct us to, and then the waitress forgot our drinks. 

A manager noticed and fixed the issue however, that was just plain sad. It wasn't bumping- our reservation was for 9pm. Let me say that the choice for this spot was ease of access only as we stayed at PH this last trip. 

We were sat a decent table, a round booth that was comfy and lent us a great vantage point for people watching. 

The waiter was fast, knew the menu and to the point. We were missing out on a return round of drinks. 

I ordered a Beefsteak tomato salad, we ordered shrimp cocktail and calamari to start. DH ordered a fettuccini - lobster fettuccini. 

All tasted AWFUL. Calamari was rubbery, cocktail shrimp were actually jumbo prawns that weren't deveined, tomato salad came as a scalped tomato with some cheese on top. Pasta tasted mushy and the lobster was chewy. 

Luckily we weren't too hungry because we didn't finish any of it - but we also didn't complain. 

Pricing was out of control - even for a steakhouse. Mortons/Hy's is far better quality & service for far less. 

Wouldn't head back here for love or money - nothing nice to say.

I arrived in Vegas early so I decided to go out and treat myself to a good meal. I was staying across at the Vdara, but PH is my favorite place to hang out. So when I saw there was a steak house, why not? I love steak. I was seated first at the bar, my first impression was this was definitely a high class place, you can just tell by looking around, plus it's in a casino/resort in Vegas, it has to be right.

The bartender was super friendly, we talked for a while and since I was alone, the company was nice. It's always a good thing when the bartender talks to you because that means he cares about his job and his customers, which is why I left a fat tip at the end.

I ordered the steak and asparagus. It was amazing! The steak was cooked just the way I liked it.. medium rare, and the asparagus was fresh and tasted great. I was super satisfied when I was done with my meal, couldn't been happier. 

This is a great place to enjoy a good steak, even though price is a little steep, you get what you pay for, it's vegas! Can't ball on a budget. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a good meal.

Went here for our Honeymoon celebration dinner on April 9th, 2015. Amanda was our server and she was AMAZING. Every detail was attended to. The food was fantastic. I had the filet mignon and my husband had the ribeye. Best steak we've ever had. Also, as a complimentary gift in honour of our wedding, we were gifted two glasses of champagne and a HUGE piece of their 24 layer chocolate cake. We counted, every layer is there and it is delicious. We couldn't have asked for better service or food. We were treated to a great time and we can't say enough wonderful things about their staff. GREAT choice if you're in the area and would like a phenomenal meal.

One of the best parts of Vegas has to be the amazing variety of top notch restaurants you can choose from.  I am always trying to find the best ribeye steak in town.  I have to say, this was in the top 3!  

Oh, and you have to try to the mac'n'cheese.  And don't let your server try and convince you that you don't need your own side of this!

I would have given them a better star rating but the service didn't match the quality of the food.
Hands down one of the best dining experiences of my life. Everything about this place was absolutely phenomenal. A must try!

Great Steak House!! 

The service is excellent. You have to make appointment.

The abience is quite upscale, a little bit dark, and well-decorated.

Great selections of wine and definitely delicious steak.
The price can be very expensive, but definitely worth it!

I wil ldefinitely come back the next time I visit Vegas.

Come on Strip House. The quality of everything here is just great. It's the type of place that I would drive 3 hours to eat at. The Strip House just does everything right.

The salads, the steaks and the sides. The Strip steak was, and is my favorite. The wedge salad is over the top. And if you eat desert, get the cake and nothing else.

The prices are fair for the quality, and the service. A must every time I hit the Strip.

Ate here this past weekend for mine and my best friend's birthday.  We ended up here for a couple reasons.  First, it was pretty much the only restaurant with good yelp reviews that was able to take a late reservation for 8 people at dinner time.  Second, we were staying at PH towers and Strip house is in PH.  

It wasn't super busy, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the food.  The steaks were REALLY good.  I ordered Lobster Linguine, which was good, but I should've just gone for a steak since this is a steak house.  Almost everyone else got steaks and everyone was very happy with their meals.  We also shared 4 sides - mac n cheese, potato romanoff, creamed corn, and fries.  They were all decent although not mind blowing. 

With everyone getting an entree, 4 sides and 2 bottles of wine, our bill came out to $80/person.  It was expensive, but I can definitely say that we were all happy with the experience and would come back here again.

And I repeat....GET THE STEAK!
Absolutely fantastic!!  Fabulous food and outstanding service.  Will definitely be back.

Extremely disappointed. I don't know whether I am more upset over the quality of the food or the fact that I felt ripped off by the cheap and stingy portions. 
A group of four of us ate here on Sat 3/4/17. The menu is such that you pay for a main course and the sides separately. We ordered one surf and turf, and one 12 ounce filet, plus three sides: strip potatoes, mushrooms and charred broccoli. I ordered a glass of cab.
I order wine every time I eat out and this was the stingiest pour I have ever seen. For $16/glass, I would expect closer to a 9 ounce pour. What I got felt like 4-5 ounces. I was done with my wine before my steak even came out but $16 for a pour that small there was no way I was ordering another.  I found myself eyeballing the couple next to us as they had a bottle on their table and I was longing for a little more. 
When our steak arrived I was shocked at how small it was. I knew we had ordered the 12 ounce which would be about six ounces each. I've been on meal plans where I've weighed and measured my protein portions, typically in four ounce portions, and this did NOT look like a 12 ounce steak/6 ounce portion on my plate. I glanced at the steak across the table because it was the smaller filet on the surf and turf and it looked to be the same size as ours. I should mention I wouldn't normally be this focused on the steak size except that we hadn't eaten for a long time and we were starving, plus for $56 for the steak and no sides, one wants to get what they've paid for. 
After tasting the steak I couldn't believe how dry it was, especially for filet. The internal temp looked proper for medium, but the steak itself was still dry. I literally found myself putting butter on it to add some fat which is something I would normally not do. The broccoli had the wrong texture to it, as though it had been cooked to al dente but perhaps had sat too long waiting to be served. The other sides- mushrooms and potatoes- were just ok, but really the overall feeling from the meal was that for a very expensive place, it was all just "ok." 
No one in our group said anything at the time because it was our first night in Vegas and we all just wanted to have a good time. No one wanted to be complaining about anything and besides, it's hard to have any self respect when you tell them they didn't pour enough wine in your glass or can they come weigh your steak, but the customer should never have to feel they have been gypped when you're at a restaurant as pricey as this one was. We ate and then had a concert to go to but later on we started to talk about it and realized we all felt the same way, and that both steaks were dry, the sides were nothing special, the wine pour was stingy, etc. $200 for dinner with shared entrees and one alcoholic beverage gone down the drain. The next few times we ate out we felt even more annoyed because we were receiving better food, in bigger portions, for better pricing. Examples, Aria Cafe, Aria Buffett, grand Lux Cafe, Gordon Ramsey's pub and grill. 
We decided to return the next evening and let the manager know how we felt but as it was after the fact, he did nothing to remedy the situation. Had he even offered us a couple of glasses of wine on the house or some chips to gamble with I would have felt like their intent was in good faith, but as it is, I would say you take your business elsewhere.

Ok so it's not really dressy, the guys cannot wear tanks and absolutely no swimsuits other then that your ok. Lighting is dark and can be romantic if you want. Everything is a la carte. Our server is awesome. We did 4 sides with 6 people and it was a lot. 

Prosciutto- 5 stars 
Oysters- very fresh 5 stars
Crab cake - 5 stars

Mac and cheese- 5 stars
Asparagus- 4 stars
Goose potatoes- 1 star 
Mushrooms- 5 star

My husband and I split a ribeye entree and that was made perfect. The price was crazy. Almost $100 a person, but the experience was nice. Probably come back and do a couples dinner.
Great service, awesome steak, even better 24 layer chocolate cake! Well done Strip House! If in Vegas, must visit!

We recently came to the Strip House for Dinner while I was in Vegas and I enjoyed my experience. I sampled the Bib salad and the porter house. The salad was a bit over dressed for my liking but still very tasty. Fresh crumbles of blue cheese and bacon makes any salad delicious! My porter house was cook medium rare and was very good. There was a crispy crust of spices which added so much flavor to the steak. Service was impeccable and I would definitely come back.

The food here sucks.  The service is OK, drinks are fine but for the price, it's terrible.  Granted I can't stand Vegas to begin with but when you fork over $250 for a shitty steak, some canned veggies and a few cocktails, you know you've been duped.  Anyone that say this place has the best steak or any derivation thereof is insane, delusional or both.  The food here is barely edible, they have some nerve charging what they do.

It was a perfect evening, the hostess walked us to a comfy corner booth. Our server Carlos was so friendly and attentive.  Food was absolutely mouth watering. The charred pepper steak was delicious. Thier cosmo was also super tasty. I loved the decor! dark with romantic candlelight. At the end of an amazing meal our server brought me a piece of chocolate fudge cake for my birthday. Yum! I definitely enjoyed every aspect of my night,  can't wait to return.

If you're going to the Strip House for steak . . . the steak was good . . . perfectly cooked . . . and the chef did a great job on the Lobster Bisque.  The oysters were fresh.  The room itself had a great, traditional steak house look.

That's where the compliments end.  Here's the rest of the story
:
First, I'm not an old codger, but I have to say that dining in a formal dining room with rap music blaring over the speakers ruins the whole experience, even in Las Vegas.  Service?  It was very good . . . nothing to complain about . . . but our wait staff had absolutely no personality.  In fact, there was no personal interaction whatsoever.   Courses arrived so quickly that we felt rushed and were made to wonder if everything was pre-cooked and just waiting for an order to come in.

Aside from the steak, the food was not good.  The chicken, while perfectly cooked, was coated in some kind of horrible-tasting crust.  Most of the sauces and sides ranged from mediocre, (Potatoes Romanoff), to downright disgusting, (oyster sauces with rotten fish smell, sickeningly sweet steak sauce).

In sum, the Strip House was ADAQUATE but nothing really special.  On top of that, it was horribly over-priced.  (We skipped ordering a bottle of wine, because the wine list was laughingly ridiculous).   If I'm going to spend $250 for 2, there are so many very exceptional venues in Las Vegas that I can't think of a single reason to dine here.

Started with the crab cake and beef jerky. Crab cake is one big portion. Nice crust on outside and served with green beans and potatoes. Not the traditional crab cake but that is what made is even better. Good flavor. The jerky was very  flavorful  and the salad goes perfect with it. The steaks are served with a char and salted crust. Loved the crust!!! Cooked perfect! Goose fat potatoes were different but very good. Mac and cheese was rich but that's what was hoping for. . Service was very good. Overall a very good experience and will return!

I LOVE this restaurant.  My company stays at this hotel twice a year, and the Strip House is one of our favorite spots.  Very quiet inside, dark, relaxing, great service, excellent food.  I get the Filet Mignon and also pastas and fish, and everything is awesome.  Even the side dishes (mushrooms, creamed spinach) are phenomenal.  VERY pricey (like $40 for steak with no side dishes) but I get reimbursed so it's OK.  The decor is slightly risque but classy enough to bring a date.

I visit Las Vegas quite often both on business trips and for vacations, I've eaten at many different restaurants, and due to the outstanding service I received from my cocktail server I can now say that I will definitely be coming back every time I visit. The service was absolutely top notch, I now know why Vegas is #1 in customer service. It is because of gems (no pun intended) like Crystal that make my stay enjoyable. I had dinner at the lounge and wanted to order a steak and I didn't know what to pair it with, Crystal told me told to try the dry age rib eye and to pair it with a wente cab. Wow does she know her stuff, not only was the pairing spot on, There was never a moment where I found myself needed anything that I would have to ask for. She made sure my wine was never empty. Needless to say because of my wonderful experience I had to give the restaurant and especially Crystal a lovely review.

Thank you Crystal you are one in a million!

This was my last night of my birthday weekend. I wanted to go somewhere nice. I heard about their chocolate cake and had to have a piece. My son and I were seated at a booth type seat. Not my favorite seating. A girl next to us was drunk and was very annoying. Not the restaurants fault. The waiter was very polite and sophisticated. We each had a very nice cocktail. We both ordered the special, surf and turf. It consisted of a 6 oz. filet and a 1 lb. lobster tail.  We had the pureed potatoes as our side order. It was presented beautifully. They also served drawn butter and their special steak sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection. The lobster was laid out beautifully on the plate. It also was cooked perfectly. We decided to take the cake to go. One piece is enough to serve 4-5 people. I was a little disappointed in the cake. It was to rich. Overall it was outstanding. It's not cheap, that's for sure. But if you are celebrating a special day I would suggest them highly.

Can I say WOW! If you are a big fan of steaks and has the wallet to put out for it. This is definitely the place to eat.  The bone-on rib-eye was my choice.  I wasn't really too hungry, but once I had one bite, I was amazed on how perfectly cooked/juicy this was. I just had to finish it. I had it with deep-fried onions and wild sauteed mushrooms. I think it was the right sides for the steak. Definitely a must if you are a steak fan.

Thought they threw down a good Filet (but not incredible). However, the seafood platter was ridiculous (oysters, crab legs, lobster, etc...). It's worth coming for the seafood platter - that's about it.

Can you say a hidden gem in Vegas ? From all the big names like Gordon Ramsey,Morton's and all the major strip hotel steakhouses , there is Striphouse. Located on the 2nd floor of the main casino Planet Hollywood . It has a very nice dark ambience inside surrounded with Hollywood legends red seats . Service here is fantastic and very prompt . I like the way they bring you pretzel bread and little cheese bread rolls with room temperature butter simply amazing.  The Menu has a perfect simple choice of prime steaks on the menu. I had the 8oz fillet cooked at a perfect medium rare with  instant taste orgasams accompanied by broccoli and mushrooms was the perfect side . I'm getting hungry as I'm writing this and want to go back they do have a amazing chocolate cake which I highly recommend you try. If you're looking for that perfect steakhouse which is quiet dark and very relaxing look no further strip house at planet Hollywood is the spot

Just about a carbon copy of their restaurant in lower Manhattan..that we have dined at a few times over the past few years. beautifully decorated....quiet and respectful.....delicious food...excellent service and very expensive. Its supposed to be designed like you are dining in a very high end bordello. Cannot say a bad word about our experience. I had the bone in rib eye($54)...juicy and full of flavor. My wife had her usual salmon....said it melted in her mouth. My son had the 16 oz. NY strip and declared it very very good. to start..our drinks were potent and made correctly. two us split a Caesar salad. we all shared the creamed spinach and the goose fat potatoes. No room left for dessert. Its a pretty standard steakhouse experience but I say that in a positive way. You get what you pay for..and what you get here are really good meals!!

Had a dinner with friends another night and we had a great time. My friend and I shared the 24 Chateaubriand cut beautiful seasoning cooked perfect, for a sauce we chose which I don't remember the name but remind hollandaise it was delicious, four sides we had a salted mushrooms mac and cheese.....
Nice environment I loved the dark red kinda...
Definitely go back very good service.

Food was great!

But went here the night after we went to N9ne Steakhouse and sadly it just didn't match up all the way (hence the 4/5 stars).

Would definitely eat here again though. Fabulous steak, crab cakes, and shrimp.

Decor is also lovely, red and dim with pictures of half naked women from the 40's and 50's everywhere. 

Oh and got a sample of the potato soup (compliments of the chef) and it was also yummy. Complimentary samples, always a plus.

The only reason this isn't a 5+ star review is because of the prices (ouch!).  The menu is standard for a steakhouse in terms of selection and prices, but the way the dishes are done makes every item truly exciting so they deserve extra props in that department.

The presentation of every dish is impeccable.  The shotglass of cold watermelon soup to whet the appetite and awaken your tastebuds does just that--it's amazing.  The salmon with basil pesto foam, lobster linguine, and steak were all devoured.  Absolutely incredible.

Let's start with our server. Carlos. If you ever want the truth, best, customer service in a server, we found him! Exceptional service all the way around! Thank you again Carlos. Now moving on to the food. I ordered a filet mignon and lobster tail oscar style that my wife had the Flaming yawn with lobster tail top of blue cheese. But first we started with the kalamari and Caesar salad. Can I say very flavorful very tasty, cooked perfectly, nice crisp salad. And the timing was perfect. From bringing our appetizers to taking plates away to bringing our second course, to taking plates away to bringing our entr√©es taking. To top it all off we could not even ordered dessert as I could not put another piece of food in my mouth, yet Carlos knew it was my birthday and ended up bringing out the 24 layer chocolate cake, as a birthday dessert gift! Hands down, the best restaurant experience I have ever had exclamation point

Dinner for 22 is a tough number to serve and keep happy.
Fantastic job by the service crew
 Nice to see management assign the correct number of serverrs. Steaks were fantastic. Appitizer bacon dish was worthy of the visit by itself. 
There are many choices in Vegas, put this one on your list.

I ate here two weekends ago when we were in town and staying at the Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers.  When we stopped by earlier in the afternoon to make dinner reservations, the earliest they can seat us was at 9:30 for a Saturday night.  No problem since we had to squeeze in an afternoon power nap from the day drinking and site seeing we did earlier in the day.

We got there and it still took a while for our table to be ready for our party of six.  When we sat down, service was a little on the slow side, but that was to accommodate our sixth person who was leaving her car with valet.

We started off with lobster bisque which my boyfriend and I shared, it was nice they split it up for us (versus being cheesy and sharing it in one bowl, lol).  I got the surf & turf dish that came with a petite filet mignon and lobster tail.  He got the rib eye which was enormous!  The side dishes we all shared were all good except the mac & cheese was a little too rich for me, but it was a hit with the others.

Overall, the service was good, the dinner was great, but the company I was with alone deserves five stars.

We walked over to the bar after dinner to continue with our night of drinking and little did I know that comedian, Wayne Brady was lounging right behind us.  Heyyyyyy....

Amazing! We just spent five days in vegas and had many steaks and my strip here was my favorite steak all week! And that potato dish with green chilies and bacon...to die for. It's a huge side, it's definitely shareable for two or three people. I was so impressed with the steak! They have a huge chocolate cake that our friends swear by, but we were all stuffed! Our server was fantastic. 

My only knock...we had eight people around a round table and every single one of us complained that our backs and bottoms hurt from the chairs. They are awful!!! Get a booth because you will be hurting from the nightmare of chairs you have to sit in for the duration of your dinner. but I'll still give it 5 stars.

Very good steak house.  If you plan on going and don't have a cushioned backside, you might want to bring a pillow, or sit in the booth.  The chairs are a bit hard. Luckily, I didn't have a problem in that area.  The steak was great.  Bone in ribeye.  Good taste, I do not recommend the steak sauce.  Tastes a bit too much like ketchup, besides, if you need steak sauce, it isn't a good steak.  The truffle cream spinach was amazing, as well as the Mac "n" cheese.  The potatoes were good, but had a stronger onion taste.  The service was excellent.  Ask for Amanda.  She was amazing.

Wow, that defines the quality of not only the food but the service. Our waitress Adrian, defines what every hostess or waitress should inspire to be. Her beauty, both inside and out was so genuine. I'm a people person myself and I know how it is to be liked or disliked, it's always a great feeling when people appreciate YOU! Adrien was amazing, it's what brings people back, the attention and service they deserve. If you throw the combination of the quality of service plus delicious food with ambience, that leads to prosperity and wealth. It's not about advertising, the word of mouth is everything, it's what brings people back for return business. In any case I ordered the Lamb T-bone and it was amazing, all the side dishes the mushrooms and veggies were freshly cooked. The bar ambience was very impressive it's the first thing you see on the left as you walk in surrounded with great lighting and televisions. Enough said, come on in and enjoy a nice steak and a glass of red at Strip house...

Booked their wine room for 6 people, and we were very nicely greeted, quickly seated, and felt welcomed. The ambiance is classy meets romance and modern touches. Love the red colored designs and photos! 
Our server was excellent, prompt, and very polite. One of the managers hopped in to help us take a group photo (it's the little things that count), and everyone seemed to be working as a team to make the experience delightful for all. 
We all had a steak of some sort, along with the lobster tail, a bottle of wine, and varied sides. Everything was so great! Our check was brought in on time and taken care of quickly. 
Really enjoyed my first experience here! Thank you!

The service was horrible here!

The decor was nice inside and food was decent but I had a horrible experience here. Our server was always rushing and it made our party feel unwelcomed. He would leave the table before the last two people could order their drinks. 

The food was average, my filet was very salty - I had no more than 3 bites and ordered the caprese salad, which was amazing. It could have just been I came on the wrong night, many of the items we wanted to order such as fish, specialty drinks and a few appetizers were all sold out. But it was only 7:00pm? 

I had a bite of the 24 layer chocolate cake which was pretty good but rich, needed a glass of milk to go with it. 

Not sure if I would come back here or recommend it, I would rather go to Gordan Ramsey's.

For being a fairly large resort and touting some of the biggest headliners on the Strip, Planet Hollywood currently does not offer a real "big night out" dining option.  Even though the happy hour at Koi is solid, sitting among those terrible fake plants in the main dining room make me feel like being on a movie set for a straight to video romcom. Pampas is horrendous, and pretty much every other spot is shorts and flip-flops crowd.  

But if something along the lines of a legit dinner (budget allowing) at PH is what must happen, Strip House is the only call.  The ambient red and classic dark steakhouse wood make for a nice setting and an OK-ish meal with a few martinis or a bottle of wine.  

The chef really likes to season the living hell out of the meats.  The salt and pepper crust on my 14 oz medium rare rib-eye almost looked like sweaty pavement upon arrival.

https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ZDFzw2lEiUYZW9EsV0YR2A&userid=8DEyKVyplnOcSKx39vatbg

And while the steak was satisfactorily tender, I found the crust to be overpowering and opted to not finish the entr√©e.  It might also have had to do with those delicious crispy goose fat potatoes giving me that "devour the hell out of me" look from across the table.  My wife didn't mind the seasoning on her rare filet, but that had more to do with it covering a lot less of the surface area of her steak than mine.  I'm not sure if light or no seasoning is an option, but I will attempt to request it if I ever find myself here again.  

I was impressed with our server as he was very cordial, informative and even talked me into a fruity cocktail :P  Maybe he's Marc Savard's understudy?  He couldn't hypnotize us into one of  those huge $15 slices of chocolate cake that kept passing by though.  

2.799912643 stars

Not bad.  Went with the dry aged ribeye, creamed spinach, and mushrooms. The pepper crust on the steak was a bit much. With that kind of cut, it could have done with a bit less. The mushrooms were pretty darn good. The bacon in the creamed spinach was a bit over powering. 

Count on around $80 per person when you go here. Probably not the best I have had, but it's near the top and was a consolation choice when we couldn't get into Gordon Ramsey's new steakhouse to try the Beef Wellington.  If you can't get in there, then this will be a good runner up choice.

The strip house was excellent. The atmosphere is just what I like in a good steak house, darker, old time decor. The service was excellent and the waiter was too notch and wasn't overly present during dinner, just the perfect amount of attention. The house special potatoes and creed spinach were delicious. My bone in rib eye cooked perfectly. All in all a great experience and dinner.

Ive been to the Strip House in Houston and LOVED it. The Strip House in Vegas did not disappoint from a food perspective. Everything was delicious and prepared perfectly. The 2 star rating comes from the fact that I found the service to be less than stellar. Our waiter seemed annoyed by questions about the menu. He argued about splitting our checks. He wasn't terribly responsive to the table's needs. I probably won't go back to this restaurant if/when I go back to Las Vegas. If I Want to go to the Strip House, I'll make the trip to Houston.
B√©arnaise sauce is out of this world. The mashed potatoes and cosmopolitans were amazing as well. I would come back to this restaurant in the future. The service was fast and friendly.

Best Steakhouse! Bone - in Ribeye was cooked perfectly and was definitely took center stage. The Romanoff potatoes were very flavorful and could be considered a main dish.  Our serve Chris provided excellent and friendly service.

After my last visit and prior negative review the manager called me repeatedly to apologize and to make things right. He was so nice and so apologetic and tried very hard to do the right thing. I love the venue and the menu and the crowd so don't let my review deter you (I'm sure it hasn't as there are so many other great reviews!) and try the joint and have a great dining experience. I'll go back and give them another chance when I'm next in Vegas and when I do and it's awesome I'll let you know.

WTF? Am I missing something? The meal started out well with a pretty decent caesar salad but not in the mood for beef I ordered the tuna entree which seems to be a pretty standard fair for a "steak house." When the orders came to the table it seemed like I was sitting in the dunce corner with what looked like an appetizer at best in size and the presentation did not match anything else either. Was the tuna so amazing to justify the small proportioning and odd presentation -- no. Am I going back to take a walk on the beef side for a better experience -- no.

We went to Strip House for my birthday dinner on August 5th.  I got a horrible birthday present from Strip House,  FOOD POISONING!!!  I was the only one at the dinner who ordered scallops.  I ended up spending my birthday feeling like I was going to die.  I had to have a doctor come to my room to give me a shot that cost me $400.    

During our visit we had terrible service.  The waitress forgot all of our cocktails every time we ordered them.  We had to get to a show at 9.  We were sat at the table at 6:30pm.  The food did not arrive to our table until 8:30pm.  We had to rush to eat our food to make it to the show onetime.  I will never recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!!

My wife and I went to The Strip House for dinner on New Year's Eve. So my thoughts were that on a night as crazy as NYE and in a hotel that is about a minute away from being another Harrah's property, we are probably not going to have the best meal ever. Man was i wrong... 

1st, the service was fantastic...happy wait staff who talked you up while they were working, were attentive at all times, and made accommodations on a very busy night. For example, I brought a really nice bottle of wine with me, and the waiter thought that maybe I would not be allowed to do that (I had called ahead, and they had a "buy bottle/waive corkage" policy). he confirmed with the manager, everything was cool, and he even shared a drink with us. 

2nd, the food!! This is truly a steakhouse...you ask for your meat cooked a certain way, it gets cooked that way. Perfectly seasoned, great portions, and the sides are fantastic. Signature creamed spinach, Potatoes Roskoff...you are not leaving that place hungry, and if you have not eaten something that made you say NOTHING but only smile to yourself....than you should give this place a chance. 

3rd, the drinks...we had to wait a couple minutes at the bar because we were early, so we grabbed a drink. This place had a couple of really sharp guys behind the bar; knowledgeable, friendly, no one waited for drinks and they realized that if you are paying $12 for a drink, you should be getting $12 worth of liquor. 

Finally, the atmosphere. I have only been to a couple of places where the decor and atmosphere is...in my opinion...perfect. Strip House is such a place. It is loud enough to make you feel like you picked the right place, but not so deafening you can't hear your companions. Dark velvet wallpaper covered with pictures of '30's burlesque strippers lit from behind. High-back booths you can sink into and watch people go by. 

If none of that is motivation to go, here are five final words that may do it: Twenty-One Layer Chocolate Cake. 

Happy new year!!

Beer list- Awesome

Steak- tender and delicious

Service- extraordinary

Tab- somebody else picking it up, even better!

The waiters kept plying us with food and beer and wine, by the time I got to dessert, I could barely sample anything.  My steak was excellently prepared and the sauces they had for it were wonderful.

Spendy, but if you're not paying, go hog wild!

My husband and I decided to eat here on Saturday night since there was an hour wait at STK.  We didn't have to wait at all at Striphouse (which should of been a sign). A modern, adult themed steakhouse with inflated prices for slightly above average cuts of beef. Although my steak was cooked well, the quality just wasn't there and was pretty disappointed. For $49 for a 16oz NY strip, I felt as though money was wasted. With so many positive reviews of this place, I can only hope this was an "off" night for Striphouse. However, based on my first impression, I will not be returning.

On the upside, our server was very sweet and attentive. The Mac & cheese was really good and the potato pur√©e (mashed potatoes) was yum.

Came here for a Bachelor party dinner with the fellas. We had the private room reserved for our group dinner (about 20 people).

While we waited for our private room to be set up, there is a lounge bar area with couches and mini tables to hang out at while you wait or lounge and grab a drink.

The private room was great. Pros: very private room, enclosed room away from the crowd and noise. Sometimes could be too quiet if no one was talking. Cons: Away from the crowd and scene! haha The private room also had plasma mounted so you could watch any showing of your liking.  

Food:
- Ribeye: Perfect portion, very tasty and lots of flavor. Recommended
- Cream corn (sides): mediocre. I've had better.
- Mac n cheese (sides): just alright...nothing special
- Fries (sides): decent...I prefer truffle style fries 

Overall: Great ambiance and excellent host and customer service.

Once again, Open Table made reservations a breeze.  As I was seated the steak house mood was set with the dim lighting and dark/red colors of the room.  The staff was very accommodating and attentive throughout my meal.  I starte with Rye Chai cocktail which was tasty and set a good tone for the rest of the meal.  An assortment of breads started the meal with the pretzel bread standing out.  I starte with the lobster bisque which was rich and savory.  The main course was the aged prime rib done perfectly medium rare, tender and juicy with excellent flavor.  I accompanied the meat with charred broccoli and the velvety pureed mashed potatoes.  After a second Rye Chai (it was that good), I finished with a wonderful espresso cr√®me brulee for the win.  Another excellent steak house in sin city?  This one makes my list of sinfully decadent places to take care of my meat cravings.

First off let me start by saying that I am huge fan of steak! I have eaten at a variety of steakhouses in Vegas that have not disappointed. We left to Vegas with extremely high expectations of having fun and also eating at this "highly" rated steakhouse. My wife and I ate here on our last night in Vegas expecting SOOO much. I ordered the bone in rib-eye and she had the fillet. We each had the same sides of goose fat potatoes and the spinach with bacon that was a special that evening. I have to say that neither of us were impressed with the steak. About the only thing I really liked was the spinach and even that was a bit over rated. The bone in rib-eye was good but nothing to slap yo mama for. The service was really good and very attentive. They were able to accommodate us although we called for reservations late due to an extreme hangover. The decor is great and the atmosphere is also fun, even on a Wednesday night. Definitely a fun and romantic setting all in one. I was not all that impressed with the food as you have already read and I would never go back to this place again. It wasn't horrible but there are plenty of other places in Vegas that have really pleased the palate. All of the above and 1 glass of wine came out to $172.48 minus the tip of course, not to bad. Recommendation: IF you go, share the sides, it's enough for two people.

Great experience and one of the best steaks I've ever had. My wife and I ordered a couple of glasses of wine and calamari for an app. Bread was also served before the meal. She ordered the salmon and I got the 8 oz. filet along with the potatoes Romanoff. Her salmon was cooked perfectly, the potatoes were creamy and flavorful and my steak was seasoned really well. I'd say my only complaint (and it's very minor) was how my steak was cooked. I asked for medium rare and got medium. Regardless, it was delicious and tender. 

The service was top-notch. Our server was attentive without being annoying. If I had any room, I would've loved to try dessert, but we will be back for more another time!

Wow. Didn't even know about this place until a friend told me about it. I absolutely loved it. From the rolls at the beginning of the menu, to the dessert everything was excellent. One of the best filet mignons I've had.
Very friendly staff. Very nice atmosphere. I'll definitely be back!

This restaurant does not compare in any way to the other wonderful steakhouses in Las Vegas. My advice, go to Stripsteak at Mandalay Bay for a truly wonderful steak. 

The service left a lot to be desired for a restaurant with so many awards. The restaurant was practically empty. While the pace of the meal was fine, our server had an heir of arrogance that was unnerving. He was not friendly and rather inattentive. Very disappointing. 

After reading so many raving reviews, we started with the Gorgonzola fondue. I love love love garlic and have always thought you cannot put too much garlic on anything for my taste. However, there was so much garlic in the fondue, it was barely edible. I would have preferred to enjoy the Gorgonzola taste since it was Gorgonzola fondue. The garlic bread that is served with it was very tasty but drenched in butter. Again, who doesn't like butter on garlic bread? Certainly not I! But this was way too much...it made the bread soggy and greasy. 

The breads that we were served were very good. One was like a pretzel stick. 

For our entree, my husband and I had the filet. It was perfectly cooked, but not up to the quality that we expected based on the awards Strip House has received. We shared the creamed corn as a side dish. It was rather flavorless. Too much cream and not enough corn. They should rename it "heavy creamy with bits of corn". Again, a huge disappointment. 

A table nearby by ordered the daily assortment of homemade sorbets and ice cream for dessert. If I hadn't seen the table nearby order it, we would have skipped it. I am glad we didn't. It was the best part of the meal. We had raspberry sorbet and chocolate ice cream. It was served in a large toile cookie bowl that had tons of fresh blackberries, raspberries, strawberries and blueberries. They were very generous with the fruit. This made for a light, refreshing dessert. 

In summary, go to Stripsteak. We will not be visiting Strip House again.

The Decor is excellent. First of all, let's start with the waiter. John the most professional waiter I've dealt with. The pasta was awesome and my wife's Surf and turf was tasty. Then I order the Banana Tart with the Gelato. Pic is coming. Definitely coming back when I come back to Vegas.

My friends and I had a wonderful experience here at Strip House. We went for Valentines Day and were so pleased that we chose this place to dine. Billy was our server, he was extremely professional and knowledgeable about the specials and menu. Our dinner was amazing and the 24 layer chocolate cake was to die for. We will definately recommend this place to others and will be back again soon.

The restaurant is nice, the atmosphere is good but the staffs were pretty rude. When we first walked in, the guy who led us to our table was nice until we told him that we preferred the booth, he changed his attitude, walked us back out and let another guy take us in. Then our waiter wasn't really attentive until we ordered the $250 bone in rib eye wagyu. He changed completely and started chatting with us. My mom likes to have sauce to eat with her steak, they brought out some for her and charged us $3. I mean seriously we pay $400 on that bill and you gotta charge us $3 for the sauce? I mean $3 is nothing but this kind of service sucks for an expensive restaurant like this. We saw their truffle spinach on the food channel, the chef put tons of truffle in it because "its Vegas baby", but i didn't see any truffle in mine. The steak was alright, I have had better and it wasn't even wagyu. I gave 3 stars for their chocolate cake! It was heaven people! But would I come back here again, I dont think so. There are so many good steak houses on/off the strip of Las Vegas!
