John was our waiter and was fantastic, professional, courteous and had fun with our 8 year old twin girls.  The food was excellent, ambiance like a steak house should be and it was a great night to be out in Las Vegas.

Went on a thursday night so it was on the quiet side. Ordered a bottle of wine of their extensive wine list. Apparently they have a sommelier who wasn't in house at the time. Got the scallop appetizer, cooked perfectly and was delicious, but flavors weren't unique. Got the filet mignon medium rare. Again, cooked perfectly! Was a beautiful specimen! They pepper their steaks, which I normally don't like, but it was balanced and not overwhelming and didn't obstruct the flavor. 
Service was outstanding, never had an empty glass or cluttered table.

Came here for a triple date with my boyfriend, parents, and brother and his girlfriend for a post Valentine's Day dinner. 

We started with their special bacon appetizer, Rockefeller Oysters, and Salmon Cake. I was all about the bacon. Holy crap was it ridiculously good. 

For my entree, I had the special bone in filet with black truffle and parmesean and everyone else had a variety of other dishes including the NY Strip, bone in Ribeye and Lamb Chops. So... freakin... good. We shared our sides family style which was great advice from our server because we ordered six. Figured one per person... we were gluttonous. Mac and cheese, potatoes romanoff, asparagus, creamed spinach, goose fat potatoes and the GREEN BEANS. YESSSSS. (The sides are huge by the way, you don't need to order one per person) 

As if we didn't have enough ( we took dinner home), we ordered the 24 layer chocolate cake, banana tart, and creme brulee. Guess which dessert we had to box? 

Fantastic meal to a post Valentine's Day triple date. 

Ps. Blaze's Cosmo. Do it... do it.
Excellent! The best steak I ever had in Vegas and service is tip top! Had a great experience and the food was amazing, perfectly cooked Rib Eye. Highly recommend this establishment.

I came here for my birthday/new year's dinner, and it was ok.  For the price you're paying, the service is not nearly up to standard, and to be quite honest, neither was the food.  

After being left alone for a lonnggg time without bread or drinks, the server told us the specials: surf and turf with any steak you want...sweet. So I ordered filet mignon with lobster. Oh wait, the waiter says, I forgot to tell you that we're out of surf and turf. Wtf? So why did you even include that on the specials? Anyway, he offered to switch lobster for lump crab meat. Meh, ok, I'll try it.  Crab was dry and tasteless, filet was sooo dry, such a shame, I love a good steak. In fact, everyone at my table said their steak was dry. BOO

The "fondue" appetizer wasn't really fondue but it was still tasty, tuna tartare was delicious, creamed truffle spinach was rich and delicious, and their famous chocolate cake was pretty bomb also. But hey, if you're going to pride yourself on being a steakhouse, you better make sure it's perfect.  And the server could class it up a little, it's not outback steakhouse, brah.

I was there with my girlfriend to celebrate our 25 years together and her birthday. Everything was perfect. The food was delicious, Scott took great care of us and the ambiance (both the decor and music) was just fabulous. And since it was my gf birthday, we had to try their famous chocolate layers cake which was up to our high expectations!! Great dinner and thanks to Scott.

This was the most phenomenal meal I have ever had. The atmosphere is relaxing and classy, with such a unique vintage feel. Scott, my waiter, instantly made me feel at home and less awkward about being alone. My hibiscus cooler was a delicious cocktail. I had the best filet mignon and lobster duo with the potatoes romanoff, which is a twice baked au gratin. My dessert, a rocky road ice cream with marshmallow and salted caramel Rice Krispie was a decadent finish to my perfect meal! Thank you for making such a fun, classy, solo Vegas dinner! I can't wait to bring my family in October!

I've been wanting to go to Strip House for years. I have no idea why it's taken me so long to finally make it happen. My experience last night (11/14) far exceeded my expectations. 

The d√©cor right down to the sillouettes of naked ladies on the napkins more than satisfied my pin-up fetish. I expected the floors to be plush red carpet as well and was surprised to see small tiles. At first I was concerned about noise. (The Palm at Ceasars has a tiled floor and gets ridiculously loud when it's full.) However, the sound level was perfect. Not sure how they did it--perhaps the velvet in the wallpaper was sufficient to absorb the sound. 

I was also pleasantly surprised to see how busy it was. In fact, Planet Hollywood in general was totally jamming. Wonderful sight!!

The service was impeccable: never rushed, thoughtful, and thorough without being intrusive. And the food was outstanding. I mostly eat a raw vegan diet when I am on my own. And everyonce in a while, on special occasions, I go overboard. Last night was that night and I was lucky enough to have the best lamb chop I've ever tasted. Extraordinary. The beet salad was beautiful. And my chocolate ice cream filled, hot fudge drenched, pastry puff was scrumptious, simple, and somehow was not overly sweet. Again, perfect.  

My companions loved their steaks and all agreed on the excellent service. The winelist was consistent and well suited. Yay! for my favorite: Duckhorn Merlot. I can't wait to go big again.

Decadence in perfect balance.

It was high time we returned here, so we finally did, with friends in tow.  The dinner was almost as fine as before--but not quite.

Brown Bread with fruit inside it was excellent, and golden Calamari Fritti was great with a fine Remoulade Sauce.  And a Shrimp Cocktail with Horseradishy Cocktail Sauce featured 4 large and delectable shrimp.  But the Caesar Dressing on my Caesar Salad was far too weak--like a light oil that at best contained only a hint of traditional Caesar flavor.  

Lobster Bisque with couscous and cream was velvety and excellent.  A medium-rare 6 oz. Filet as part of a Surf & Turf pairing was very good, although so laden with peppercorns that I knocked 2/3 of them off.  But Goose Fat Potatoes were perfectly crisp, and Potatoes Romanof were creamy and great.  

There was one notable service error.  Our server initially brought 2 orders of mixed sauteed Wild Mushrooms to the table instead of 1 plus the Potatoes Romanof.  The error was fairly quickly resolved.  Both Bearnaise and Bordelaise Sauces were quite well prepared.

Overall, a fine 4-1/2 star meal!

Visited the Strip House during a visit to LV last week (4/7/11). Came later in the evening (930ish) and restaurant was pretty empty. My friend and I felt a little under dressed, but did notice other seated parties dressed similarly. The restaurant itself is quite cozy...dark and sexy B/W photos on the walls, with some larger ones back lit with red light. The food was decent, but a medium-well fillet should have some pink and not be charred quite that much. All sides are Ala carte and as stated in other reviews, quite potatoe-centric. The service was the sticking point with me though. Sullen waiter who just repeated out the specials and then zoomed off, appetizers delivered (or tossed) on the table and no real customer service given. For the price of the bill ($200+), I would expect a little more respect for the patrons.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here last night. The staff was amazing, food ok but the big brown water bug/cock roaches I could have done without. We watched one go completely across the dining room floor and then again in the bathroom. I couldn't eat thinking what must be back in the kitchen. I didn't say anything last night so as not to alarm any guests but EWW. They have to know these huge nasty bugs are in this restaurant as we were there only 2 hours!!

Cool vibe: dark interiors with vintage photos of pin-ups on the wall.

We dined here with a large party (25 guests) and had an amazing dinner.  One of the guests at our table got the half order of the seafood plateau.  It's an impressive looking dish and crammed with seafood and shellfish served on crushed ice.  I was totally loving the bread basket (lots of variety, all very tasty) since I'm not a huge creepy crawly seafood person.

I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass for my main.  Seriously, one of the best fish dinners I've ever had, and I live on Maui.  I eat and serve fish for a living.  The Sea Bass was served on a bed of Jalapeno Potato Puree with a red wine sauce.  It was so delicious that I only gave my boyfriend a single bite.  I usually am much more generous in giving him tastes from my plate, but not with this dish!  He ordered one of the many specials offered: the dry aged ribeye.  It was a tad overcooked, but still incredibly juicy with a killer rub.  

All steaks were served a la carte (minus the bulb of roasted garlic on the side of every steak--such a great idea and oh so delicious.  I had to school the table on how to remove the garlic cloves and spread them on each bite of steak, or eat them on their own if you're a garlic lover like me), so we ordered a few things for the table: the signature Strip House Potatoes (twice baked potato gratin), steamed asparagus with Bearnaise Sauce, and Mac & Cheese.  Do yourself a BIG, BIG favor and order those potatoes.  AH-MAY-ZING.  To die for.  Mouth watering. I wish I had some right now.

My first night in Las Vegas last week started at the Strip House Steak House. Mark helped us at the bar and was great, my dirty martini was excellent. We had a party of 22, so we had a pre-fixe dinner.

I started with the caprese salad with buffalo mozzarella and then moved to the iceberg lettuce salad with crumbled bacon. Both were equally good. The 10 oz. filet mignon was good, not outstanding, but it was fairly good. I certainly didn't need all 10 ounces. However, the mashed potatoes were outstanding.

We ended the night with the Strip House chocolate cake with 24 layers of chocolate. This huge piece of cake was a bit difficult to split with coworkers - it would have been easier to split with friends. However, it was delicious and paired nicely with the red wine I was finishing.

WOW! We were disappointed that our choices of lobster and oysters were sold out after CES week but they sure made up for it. Food was spectacular, well portioned and beautifully cooked. Brett was our server and he was excellent and took time to speak about the pride he has in the restaurant. 2 of our party only eat fish and they said it was the best seafood they have ever tasted and ethically sourced! The smell of the mushrooms was divine and the whipped potatoes were heavenly. The bountiful crab and shrimp appetizer was the luscious and sinful. Awesome, homemade cocktail sauce. They stand by their product as they should because their distributor is top notch. I cannot wait to go here again and I would definitely recommend it as one of LV's hidden gems.

While I was skeptical at first, I am very satisfied and impressed with my visit Strip House. The ambiance is very nice, semi-dark with a low-key feel away from a lot of noise.

The food was excellent, from the shrimp cocktail to the entree through dessert, everything hit the right mark. My girlfriend and I both had the filet (sans-bone) and the preparation was great.

Per recommendation from our very attentive waiter (John), we decided on the Caramelized Banana Tart for dessert and it was delicious.

I've dined at several Vegas steak houses and Strip House ranks at the same level of the greats!

This place was so delicious! I loved the ambience and the decor! Which totally added to the food! The staff was great! And I liked how everyone was helpful and wanted us to have a great time! 
Had their Moscow mule and aged martini! Both cocktails were exactly what I wanted. And the bartender was great and gave my extra dirty on the side for my martini! 
The bread they give you was yummy! 
We ordered the steak for two, wild mushrooms and twice baked potatoes!!  We walked in super hungry and walked out beyond happily stuffed!! Everything was perfect! The steak was cooked exactly how we like it! And the blue cheese sauce was amazing!!! Sadly I was way to stuffed to try their layered chocolate cake. But I plan to make a visit back if I ever end up in Vegas again, and will totally save room for dessert!
